loans.name: Azimdjon

texts.ru:
Женат и отец троих детей, Азимджон родился 9 сентября 1977 года. Являясь жителем региона, где животноводство является основным видом деятельности, Азимджон занимается продажей крупного рогатого скота с 2004 года. Он покупает их от фермеров, которые откармливают их, а затем продает их на рынке. Так как и его капитал ограниченный, он покупает всего лишь пару скотов, а затем после того как он продает их он возвращается, чтобы купить больше. Азимджон хотел бы расширить свой бизнес за счет увеличения своего капитала, чтобы максимизировать свой прибыль. По этой причине, он запрашивает займ для покупки молодняка крупного рогатого скота. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Married and the father of three, Azimdjon was born on September 9, 1977.  Living in a region where raising farm animals is the main line of work, Azimjon has been selling cattle from 2004. He buys cattle from farmers who raise them, for resale at the market. Since his capital is limited, he buys only a couple of heads of cattle, and after selling them, he returns to buy more. Azimjon would like to expand his business by increasing his working capital and maximizing his profit. This is why he is requesting  a loan to buy  young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle with the goal of expanding his business

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 13 children. Bebiana has a shop where she sells canned goods, breads, biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for 10 years.

Bebiana has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, detergents and snacks. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bebiana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents and snacks

loans.name: Mrina

texts.en:
Mrina is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbours. He faces a major challenge of high competition from other charcoal sellers in the area. Mrina dreams of expanding his business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kaay Bakh 3 Group

texts.fr: Kaay Bakh 3 est un groupe  de 5 membres qui s’activent  dans le commerce  de poissons, de légumes, de et de produits détergents. Elles habitent dans la même localité  et sont représentées par madame Salma (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elle s’active énergiquement  dans la vente de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans. Sa journée de travaille  commence le mati a 6 h 30mn jusqu'à 16 heures dans l’après midi. Son objectif est de renforcer la quantité de poissons  qu’elle offre a sa clientèle  face a une augmentation croissante de la demande. Le groupe sollicite un crédit de 550 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons , de légumes et de détergents  destinés a développer d’avantage les activités respectives des différents membres du groupe.
texts.en: Kaay Bakh 3 is a group composed of 5 members who are active in the sale of fish, vegetables, and detergent products.  They all live near each other and are represented by Madame Salma (the one who has her hand raised in the photo).  She has been very dedicated to her business of selling fish for 10 years.  Her workday starts at 6:30 am and goes until 4:00 pm.  Her goal is to increase the quantity of fish to offer her customers to meet the growing demand.  The group is requesting a loan of 550,000 francs to buy fish, vegetables, and detergents which will help to develop further the respective businesses of the different members of the group.

loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, and detergent products to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Micheal is married and blessed with three children. For the last three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to support the family. He also practices dairy farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to become more financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access a loan credit facility.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mohamad Khayr

texts.en: Mohamad is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man living with his mother. He started to work as a freelance home electrician and has been doing so for the past 10 years. With his requested loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to purchase new electricA. gear and tackle. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year. In the future, he plans to expand his business operation into wider areas and villages.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical gear and tackle.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 41-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and she is a mother of six children. She makes pastries from home and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase a new oven which will help her increase her quantities.

Eman started her business by making pastries only for her neighbours and the nearby schools; then she start receiving orders from other areas.

Eman is looking to increase her business volume and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven for her business.

loans.name: Mahoni Kasih Group

texts.en:
Sri is 39 years old and married with two children, Yulianti and Daniel.  She is pictured in the photo above wearing the black shirt.  Yulianti is 13 years old and is in the 7th grade.  Daniel is 12 years old and is in 6th grade.  Her husband works as a driver.  

Sri has been selling dishes from her food stall for the last year.  The business runs smoothly and has been going quite well because there is not a lot of competition in her area.  The income helps ensure that the children's needs for school such as fees and uniforms can be met.

This is Sri's second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to increase the ingredients at her food stall by purchasing items such as pop ice, coffee, noodles, and rice.  This will help her have more variety in her stall to hopefully draw more customers.  She hopes that their family will continue to have enough money to pay for their children's education so that when they grow up they can have a better life.

The other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling vegetables, selling cakes, selling household appliances on credit, and selling slippers, umbrellas, and shoes on credit.

loans.use: to pay for more food such as pop ice, coffee, noodles, and rice to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Reiner

texts.es:
El señor Reiner tiene 55 años de edad, es casado con un hijo.

Reiner actualmente vive solo con su esposa, desde muy pequeño comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su papá, luego trabajo como jornalero con un vecino y desde unos 25 años se dedica a sembrar maíz y fríjol. Además de trabajar en la agricultura Reiner presta sus servios como vigilante privado en un negocio por las noches. Cuando sale del trabajo en la noche se dirige a realizar sus trabajos en la agricultura, aborda un bus que tarda veinte minutos y luego viaja por treinta minutos en la palangana de un vehiculo hasta llegar al cantón donde tiene sus cultivos y camina veinticinco minutos a pie y llega a realizar sus trabajos agrícolas. Mas tarde regresa a su casa a comer y a las 4:00 p.m. vuelve a su trabajo de vigilante.

Él compra los productos agrícolas en una ciudad y luego los traslada en un vehiculo al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos. Reiner solicita el préstamo para pagar la mano de obra para recolectar el maíz y el fríjol y para comprar 3 cerdos para engorde. 

Con esto él recolectara su cosecha a tiempo y aprovechara el precio, ya que se esta pasando la recolección del fríjol y no tiene para pagar quien  le ayude. Reiner manifiesta que ahorrara para que cuando él ya no pueda trabajar, tenga para el sustento de su familia y también quiere construir una casa ya que viven donde su suegro.
texts.en:
Reiner is 55 years old, married, and has one son.

Reiner currently lives only with his wife.  He started working in farming with his father at a very young age.  Later, he worked as a day laborer with a friend and, from the age of 25, has dedicated himself to growing corn and beans.  In addition to working in farming, Reiner lends his services as a night watchman for a business.  When he leaves his evening job, he goes to manage his farming activities.  He boards a bus that takes 20 minutes, and then travels for 30 minutes in a vehicle to reach the canton where he has his crops.  He walks on foot for another twenty-five minutes to be able to carry out his farming work.  Later, he goes home to eat and, at 4:00 pm, returns to his night job.

He buys his farming products in a city and later transfers them in a vehicle to the place where he has his crops.  Reiner requests this loan to pay for the manual labor to harvest his corn and beans, and to buy 3 pigs to fatten.

With these funds, he will be able to harvest in time and take advantage of the prices.  The time to collect his beans is passing, and he doesn’t have the money to pay for help.  Reiner states that he will save for when he can no longer work, to care for his family, and he also wants to build a house as they currently live with his father-in-law.

loans.use: pay for the manual labor to harvest his corn and beans, and to buy 3 pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Mariana Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña María de 55 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de León, casada, de oficio comerciante, no tiene hijos debido a los tratamientos a los cuales estuvo sometida para eliminar quistes que le aparecieron  en la matriz, es una mujer fuerte y luchadora que no se dio por vencida por ganarle la batalla al cáncer. Ella  se dedica a la venta y elaboración negocio que heredo de su mama hace 22 años, también es dueña de una pulpería que puso hace 12 años donde comercializa productos de consumo para el hogar y ropa.
Ella realizo el préstamo  comprar ropa, gaseosas y maíz, papas, carne, vegetales para realizar sus deliciosos nacatamales. Pues se acerca la época navideña donde las ventas son muy buenas y quiere tener de todo producto para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella desea progresar su negocio ampliar su pulpería con productos de  gran necesidad en su zona.
texts.en:
Doña María is 55 years old and lives in the city of Leon. She is married, a businesswoman by trade and without children because of the treatmentst she was subjected to for cysts in the womb. She a strong and determined woman who never gave up in her fight against cancer. She sells and makes tamales, a business she inherited from her mother 22 years ago. She also owns a grocery store which she set up 12 years ago where she sells consumer products for the home and clothing.

She took the loan to purchase clothing, soft drinks, corn, potatoes, meat, vegetables to make her delicious tamales, as the Christmas season is approaching which is when sales are very good and she wants to have all kinds of products to offer her customers. She wants to grow her business, expand her grocery store with products of great need for her area.

loans.use: to buy clothes, soft drinks and corn, potatoes, meat, vegetables to make her delicious tamales.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is 23 years old and single.  To earn a living, he does motorbike transport business.  He has been in the business for two years.  Besides, he practices dairy farming.  He has grown his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has helped him to improve his living standards.
Evanson has requested for a loan of 20, 000 Kenya shillings to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Mujeres La Esperanza se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que a la Sra.Guillermina, quien contacto con una de las asesoras y de esa forma se informo y logro juntar a 13 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa de la fundación.
Guillermina, está casada, tiene 3 hijos. Nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser sandwish, empanadas, croquetas y demás, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha podido tener ya una clientela bien definida. Cuenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas del dia para preparar los alimentos que vende y de esa forma darle a sus clientes productos de primera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, hortalizas, jamón, queso y demás insumos indispensables para elaborar los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women is called "Mujeres La Esperanza." Its members live in the city of Ita.  The communal bank was started thanks to Guillermina, who contacted one of the advisors, and that way informed herself. She succeeded in bringing together 13 women, who are working very happily in the Foundation's program. 

She tell us that she sells foodstuffs of all kinds, such as sandwiches, empanadas, croquettes, and other things. It's going very well, since thanks to the good quality of her products, she has a well-established base of customers already.

She says that she gets up every day at a very early hour of the day to prepare the food she sells, and so provide her customers with first class products.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy meats, vegetables, ham, cheese and other indispensable ingredients for making the food that she sells.

loans.use: To buy meats, vegetables, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 56 years old and is a married woman with 7 children. She has been a farmer for 20 years. She tills the land with her husband in their town of Trinidad, Bohol. Rice is the primary crop that they grow to sell. Josefa works hard to improve their family income. Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes this loan will help them achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Concepción, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ; ya que ellos tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condición es de vida y apoyar en sus estudios a sus hijos , don Concepción desde hace muchos años  trabaja en una empresa privada , pero no cuenta con el suficiente sueldo para ir mejorando su humilde vivienda , ya que el solicita el apoyo de Afodenic atravez de los fondos kiva para realizar un anexo de un pequeño cuarto para una de hijas, para que goce de privacidad siendo adolecente y necesita de su propio espacio , ya que donde actualmente duermen están todos en el mismo cuarto .Agradece mucho estos programas que para personas de escasos recursos le cambian la vida poco a poco .
texts.en:
Concepción lives with his wife in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She has a small business in order to help him with the household expenses, as they have children in their care. Their plan is to improve their family's living conditions, and support their children with their education. 

Concepción has been working at a private company for many years, but he doesn't earn enough salary to keep improving his modest home. 

So he is applying for support from Afodenic through Kiva funding, to undertake the addition of a small room for one of his daughters, so that she can enjoy privacy. She is a teenager, and needs her own space; as where they currently sleep, everyone is in the same room. 

He is very thankful for these programs, which change life little by little for people with limited resources.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bread for resale.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor was born in 1972 year. She is divorced and has 2 children. She is only feed keeper of her children. She works more than 3 years in a local hospital as a cleaning woman. She is kind and hardworking woman. She is one of the best workers who make her job well. Gulbahor works from 7 o’clock till 5 o’clock. She is ill now. She must to buy medicines for her treatment but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy medicines. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative microfinance group.  She has 5 children and manages rice farmland in Dumingag in the Philippines.  She cultivates the piece of land to support her family. 

She has obtained her 4th loan through the cooperative to pay for land preparation and buy sacks of fertilizers. 

In the future, Editha hopes to own a water pump to easily soften the tillage pan and supply enough of water on her rice farmland.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and buy sacks of fertilizers to obtain more produce and save for a water pump.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria de los Angeles is a 54 year old woman. She is a widow and she's enjoyed selling since she was young. She started her small business since 2000, and at the present time, she receives support from her son and her daughter. They live with her because María de los Angeles has cataracts in both eyes and she cannot see very well and so she requires their love and support. She sets up a stand in different local markets and people prefer to visit her because she always has fancy merchandise.

She is requesting a loan for $925 USD to pay back in a term of 6-12 months. She will use this to buy a greater quantity of clothes for a lower cost and she will prepare for the next season when she hopes her sales will increase.

ESPAÑOL

Maria de los Angeles es una mujer de 54 años, viuda, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a vender diferentes cosas. Ella inició su pequeño negocio a partir del 2000 y en la actualidad le ayuda uno de sus hijos y su nuera que viven con ella, ya que debido a que esta enferma de sus ojos (tiene cataratas en ambos) no puede ver muy bien y requiere de su apoyo. Acostumbra poner su puesto en varios mercados rodantes en zonas muy populares, en donde la gente la prefiere pues siempre trata de tener una variedad de mercancías del gusto popular.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo por $925 USD para comprar ropa en mayor cantidad y a un menor costo y prepararse para la nueva temporada en que se incrementan sus ventas. Piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and notions

loans.name: Etiram

texts.en:
Etiram was born in 1979 in Jabrail region of Azerbaijan. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He is single man. At the beginning of his business he bought grocery goods. Having borrowed the loan $700 he has opened the computer game hall. Now his computers are old. 
Etiram applies for the loan $1100 to buy 2 new computers.

loans.use: To buy 2 new computers

loans.name: Salaevalu

texts.en: Salaevalu is married with eight children.  In order to support her family, she makes hand-printed fabrics that are sold in local flea market stalls.  Making hand-printed fabrics takes time, patience and precision.  Salaevalu works hard to make her fabrics special, and her designs are artistic and individualized, and so they sell well.  The hand-printed fabrics are bought by seamstresses to make clothing or else are bought to be worn as sarongs (locally referred to as “lava lava”) by men and women alike.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina has a small kiosk at the Rushki Market in Melitopol where she sells a beautiful array of dishware and small souvenir items. She has been in business for thirteen years now. The income she makes has been a very important source of provision for her and her husband, Sergei, as they have raised their two daughters. Irina is able to provide financial help to her parents as well. Irina has a reputation as a goal-oriented, polite, and hard-working business owner. She had a serious surgery not long ago, but she continues to work and develop her business. In the future, she hopes to open a new sales location which would dramatically increase the size of her venture. Irina has requested a short term loan of $500 to give her some additional working capital to buy necessary inventory.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar R. is a 27-year-old farmer with two cows who sells dairy products to traders who, in turn, sell them in a nearby bazaar. He lives in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar, where he relocated after fleeing Nagorniy Karabakh during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He is married and has two children.

Khanlar has been selling dairy products, including milk, butter and yogurt, for five years. He started his business with money his parents saved for him. He began with one calf, which is now a full-grown cow. This cow has produced enough dairy products to allow him to buy a second cow. Khanlar would like to continue to expand his business because dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan -- particularly in Baku, the capital, whose traders come Bilasuvar to purchase dairy products.

To meet his goal, Khanlar has come to us for a loan to buy one milk cow and two calves. He estimates that one cow will cost $700-800, and the calves will cost $200-250 each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia is 41 years of age and married with 4 children. Her husband is unemployed, but he has a small farm. He is a very hard working man who always puts his family first.

The family earns income from their garden. Therefore, Valelia would like a oan to buy equipment for the garden. Through the years of hard work, the family has been able to save and live where they are now. This will be Valelia's 4th loan with SPBD. She is very thankful for this opportunity, which helps her to develop her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Cherkez

texts.en: Cherkez S. is 39 year old  farmer who sells sheep for meat production. He is married, has 2 children and lives in the Saatli region. He has 8 years of experience in raising and selling sheep. The main  purchasers are local people, who purchase mutton for wedding parties and for holiday meals, and local bazaar traders. Breeding sheep is the only  financial source for his family and it is very hard to keep his family in good condition and to cover all their needs. He has applied for 1200 USD  to add to his farm livestock. This amount is for purchasing 10 additional sheep and two calves. The estimated price for one sheep is 60 USD and for one calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and two calves

loans.name: Gie Bana-Bana Group

texts.fr:
The members of the group calling itself BANA-BANA intend to innovate in the field of distribution of goods and managing of sales points. We intend to divide the responsibilities fairly, taking into account the fact that each of us is a member of the eco-village. The disbursal of local products is to be assured using using a pick-up truck, and we will see to the sale of the various much-needed goods in the marketplaces of the commune of Diourbel and the area surrounding it. Our group intends to put into place a chain of little corner grocery stores, thereby creating work for each of us.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupement BANABANA ont innovés la distribution et la prestation de services avec un moyen de transport (camionnette) et surtout l’équilibre des charges en tenant compte de la qualité de membre de l’éco village du commerçant. La circulation des produits locaux est assurée grâce au véhicule fonctionnel. La chaîne de commercialisation des divers produits demandés dans les marchés de la commune de DIOURBEL et de la région. Le groupement envisage de mettre en place une chaîne de petites boutiques de quartier et créer des emplois pour chaque unité.

loans.use:
Fairly managed businesses in wholesale distribution and retailing

Commerce équitable

loans.name: Nisida

texts.es:
Mrs. Nisida belongs to the communal bank of democratic women. She lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, and in the district of Juanjui. She works buying and selling chickens, and the business is located in the forth block of La Prolongación Grau.

With a loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian Soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy chickens. She buys chickens daily, which means she will invests some of the money each day. She will also build more cages for the chickens.

Mrs. Nisida is 42 years of age. She lives with her husband and three children. As a family they work hard to support themselves, sacrificing other needs, but little by little they are seeing the results to their hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Nisida pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Democráticas. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y el negocio está ubicado en la Prolongación Grau cuadra 04.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gallinas, pero sus compras lo hace diariamente, eso quiere decir que invierte a diario, además construirá más jaulas para tener gallinas.

La señora Nisida tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos y como familia trabajan duro para salir adelante sacrificando otras necesidades, pero poco a poco están viendo los resultados.

loans.use: Purchase small animals (chickens)

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa has been a member of the community bank “Compartir” for four years. Nicolasa is from the small town of Compañia, which is located one hour away from the city of Ayacucho.

Nicolasa is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and her four year old daughter. Nicolasa grows potatoes and corn, which she sells at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. She also resells other fruits and vegetables that she buys from farmers in the area. Since joining the community bank Nicolasa and her husband have been able to purchase the car that they use to transport their goods. In addition, Nicolasa buys tuna, a regional fruit that comes from a cactus, and takes it to Lima to sell.

Nicolasa needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she would invest in tuna and vegetables.

Nicolasa plans to use her profits to buy a bigger car and to build a home. Her dream is to grow her business, own a sturdy home, and that her daughter will become as successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To invest in tuna and vegetables.

loans.name: Thi Chien's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Chiến, 48 years old, is married with three school age children. They have a pet food shop. She also raises some livestock for extra income. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for her livestock. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lê Thị Nga applies for a loan to buy scrap metal and feed for pigs.
  • C. Thị Luân applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Thuý applies for a loan to buy piglets.
  • Ngô Thị Thư applies for a loan to buy feed for her livestock.
  • Nguyễn Thị Liễu applies for a loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Chiến năm nay 48 tuổi. Chị có chồng và ba con đang đi học. Anh chị mở một cửa hàng bán thức ăn cho gia súc phục vụ nhân dân quanh vùng. N.ài ra chị cũng chăn nuôi lợn để góp phần tạo thu nhập nuôi các con ăn học. chị vay 2006000 đồng để chị mua thêm lợn giống về nuôi. Chị rất muốn được tham gia chương trình mãi mãi. Trong nhóm gồm có các chị: Lê Thị Nga vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám cho lợn và một phần thêm vốn đi chợ sắt vụn hàng ngày. Chị C. Thị Luân vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn cho gà, lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý vay 2006000 đồng để mua lợn giống. Chị Ngô Thị Thư vay 2006000 đồng để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liễu vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
For 12 years Ana Victoria has run her small grocery store. This has been the only income to support her humble household and her two small children that she loves so much.

She started her business with very few resources and products and over the years she has been able to improve her sales. Regardless, she still has many needs for her business. Ana Victoria now urgently needs to purchase merchandise and for this reason has gone to Ceprodel to take out a loan to purchase products and thus continue to fight to improve her financial situation through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La dama Ana Victoria desde hace 12 años se ha desempeñado en su pequeño negocio de pulpería, único ingreso para el sustento de su humilde casa de habitación y de sus dos pequeños hijos a los que tanto ama.

El negocio inició con pocos recursos y productos, a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo, ella ha logrado mejorar en parte sus ventas, sin embargo aun atraviesa fuertes necesidades en su negocio. Hoy en día la señora Ana Victoria posee la necesidad de la urgente compra de la mercadería y para ello acude Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le de la oportunidad de adquirir estos productos y así seguir luchando para mejorar su condición económica por medio de estos prestamos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Pamela Nabuuma’S Group

texts.en:
Pamela N. lives in the Rubaga Division of Kampala. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children, ages 6, 4, and 2. For the past four years she has been selling charcoal, thanks to an initial loan from MCDT. She buys sacks of charcoal from villagers for 18,000/= (Ugandan shillings, about $10 US) and sells it in much smaller amounts, starting at 500/= (about 30 cents). Ultimately, she makes a profit of about 7,000/= per sack (about $4).

She rents a stand in Kibuye where she sells her charcoal. Sometimes it is difficult because people ask for charcoal on credit and don’t pay her back, or people try to con her or steal her things.

With a new loan, she would like to start another retail business selling items used daily in the home, such as salt, sugar, rice, and cooking oil. With this expanded inventory, she will be able to earn a regular income. Her ultimate goal is to construct a house in the Wakiso district.

Pamela has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To open a shop selling essential commodities

loans.name: Julia Arlita

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia Arlita S. S. belongs to the interim credit group "28 de Julio" (July 28th), and lives in San Martín in the Tarapoto district. She dedicates herself to selling typical foods of the area and grilled meats. She earns her living at a sales stand in the Marina Aguilar Avenue in the same city. Her customers are residents of the community and visitors from nearby areas, as this street is very well known and traveled.

She is originally from the city of Trujillo, but currently lives in the city, performing this enjoyable role. She sells grilled chicken, beef, and pork, and also prepares typical dishes of the area such as dried meat with potato rolls, and various dishes wrapped in steamed banana leaves called juanes. Thanks to the loan she received, she is able to expand her business, and she is content.

With this loan for $350, which will be returned after 4 months, she will buy necessary ingredients to prepare her various typical dishes, such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, condiments, and so on. She will also buy meats such as beef, chicken, and cubed pork daily so she can prepare a variety of meals to the delight of her customers and others who visit her.

Julia is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 28 years. She is already a succesful woman, and has dreams of getting ahead to forge herself a better future so she can provide her young children with a better education, and like every woman, she dreams of having her own store so her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Julia Arlita S. S., pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ”28 de Julio”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica al la venta de comida típicas de la región y carnes a la parrilla, su negocio lo realiza en su puesto de ventas ubicado en la Alameda Marina Aguilar en esta misma Ciudad, sus clientes son moradores de la propia localidad y visitantes de lugares cercanos, en vista de que esta alameda es muy conocida y concurrida. Ella es natural de la Ciudad de Trujillo, pero actualmente vive en esta ciudad, desempeñándose en esta actividad que le agrada mucho, vende asados de pollo, carne de res y cerdo, además de preparar conocidos platos típicos de la región como la cecina con tacacho, juanes, ninajuanes, avispajuanes, etc. gracias al apoyo del préstamo que le brindaron ahora ella incrementó su negocio y se siente contenta. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 que lo devolverá en un plazo de 4 meses, con lo que comprará insumos necesarios para la preparación de los variados platos típicos que ella misma lo prepara como, arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, condimentos, etc, además compra todos los días, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo en kilos, que le permitirá preparar las diversas comidas para el deleite de sus clientes y personas que la visitan. Julia es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 28 años, ya es una mujer triunfadora y con ganas de seguir adelante quiere forjarse un futuro mejor para ofrecerles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos y como toda mujer sueña contar con un local propio para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale ingredients for her food sales

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is single woman. She has a house keeping and retail business. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
39-year-old Riziki has been selling bedsheets and juice since 2002. She works at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki now requests a loan to buy more bedsheets and juice for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and juice for her business.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.es:
La señora Amabel M. Vásquez tiene treintaiocho años de edad y vive en  barrio Los Pinos distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa pero no pudo continuar estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo económico de sus padres, pues en ese tiempo había que ir a continuar estudios en otro lugar porque en su distrito solamente había primaria.
Se casó muy joven con Carlos Haro con  el que tienen cinco hijos, una hija ya es casada y sus cuatro hijos son todavía estudiantes.
Su negocio consiste en la compra venta de trigo, cebada, chocho y menestras de la estación, lo realiza en su misma casa.
Con el primer préstamo que le dio Manuela Ramos que fue de 300 soles, compró trigo, cebada y chocho o tarwi como se conoce comúnmente. Su préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/ 300 soles con lo que comprará trigo y chocho o tarwi.  Este préstamo será cancelado en cuatro meses.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas, es una socia muy activa y manifiesta que lo que más le gusta de los Bancos de Manuela Ramos son las reuniones porque se tratan temas de género.
Sueña y añora con una casa propia y que sus hijos lleguen a ser felices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amabel M. Vásquez is a 38-year-old-woman who lives in the Los Pinos neighborhood of the Mache district in the Otuzco province, department of La Libertatd Perú. She completed elementary school but was unable to continue her studies due to a lack of financial support from her parents. At that time, she had to continue her studies outside her district because they only had an elementary school there. She married Carlos Haro, with whom she has 5 children, at a young age. One of her daughters is married, while her other four children are still in school. Her business consists of buying and selling grains such as wheat, barley, Andean lupin beans, and seasonal legumes from her own home. She was able to purchase wheat, barley, and Andean lupin beans—commonly known as “tarwi”—with the first loan of 300 PEN that she obtained from Manuela Ramos. Her loan was repaid in 4 months. With this loan of 300 PEN, she will purchase wheat and lupin beans. The loan will be repaid in 4 months. She is a member of the Progresistas (Progressives) microfinance institute. She is an active member, stating that what she likes most about the Manuel Ramos institutes are the meetings because they are about relevant topics. She dreams of owning her own home and making her children happy.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale grains

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Seven years ago Ludmila found her niche at the Covered Market in Zaporozhye when she opened her small business selling seeds, plant protection chemicals, footwear, shoe care items, etc. Over the years Ludmila has acquired solid experience selling retail products. Through her determination and hard work she has been able to build a loyal customer base, which is not a small feat considering she has many competitors. Ludmila's business has led to a stable profit of $600 a month from more than $2,000 of invested inventory.  

Today, Ludmila is asking for a loan of 3000 Grivnas, $575, to help increase her working capital. She understands that new selections will help her satisfy the needs of her customers. Her goal is to see each customer leave with what they like and need. Ludmila is excited about the opportunity to see her business grow and change. She is also very delighted to earn additional funds so that she will be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase working capital for winter season

loans.name: 40- Quãng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
Chị N. Thị Tú, năm nay chị 54 tuổi. Hiện nay chị đang sinh sống tại thôn ba xã Quãng Hưng TP Thanh Hoá. Trước đây 2 con của chị đi học, chồng chị lại không có việc làm, chỉ sống dựa vào hai sào ruộng. Bây giờ gia đình chị đã dần khá lên , chị đã mở được của hàng thú y tại nhà cho chồng chị. Các chu kỳ vay trước chị đã sử dụng vốn vay của Quỹ để mua gà con  và lợn giống  khi làm ăn có lãi nay chị tiếp tục vay mức vốn là 1.626.900 VND để tiếp tục phát triển chăn nuôi và đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng dịch vụ thú y tại nhà                                     
Các thanh viên trong nhóm của chị cùng coa cùng mức vay gồm:
Chị N. Thị M. vay vốn để mua rau muống, rau cải...để bán lại.
Chị N. Thị Chiêu vay vốn để chăn nuôi gà, vịt 
Chị B. Thị Thắm vay vốn để mở rộng cửa hàng may mặc gia công
Chị P. Thị Tình vay vốn để mua phân và rau giống
Chị P. Thị Huyền vay vốn để làm nem chua, một loại thực phẩm đặc sản của Thanh Hoá

loans.use: Phân bón, gà, vịt, thức ăn gia súc, rau ...

loans.name: Merida B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Merida N. from Kyela. She is married with three children between the ages of one and eight years old. She has been running a crops-selling business since 2006. She buys rice and cocoa from farmers and sell them in the market at higher price. She works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Merida currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more rice and cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Merida thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Idrissou

texts.fr: Mr Idrissou M. est célibataire née le 10 Avril 1974 et réside actuellement à Agoè Asiyéyé dans la banlieue Nord de Lomé où il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale qui marche très bien. Il souhaite augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir disposer suffisamment de moyens financiers pour faire face à la demande sans cesse de ses clients. Pour y arriver, il sollicite un financement. Cet apport financier va sûrement doper son commerce et augmenter considérablement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Idrissou M. was born on April 10, 1974 and is unmarried. He currently resides in Agoè Asiyéyé in the Nord suburb of Lomé, where he manages a grocery store that is doing very well. He would like to increase his working capital in order to have sufficient financial means for addressing the ever-present demands of his customers. To achieve this, he is requesting financing. This financial provision is surely going to boost his business and to increase his income considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with merchanise

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng T., of Kompong Cham Province, was born in 1966 and is the mother of six children, all of whom are single. To help meet the family's food needs, two of her children are employed, one as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City and the other as a factory staff member.

Leng, a rice farmer who also owns a rice extraction machine, makes around $6 each day. Her husband, Mr. Phon, 44, works with her in the business. Unfortunately her rice extraction machine is broken, so Leng is requesting a $500 loan to repair it.

loans.use: To repair her rice extraction machine

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Group

texts.en:
Mwanajuma has been an egg seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to Tujisaidie Group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 80. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more eggs for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for future use, and pay school fees for her child.

Mwanajuma is 35 years old, married, and has one child, age 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Salma, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for her business

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 35-year-old divorced woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh with her daughter. Houda has been doing tattoos since 2002, and has been doing eyebrows for a year. Houda requested a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her tattoos. This is her fourth loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

Her previous loans helped her purchase what she needed for her work, and with them she was able to meet her family’s needs. Houda is a specialist in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. Houda decided to start her business after she got divorced, because she had to depend on herself. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase tools for her tattoo business.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mr. Yon Y. is 48 years old and he lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and earn more income. His wife, Mrs. Chek Douch, is a duck breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money. In order to solve this problem, Mr. Yon Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks for his wife’s business to earn more income to support his family. He has six children, three of whom stay at home to do housework and help the parents with their work while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for his wife’s business to earn more income to support his family.

loans.name: Levenia

texts.en:
Levenia M. is an active member of HSPFI (a Kiva Partner). She lives in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. She is married and a responsible mother to her two children. Levenia now is 31 years old. She has a mini grocery store. She sells different kinds of staple goods that her customers demand. She perceives that her business is indeed growing.

Levenia is gaining profit from her sari-sari (variety) store. From that, she has been able to purchase 1 karaoke machine. This machine will give extra income to the family. This would serve as paid karaoke machine, the customers will just insert a 5 peso coin then they would have their choice of songs. Every day, Levenia has an extra income.

Levenia is very much grateful for the help that HSPFI (Kiva Partner) extends to her. Levenia now is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. This amount is intended for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: purchase of additional stock for her store

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a 49-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa area with her husband and their four children. Hasna has owned a grocery store since 2007. She has requested a loan of 1,500 LBP from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Hasna has requested a loan. 

Hasna feels special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana G. runs a business in domestic vegetable growing as the primary source of her family's income.Shee owns two greenhouses on a surface of 15 hectares. Ana has been working in vegetable farming  for more than 10 years. She grows tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and eggplants. Business is profitable as she focuses on reducing costs of production. She is the mother of three children who are the source of inspiration for their parents. Ana is seeking a loan through Microinvest  to purchase film to finish construction of other two greenhouses. Ana is grateful to Microinvest and Kiva for the trust and financial support.

loans.use: For purchasing film for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Antanacio

texts.en:
Mr. Antanacio is 37 years old and single. He owns a business in the center of the city where he sells general merchandise  He also is an important livstock farmer who raises cattle. He owns his land, and has all the equipment needed to raise livestock. He also owns his a comfortable hone in downtown Pilar.  

Antanacio has been in these lines of business for the last eight years, and is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: the buy meat, vegetables and other items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf owns livestock and she also works in agriculture. She produces milk, cheese, wheat and oil. Afaf has outstanding experience dealing with livestock. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash. Afaf decided on this business because it is in demand in her region and she likes working with animals.

Afaf is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. She is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is her second loan cycle and she has always repaid on time. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock.

loans.use: To increase livestock

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela M. is from the town of Aloran. She is sixty-two years old and married with four grown children. To make a living, Marcela owns and operates a general store in the local community where she sells a variety of different products. Marcela has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $155 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Marcela is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita G. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Rosalita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Agostinho

texts.pt:
Carlos agostinho M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 13 anos, estando os três primeiros a freqüentar escola. Estudou ate 6 classe, tendo parando por falta de condições financeiras para custear as despesas de transporte.
Vive na casa própria e sustenta também sua mãe que vive com ela na mesma casa. A esposa é comerciante (dedica se na venda de produtos diversos).

Saiu da cidade de maputo para Boane na companhia dos seus pais ha. bastante tempo e trabalha na empresa estatal ARA sul (Administração regional de Águas) ha mais de 8 anos e obtém um salário mensal no valor de 2.500,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e pagamento de credito. 

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção. Os primeiros empréstimos de 8.000,00Mt 6.000,0MT respectivamente para a mesma actividade.

Nunca teve credito em outras instituições e obteve informações através de amigos e colegas clientes da hluvuku-adsema. Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder adceder a mais créditos para terminar com a construção da sua casa de alvenaria e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Carlos Agostinho M. was born in the city of Maputo. He is 34 years old, married, and the father of 4 children with ages between 3 and 13 years old. The first three are in school. He went to school until the 6th grade, but he stopped because he lacked the financial conditions to afford the expense of transportation. He lives in his own home and also supports his mother who lives with him. His wife is in the trade business (dedicated to selling various products). He left the city of Maputo for Boane in the company of his parents a long time ago. He has worked for the state-owned company, ARA South (Regional Administration of Water) for more than 8 years, and he earns a monthly salary of 2,500MT which he uses to sustain his family and pay his debts. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva in the amount of 12,000MT, which he intends to use to purchase construction materials. The first two loans of 8,000MT and 6,000MT respectively were used for the same activity. He has never had credit through other institutions, and he obtained information about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and colleagues who are clients. He intends to pay off this loan without problems so he will be able to get more loans to finish the construction on his brick home and then furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a brick home

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Aet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who are all living in Chhrouy Sdau village in Takeo province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Phorn A. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan indifferent purposes. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In her plantation, she needs the money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make more productive. Her husband, Hang Chan, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Phorn A. is 50 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another stays at home to do housework and the others are attending the local school. 

Fifteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make more productive.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah - Negara. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent, or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tunas Mekar Asih (DNR.M-0595).

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini owns & operates a business that raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 300.000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living situation and be able to engage in expanded business activities. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is requesting a loan in the amount of 1.000.000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ni Ketut Tiyarmini from DINARI. Ni Ketut Tiyarmini plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini - (-) merupakan 34 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah - Negara.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Tunas Mekar Asih (DNR.M-0595).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR.  Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut Tiyarmini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 32-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Hicham has owned a barber shop for over ten years. Hicham is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and his clients like him. His clients are mainly people from his region, but he also receives tourists. Hicham requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop; he wants to make it more modern and more attractive.

Hicham has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped him maintain his work when there were hard times, as well as always improving his business. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to establish his shop. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, and he also wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara P. lives in Ljevan with her husband and daughter. Since 1992 Tamara has manage her own café. Tamara’s husband is a musician. He doesn't work regular hours so he helps his wife with her large business. At the beginning Tamara had a small café, but during the past 17 years she has reinvested the income from her business and was able to buy the neighboring land to enlarge her café. With the income from her business Tamara is able to supports her family, to reconstruct her café, to buy café equipment and a car to use for café needs. Tamara’s café is very popular in Ljevan thanks to its cleanness and good service. Tamara needs a loan of $3,000 to buy a projector and screen for her café which will enable her to show music videos and thus attract young clientele. With future income, Tamara hopes to increase the café’s size and make it more comfortable in winter months.

loans.use: To buy a projector and screen for her café

loans.name: Alis Marisol

texts.es:
Alis es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío Los Bances, distrito de Pacora, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Debido a que lo que su esposo percibe como trabajador de un molino de arroz no es suficiente para sostener los gastos de educación de sus tres hijos (uno de ellos tiene problemas con el lenguaje por lo que debe recibir educación especial), ella se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar a solventar los gastos familiares: desde hace tres años se dedica a la comercialización de los diversos productos que cosechan los agricultores de la zona: los compra luego de la cosecha para venderlos a un distribuidor que viene a recoger la mercadería a su casa.

Por otro lado se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, las cuales vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Ella desea comprar algunas ovejas para criarlas y luego venderlas; por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre entregada, trabajadora y optimista. Su sueño es poder vivir en el pueblo cercano para instalar una tienda y con ella seguir sacando adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alis is a 33 year old mother who lives with her husband and three children in the town of Los Bances, District of Pacora, Lambayeque Province, which is located 1½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband works at a rice mill, but his income is not enough to cover the educational expenses for their three children (one of them has problems with language and is currently enrolled in special education classes). Therefore, Alis concluded that she needed to work and help with the household finances. For three years she has been selling various crops grown by local farmers. She later decided to sell to a distributor who comes to her house to pick up the produce.

In addition, Alis raises and sells sheep. Her customers are livestock dealers who pass through the area. She wants to buy some sheep to raise for later resale. For this reason, she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles.

Alis is committed, hardworking, and optimistic. Her dream is to live in the nearest town so that she can open a store as a means of providing continued support to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep to raise for later resale

loans.name: Saliu

texts.en: Saliu is 41 years old and is married with 4 children. His wife sells clothes and he sells vegetables and potatoes at the front of his house at retail prices.  He is happy because the demand for his vegetables and potatoes will increase during this festive season. Saliu has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more vegetables and potatoes to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and potatoes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia sells groceries to make a living. She has been in this business for four years. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profit. Her challenge in the business is inadequate funds. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more groceries to sell. Cecilia hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

Cecilia is 47 years old and married with four children. Her eldest child is 18 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Albina's Group

texts.en:
Lives of many people turn out in such a way that they do not get an opportunity to go to college. The circumstances force these people to go to work as soon as they graduate from high school. The life makes these people grow up earlier and start supporting their families, whereas their peers may still enjoy their youth. However, there is an advantage to this state of affairs. Beginning to support one’s family from early age makes this person mature and better prepared for life. From this point they could regard themselves even as fortunate ones. T. K. Albina, the leader of this group, is one of these fortunate youngsters, who started earning their livelihood at an early age. Albina is nineteen years old. She is single and lives with her family. She has a sister, who is two years younger than her. Albina combines two jobs. During her spare time she helps her mother, who is occupied with manufacturing traditional articles of bedding and coverlets. Her mother used to work in a sewing workshop, but because of the low salary, she decided to start her own business. Albina has applied for this loan to help her mother purchase fabric and expand their business.

Albina’s partners are:

Ainur, 45, is single. She lives with her father. Because of her father’s illness Ainur is temporarily not working, as she has to stay by her father’s side and take care of him. Her brother provides them with food and medicine. Ainur needs this loan to buy a washing machine, a DVD player and a ton of coal. 

Svetlana, 47, is a mother of four children. Her husband works as a bus driver. Svetlana is a teacher in an elementary school. One of Svetlana’s daughters goes to college and Svetlana needs a loan to pay for tuition. 

Alisa, 55, lives in a city of Balykchi. Alisa trades in sea–buckthorn. Her husband, 65, is retired. Her youngest son, 21, works as a waiter in a café. At weekends he helps Alisa sell the sea–buckthorn. Alisa has applied for this loan to purchase ten sheep for breeding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and expand her business

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 38 year old man who lives in southern Lebanon with his wife. Jamal has been working as a blacksmith since 1991. When he first started his work, he had some financial issues and faced difficulties in building networks. He decided on doing his business because of his experience and because he likes his work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work, like an electrical arc welding tool and an abrasive. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires for his work.

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Brenda del Socorro E. L., vende ropa para varones, sandalias y gorras a dos cuadra aledañas del Mercado central Chinandega, la señora E. solicito el crédito para surtir su negocio con mercadería para la temporada de playa, que ahorita en su negocio no tenia en existencia, ella anteriormente le ayudaba a su tía a ver sus tiendas y luego le motivó y decidió poner su tienda con la ayuda de su mamá y su tía que le brindaron ayuda económicamente.
La señora E. es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar  por lo que ella se esfuerza enormemente en su negocio para poder llevar el sustento en su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda del Socorro E. L. sells boys clothing, sandals and hats, 2 blocks in front of the central market Chinandega. Señora E. is seeking a loan to stock her business with merchandise for the beach season, as at the moment there isn't any in her shop. Señora E. used to help her aunt in her shops, and later became motivated and decided to have her own shop, with the help of her mother and her aunt, who have assisted her economically. Señora E. is the mother of 2 school-aged children, for which reason she works enormously hard in her business to be able to sustain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and beach sandals

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is a single, 25-year-old woman from the village of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, Joy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells health and medicinal products to members of her community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was able to improve her standard of living and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy successfully repaid a prior loan from GDMPC in the amount of 3,500 PHP. Joy is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 6,000 PHP ($150), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Notably, this loan would be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 43-year-old lady who is married to Stephen Karanja. The two of them have three school-going children.  She has been selling second-hand clothes in Naivasha town since 2005.

Florence was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan, after applying for a previous loan which she repaid well and on time.  She plans to buy more clothes for sale as the current stock she has is getting finished.

She plans to move from selling her clothes on the roadside into a permanent place.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana, a married mother of a grown son and daughter, is a market entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells children’s clothing, merchandise and toys in one of the local marketplaces called “Nadezhda” (“Hope”). Svitlana is a very disciplined entrepreneur and borrower. She likes to have everything organized and thoroughly planned out which has helped her grow her business and make it a success. Presently, Svitlana has 18,000 Grivnyas invested in this business, with net monthly profits of at least 3,000 Grivnyas.

Energetic and motivated, Svitlana always moves forward with a drive to build something new which helps her reach new goals and make her business more lucrative. She is also very creative and knows how to run the financial end of the enterprise. Svitlana is now seeking a loan of 9,170 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise and broaden her selection of children’s clothing items and toys that she offers for sale.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Nazaret A Group

texts.en:
Nazaret A is a group of eight farmers in Oenif Village-Kupang District, East Nusa Tenggara Province. It is situated about 30 km (one hour's drive) from Kupang City. Even though this village is categorized as a remote place, the road into the village is good and has been sealed. There are 35 families who live in the village. The community in Oenif Village relies on farming as their primary income source. The most difficult challenge faced by the community is lack of water for watering their crops. They usually sell their agricultural crops in Inpres Market at Kupang City, as there is no traditional market available in the village. They take motorbike taxis to bring their agricultural crops to Inpres Market as there is no public transport from their village. It costs IDR. 20.000/ return trip.

Nazaret A Group is led by a 41 year old, Obednego L.. He is married and blessed with three nice children. They are: 
- Remli L., 17 years old, who is in the Second Grade of Senior High School
- Reliana L., 14 years old, who is in the Second Grade of Junior High School
- Rismi L., 7 years old, who is in the First Grade of Elementary School

Obednego relies on agricultural crops and the breeding of pigs and goats. Obednego is very concerned about his children’s education. For Obednego education is a priority for his children’s future. Currently, Remli is studying in a Catholic School in So’e - South Central Region of Timor in East Nusa Tenggara Province. It is situated about 150 km from Oenif Village, so they need a lot of money to pay his education costs. He has to send IDR 500,000 per month to pay for his son’s school, living expenses and daily needs. This is one of the reasons why Obednego has to work hard at selling his crops. Fortunately, his wife is able to help him with selling their agricultural crops at the market.

As the father of 3 children, Obednego dreams of providing a better life for his family and to support his children’s education through to University. The lack of capital is the main issue for him in improving his family’s living standard. Moreover, he also does not have any other skills to generate further income. One day he heard from the clergyman in the village that the Kiva field partner – TLM Foundation, assists poor farmers, particularly in West Timor, by providing loans through the Cattle Fattening Program. He is very interested in joining the program as he has experience in fattening livestock and he thinks this program will have a positive impact on his family’s future.   

Obednego discussed it with his neighbours and they are also interested in the program so they formed a group which is called Nazaret A. Obednego is requesting a loan of IDR 3,200,000 to buy a young cow to be fattened over a 12 month period. Other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle as they are sure this program is a good way for them to improve their families’ lives.
