Note: Sarlota and Sara were replaced by their family members when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened.

loans.name: Felix Nilton

texts.es:
FELIX TIENE 27 AÑOS, ES SOLTERO Y TRABAJA EN CONSTRUCCION, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE 
QUE SE INICIO EN ESTE NEGOCIO HACE MAS DE 2 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. VIVE EN CASA DE SUS 
PADRES A QUIENES APOYA CON PARTE DE LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. SU SUEÑO ES LLEGAR A TENER 
UNA EMPRESA CONSTRUCTURA GRANDE, YA QUE ÈL APENAS REALIZA OBRAS PEQUEÑAS PARA SUS 
VECINOS Y PERSONAS NATURALES QUE LO REFIEREN, YA QUE ESTA COMENZANDO Y LOS EQUIPOS QUE 
TIENE LOS ADQUIRIO CON SUS AHORROS PRODUCTO DE SUS EXCEDENTES. REQUIERE EL CRÉDITO 
PARA LA COMPRA DE TABLAS Y PODER AVANZAR CON OTRA OBRA EN FORMA PARALELA.
texts.en:
Felix is 27 years old, single, and works in construction. He is a responsible person who started in this business more than two years ago. Felix lives in the home of his parents and helps with part of the family expenses. His dream is establish a large construction business. He currently performs small jobs for his neighbors and people who have been referred to him. Through his work and with the money he was able to save, Felix acquired equipment for his job. He needs a loan in order to purchase lumber so that he can work on multiple projects at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lumber & equipment for his work

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a loyal member of a Kiva field partner in the Philippines (ASHI), Narcisa S. has been receiving loans since 1998. Loans she received then have enabled her to start up several businesses managed by her. First, she started selling vegetables & fruits and with her next loans, she started a slaughtering business and a “sari-sari” (variety) store. She sells her products directly to people in her village and in a public market. 

Now, Narcisa is requesting another loan from ASHI to support her businesses and to grow them further until such time as they become profitable and stable. She wants to increase the inventory of her store for the convenience of her customers who live around the village. 

Narcisa happily handles her career being a wife, mother, and businesswoman. Her desire to give her children a better life in the future inspired her to have her own businesses and augment her husband’s sporadic income as a government employee. 

Narcisa is a very good member of ASHI who is requesting a new loan of 45,000 Php to realize her dream of buying more vegetables & fruits, pigs to be slaughtered, and to purchase inventory for her store. The pigs that Narcisa slaughters are sold directly to people in different municipalities during market day. Profit from this kind of businesses is quite good compared to other businesses that Narcisa has tried. Furthermore, she wishes to support the education of all her children until they graduate from college and have a better career in the future. With her passion for giving her children a better future, she will be willing to work hard and help her husband earn money through her businesses. 

Narcisa is motivated by her desire for personal development so that one day she can be self-reliant in her businesses. Narcisa enjoys the system of work groups that is implemented by ASHI. She has benefited from hearing the experiences of her fellow group members and also appreciates that the process for securing a loan is convenient for her.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables & fruits, pigs to be slaughtered, and buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao S. is 28 years old and single. He has been a farmer for the last eight years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for growing wheat.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy fertilizer and pesticide to spray his ten acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more farmland to meet the demand for wheat.

Patao is a young and energetic man who is determined to reach his goals. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for his ten acres of wheat.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. is from the village of Parog-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 51 years old. Oscar is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Oscar grows crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Bramme

texts.en:
Bramme J. lives the village of Manticao in Misamis Oriental. She is 18 years old, single and makes a living by providing transportation services to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Bramme joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy various items she needs to offer her services. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en: Aqil E. is 38 years old trader who sells home accessories in a small shop in Agsu city. Aqil is married and has two children. He has four years of experience in the trade field. His monthly income is 260-280 AZN and he would like to increase it to 350. For this purpose he has applied for 1000 AZN loan. He hopes that this increases his income and that he can one day build his own business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Lydie Olouwafèmi

texts.fr: Z. Lydie Olouwafèmi est née le 13 Juillet 1977 et est mariée à OGAH Adrien, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Lydie habite le quartier Midombo à Cotonou, avec ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Lydie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Lydie vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, sucre, lait, savons, allumettes, etc.) et aussi des produits de merceries au marché de Midombo. Lydie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Lydie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle. Lydie a bien remboursé le premier crédit.
texts.en:
Lydie Olouwafèmi Z. was born 13 July 1977 and is married to Adrien Ogah, a mechanic. The couple has two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Lydie lives with her children in the Midombo borough of Cotonou. The couple shares the handling of family expenses. Lydie interrupted her schooling at secondary level. For the past 12 years, she has been selling various items (pasta, canned goods, sugar, milk, soap, matches, etc.) and also haberdashery products at the Midombo market. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This is Lydie’s second loan request with ALIDé, the purpose of which is to increase her level of activity and also her customer base. She fully reimbursed the first loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy haberdashery products and various items (pasta, sugar, canned goods, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Kasaine

texts.en:
Kasaine K. is 24 years old. He is married to Noomechuki K. and the father of one child who is one year old. Kasaine is a farmer and he has been farming on his own piece of land for the last four years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET registered client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend as follows: 20,000 KES on harrowing,15,000 KES on seeds and 15,000 KES on planting his wheat farm.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming by plowing a bigger piece of land for planting wheat. Kasaine's dreams are to do large scale farming, attain financial independence and buy his own farm machinery. 

He is a young, hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: For harrowing, purchasing seeds and planting his wheat farm.

loans.name: Ssendy Margaret

texts.es:
Ssendy tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un menor hijo a su cargo, reside en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de locutorio y recargas para celulares en un pequeño ambiente dentro de su domicilio. El lugar cuenta con mucha acogida debido a que es céntrico, por lo que también ha estado implementando su negocio con la venta de productos de belleza y golosinas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para mantener a su menor hijo.

Ssendy desea ampliar su negocio con la compra demas productos parea ofrecerlos en venta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa realizar su objetivo.

Ssendy es una mujer emprededora, siempre está buscando la manera de agenciarse de ingresos de modo que pueda sacar adelante a su hija. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y alegre.
texts.en:
Ssendy is a 29 year old single mother who has a young child under her care. She lives in the city of Lambayeque, an area that experiences regular commercial activity and is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Ssendy has been operating a call center and providing electronic loads for mobile phones from a small room in her home. Her business has been well-received because it is centrally located and from there her customers can also buy beauty products and candy. The income she generates from her business is used to support her young child.

Ssendy wants to expand her business by acquiring other products that complement what she already sells. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can achieve her goal.

Ssendy is an enterprising woman who is always looking to manage her income in a way that will help her daughter move forward. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and cheerful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general merchandise so that she can start a small store within her call center

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. is divorced. She is into the production and distribution of palm oil in Elmina. She takes care of five dependants. She has been in this trade for quite some time now. Ekua uses her income for the general upkeep of her home. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more palm fruits to process for sale. Ekua plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to enter into the sale of foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to process for sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa Hilo de Oro en quechua.
Julia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia y el otro aun es pequeño, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende pollos y huevos, que compra de las avícolas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevo.
Julia sueña con tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Qory Qaytu”, which means “Thread of Gold” in Quechua. She is in a common law marriage and has two children, one who is in school and another who is an infant. Julia has a stand at the April 12th Market where she sells chickens and eggs. She buys the poultry and manages her business every day.

Julia needs a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of eggs. She dreams of opening a grocery store and owning a home since she currently lives in a rental house.

loans.use: Purchase eggs to sell

loans.name: Ely

texts.es: La Sra. Ely Vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace uno 15 años que vino a vivir a la ciudad de Santa Cruz buscando mejores días para ella y su familia , hace 20 años que se dedica a la actividad de la costura, el destino del crédito es para comprar tela y accesorios, su esposo se dedica al transporte de equipo pesado, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar, están en el proceso de la construcción de su casa ya que se encuentra en estado, rustico, el deseo de la Sra. Ely es de ver terminada su casa, por esta razón trabajan duro ella y su esposo, esta muy agradecida con la Institución por el apoyo Brindado.
texts.en: Ely lives in the region of La Guardia, located at a distance of 20 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She is originally from the region of Cochabamba but about 15 years ago she came to the city of Santa Cruz in search for a better future for herself and for her family. For the past 20 years she has been a seamstress. The loan will be used to purchase fabrics and accessories. Her husband is a transport truck driver. They have two school aged children. They are in the process of having a house built for them. The one they currently live in is rustic. Ely's dream is to see her home finished and to this end she and her husband work very hard. She is very grateful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Ekouéssan

texts.fr: ekouéssan est un homme marié et père de 2 enfants, il a appris la médecine, après sa formation il a ouvert son propre cabinet depuis 2000. il emploie de deux infirmières dans son cabinet. Actuellement  il souhaite réaménager ses locaux pour mieux installer ses patients. il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers matériaux pour l’aménagement des locaux de sa clinique.
texts.en:
Ekouessan is a married man, father of two children. He studied to become a doctor, and after completing his studies opened his own practice in 2000, where he employs two nurses.

At this time he wishes to remodel his premises to provide a more hospitable environment for his patients. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various materials for the remodelling of the premises of his clinic.

loans.use: remodel the premises of his clinic

loans.name: Jofre Orlando

texts.es:
Jofre de 34 años, tiene un taller de soldadura, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace 10 años atrás empezó a trabajar y aprender como soldador en un taller pero como necesitaba más ingresos decidió tener su propio taller. Con unos ahorros y la ayuda de su esposa pudo tener su propio taller de soldadura. Conoció en una construcción que lo contrataron a uno de los que ahora es su gran amigo quien le ayudo hacer más grande su negocio. Ahora el trabaja desde muy temprano con contratos en casa casi todos los días instalando techos, infraestructuras etc. 

Para darle una mejor vida a su familia él quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción para su casa ya que es de caña y cemento. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para hacer una cancha de futbol sintética y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Jofre, 34, owns a welding shop.  He lives in a semi-urban zone called Paraiso de la Flor, a hilly area with few paved roads.  

Jofre started as a welder 10 years ago, learning the trade and working as a welder in another shop.  He decided to start his own business so that he could increase his income  With savings and help from his wife, he managed to set up his own shop.  He was hired for a construction project by someone who has become a good friend and helped him grow the business. Now he works almost every day, from very early in the morning, on jobs such as roof construction and infrastructure installation.

Jofre is applying for a loan to rebuild his house.  The house is made from cane and cement and he wants to improve it for his family.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials.  In the future, he wants to buy land to build a football pitch so that he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: Cement, concrete blocks, sand.

loans.name: Taku Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKU LIGUEY est créé le 24 avril 2010. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont organisé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du banc villageois de FOGNY2

Madame Marie M. à gauche de la photo et levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits. Tels des jus de fruits naturels, de la crème glacée etc.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter sa production en achetant plus d'intrants pour la fabrique de ses jus et crèmes glacées

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKU LIGUEY was created on April 24, 2010.  It is composed of seven women living in the same district.  The women organized their group by affinity and proximity.  It is part of the Banc Villageois of FOGNY2.

Ms. Marie M. is the group's leader (appearing in the photo at the left with her hand raised).   She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a small business involving a variety of products, such as natural fruit juices, ice cream, etc.  

With her loan, Marie is going to increase her production by buying more ingredients for making  juices and ice creams.  Her goal is to help cover family expenses and to support herself.

loans.use: Advancing her business activity

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. smokes fish for sale. She also sells 'kenkey' (fermented corn dough) and fried fish at Abura. She is married and takes care of six dependents. Her husband works as security personnel. 

Ama has been in this business for some time now. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en: Nuth S., 34, is requesting a loan of $600 US to repair his house. S. makes traditional baskets to sell, earning $2.50 US per day. S. is married and lives with his wife and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $60 US on food, $25 US on electricity, and $2.00 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Nietaga Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe NIETAGA (6 mariés  et 2 veuves), avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants, vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de la commune rurale de NIENA préfecture   de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels  le beurre de karité avec MASSEBE S.. 
MASSEBE S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 60 Kg de beurre de karité. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et villages voisins auprès des productrices. Le beurre de karité est vendu à NIENA et en famille à une clientèle composée de revendeurs, surtout au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser  pour rembourser le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the NIETAGA group (six are married and two are widowed) are on average 44 years old, have three children, and live mostly in monogamous families in Nougoume, a village in the rural community of Niena, in the Sikasso prefecture (third administrative region of Mali).  
They are on their first joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Their goal is to meet the demands of their clients.   This group of women is involved in the business of selling various products such as shea butter with Massebe S.. 
Massebe S. plans to buy 60 Kg of shea butter with her loan.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Niena and from producers in neighboring villages.  The shea butter is sold in Niena and within the family to a clientele of vendors, generally for cash. 
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which she plans to use to repay the loan and to contribute to daily family expenses. 
Her goal is to increase her turnover to better meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy shea butter

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en:
Handsuren is married and lives with her husband and her youngest son in their own house in a Darhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Her husband is a truck driver and used to work for a transportation company for 8 years. Handsuren started her meat-selling business in a local market with a starting capital of 2,000- 3,000 MNT in 1995. Her business has grown quickly over the years and she has gained much experience as a businesswoman. Her earnings have enabled her to build a winter house and buy a truck, so that her husband and youngest son could operate their transportation business. Thanks to their business and endless effort, three of her four children have attended University and gotten their degrees. Now they are all married and able to take care of their families by themselves. Handsuren's dream is to open her own grocery store by her house because she thinks that it would be difficult to stand out at the stall all day for an older woman. The members of this family are all hardworking, honest and effective people who could use the bank loans successfully and improved their quality of life and pay the loan back on time. Handsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more meat that she could sell and make more money during Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian Traditional New Year. She is eager to expand her business and increase her money to own a grocery store near her house. 
"

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced construction worker who has been specialized for almost 4 years in completing woodwork projects. He works on local projects upon request of the clients. He cooperates with his wife who works in a cloth store to earn the family income.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more wood for his newest project so he can improve his business. In the future, he is willing to take on bigger projects so he can earn superior income.

loans.use: improve his business

loans.name: Rorm

texts.en:
The woman shown in this picture is Rorm C..  She is 23 and is a fisherwoman in and around the Tunle Sap River. She and her husband usually need to spend at least eight hours a day to fish. They catch around 10 kilos of fish a day and sell them in bulk to their customers who are retail sellers in the market. This young couple has been married for a few years, but they don’t have a baby yet. 

Rorm C. will use her loan to purchase nets, boat and fishing implements for catching fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, boat and fishing implements

loans.name: Rowalla Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Rowalla” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking their first loan to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata C..  Aminata is 35 years old and was born in the village of Rowalla.  She is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman, and their children are all in secondary school.  For more than four years now, Aminata has been selling drinks, soap, and brushes. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing more of these items to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy drinks, soap, and brushes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Kunduz's Group

texts.en: Kunduz K., 32, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi. She works as a teacher of the Kyrgyz language at a school. In order to earn additional money to meet her personal needs, five years ago, with the initial investment of 500 soms, Kunduz started to sell Oriflame cosmetics. In this way she earns additional 1,500 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to improve her living conditions and purchase furniture for her home. With money received from the loan, Kunduz would purchase more cosmetics in order to increase the turnover of her business, and with some part of the loan, she will purchase furniture. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and furniture

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years in Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. He sells his products of maize, beans and milk to the local market. 

Philip is 35 and married with five children aged between two and 10 years. All the children attend school except the youngest.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Kiva Partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of unpredictable weather conditions and lack of a stable market for his products.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda K. (pictured) is 25 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vannak Seur, is 33 years old. They live along National Road 2, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003, and they have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in school, while the other child is still too young for school.

To earn a living and to support her family, Mrs. Chinda K. sells fish in a market that is approximately four kilometers from her house. Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction contractor. She is seeking her first loan, in the amount of $200, to buy additional fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fish.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Víctor, de 27 años es un hombre muy trabajador y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Adelina de 27 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Todos los días Víctor se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con su labor, él es uno de los pocos panaderos del Asentamiento Humano Pachacutec de la ciudad de Lima, es por eso que su negocio es muy concurrido. El pan que prepara es muy sabroso y nutritivo, ya que pone mucho empeño en elaborarlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hornear los panes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para preparar la masa, pero es parte del sacrificio que demanda su trabajo. Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido, ya que sabe que le será de mucha ayuda para hacer progresar su negocio. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de panes.
texts.en:
Victor, 27 years old, is a hard-working and friendly man. He lives in his own home together with his wife Adelina, also 27, and what he wants more than anything is to work hard to improve his quality of life. Every day Victor gets up very early to work. He is one of only a few bakers in the settlement of Pachacutec outside of the city of Lima. For this reason his business is very popular. His bread is very tasty and nutritious since he puts a lot of effort into making it. 

What he likes most about his job is baking the bread. He has been doing this for 3 years and thinks that the hardest part is getting up very early to make the dough, but this is part of the sacrifice that his job demands. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and thereby improve his income. 

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is happy to have gotten it, since he knows that it will help in the progression of his business. With the 1,500 nuevos soles that he asked for, he will buy more ingredients to make more bread.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spice business in the Philippines.  She is requesting PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables.   Belen has been in this business for 7 years.  She earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items and drinks for his bar and restaurant

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Orn, 40 years old, is running a karaoke shop. Her husband is a chief of construction for a company and states, their income is $15 per day. They have two children, and both of them are studying. 

Every month, On has to spend $70 on food, and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy pigs and pig-feed, then sell those pigs when they are big enough to sell. If she could save more money, she would like to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house. As for the children, she wants to support them in their studies until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig-feed.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 21-year-old enterprising man living in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda. For 2 years, Rashid has been dealing in the textile business and started with 450,000 shillings but he currently has capital of one million. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes and his desire is to operate from sheltered premises. Rashid needs the loan capability to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 52 años, es madre de 3 hijas mayores e independientes, viven en casa propia sola ya que su esposo esta en otra ciudad por motivos laborales. María es una mujer muy emprendedora, le gusta mucho incursionar en todo tipo de trabajos, ahora esta incursionando en la venta de menú en un mercado conocido de la ciudad. Este negocio empezó a lado de sus dos hijas con quienes esta formando sociedad, pues antes se dedicaba a la venta de abarrotes en la casa de su hija pero no le dio resultados. Lleva con este nuevo negocio recién 15 días y esta poniéndole todas las ganas y todo el entusiasmo posible para poder salir adelante. Ya que aún es nueva en esta actividad hay cosas que le parecen desconocidas y cosas que le llenan de emoción, espera poder crecer junto a sus hijas y siente que va en el buen camino ya que hasta ahora esta ganando muchos clientes. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, espera poder seguir trabajando ya que es muy querida en su banco comunal al ser una de las socias fundadoras pero se tuvo que retirar por motivo de  enfermedad pero ahora esta nuevamente en busca de sentirse útil otra vez. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 soles, comprará utensilios y menaje para su nuevo negocio, además de pagar el alquiler del local donde esta instalado su restaurante.
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and the mother of three adult, independent daughters.  She lives alone because her husband is in a different city for work related reasons.  María is a very enterprising woman.  She likes to go into a variety of occupations.  Now, she’s starting to sell daily meals in a well-known market in the city.  She started this business alongside her two daughters that she’s forming a partnership with because she used to sell groceries at her daughter’s house but that didn’t have good results.  She’s been in the new business two weeks and she’s throwing all her effort and enthusiasm into it to succeed.  Because it’s a new endeavor there are things she’s unfamiliar with and others that excite her very much.  She hopes to grow together with her daughters and she feels that they are on the right path because, to date, they’ve been winning over many customers.

This is the third MFP loan and she intends to continue working because she’s very well liked in the communal bank for she is one of the founding members but had to drop out due to illness but now she’s once again looking to feel useful again.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy utensils and equipment for the new business as well as pay the rental on the locale where her restaurant is.

loans.use: to buy utensiles, plates and to pay the rent.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and married to Moses. They are blessed with two children aged seven years old and two years old. She has been selling tomatoes for the last year, making a profit of KES 16,820. She has been loaned KES 50,000, which she plans to use to buy more stock of tomatoes to sell.

With the anticipated profit, she would like to improve the living standard of her family. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and therefore, improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife, three children and one brother. He has owned a metal shop since 1976. His job consists in cutting up metal in order to give those shapes as the clients ask for. 

Getting older, Georges must move on with his business operation in order to earn good revenue as he is the only income source of the family and must also pay his only employee’s salary. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional materials needed. In the future, he is planning to improve his business and expand his operations still further.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for cutting up metal.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his extended family.

Bakari operates charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors. His major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season, charcoal is less available to sell in rural areas. He dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old business man. He runs a grocery shop to earn a living. He has been operating the business for over five years. He has used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost his business. His desire is to expand his business into wholesale in the future.

Joseph dreams of opening other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested a loan for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos, desde hace 21 años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de salón de belleza, inició su negocio ofreciendo sus servicios fue comprando ciertos productos poco a poco y así obtener lo que tiene hoy en día. Lo que más le gusta es brindar un buen servicio así sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos con este medio de vida. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pintura de labios, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, shampoo, peines, cepillos, entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa Maria is 46 years old and has 3 child.  She has been making a living by offering beauty salon services for the past 21 years.  She started her business by slowly buying certain products.  This is how she obtained what she has today.  What she likes most is giving good service so that her customers are satisfied with her work.  With this loan she will buy lipstick, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs, brushes, etc.

loans.use: buy lipstick, creams, treatments, nail polish, shampoo, combs, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 39 years old and a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have five children with ages ranging form 6 years to 17 years old. He runs a cafe business where he sells soft drinks, bread and cakes to the passersby at the country bus station in Nairobi. He says the business is profitable and the major challenges he has are weather changes and lack of enough capital. 

Lawrence has future hopes of owning a permanent store as well as giving a good education to his children. He describes himself as humble and aggressive.

loans.use: To add stock of bread, cakes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en: Johnbosco lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with one child. He is motorcycle driver who started as a bicycle rider four years back, and later got hired to drive someone else's motorcycle. He faces a problem with traffic officers who ask for bribes. He dreams of buying land, constructing a house and buying a taxi. Johnbosco wants a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en: Pan is a 49-year-old mother of 6 children. She is a farmer and also grows cassava to support her family. She has been in this business with her parents since she was around 10 years old. Pan is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She wants to plant cassava on her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to expand her cassava plantation and earn more income to better feed her family and build some savings for the future.

loans.use: to plant cassava on her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Martha Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Martha comenta que necesita surtir su negocio de ropa de invierno para ofrecer a sus clientes diferentes y más variedad de mercancía. 
Doña Martha ayuda a su esposo con las ganancias de la venta de ropa, desde hace doce años, ya que con la pensión que recibe a veces no es suficiente para los gastos familiares. Ya que son personas mayores de edad y no encuentran trabajo, es por eso que solicitan el préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa usada en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Martha comments that it is necessary to stock her business with winter clothing so that she can offer her customers different merchandise and a wider variety of merchandise.

Martha has been helping her husband with the profits she makes from her clothing business for twelve years because the pension he receives is sometimes not enough to cover their family expenses.  As they are older people and cannot find work, Martha is requesting a loan to invest in her used-clothing business in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Lucila Hortencia

texts.es:
Lucila Hortencia tiene 57 años de edad vive rçen unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 23, 22, 20 y 17 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Lucila se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y venta de pollos pelados hace 26 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en  Guayaquil. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas criollas,  con la ayuda del crédito obtendrá un beneficio económico.

En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Lucila Hortencia, age 57, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  She lives with her husband and their childen; ages 23, 22, 20 and 17.  She lives in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province.

The “Alas de Cristo” (Wings of Christ) communal bank is located in the Ventanas Canton.  The members generally devote themselves to commercial work.

Lucila devotes herself to the household chores, and she has been selling plucked chickens for 26 years.  She makes her purchases and her sales in Guayaquil.  

She is requesting the loan to buy chickens.  The help of the loan will be economically beneficial.

She likes to do her household chores in her free time.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mukhungula Group

texts.en:
Zacharia is the facilitator of the Mukhungula group. Zacharia and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Zacharia takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Zacharia had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Zacharia was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Zacharia and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Zacharia will educate his children save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Mukhungula group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Zacharia is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Gloría tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella es de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Esta señora es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de artesanía así como frazada, manteles y otros, pero también aparte de eso se dedica a la venta de bebidas y posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en su domicilio. Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo hacerse de casa propia y adquirir las comodidades necesarias para sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer frazadas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, ya que son más económicos en este tiempo y ella tiene mucha demanda. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Gloría is 38, and a single mother with two school-age children. She is from the city of Carapeguá. This woman is very enterprising and hard-working. She  makes and sells handicrafts, such as blankets, tablecloths and other things. 

Besides that, she also sells beverages, and has a small grocery store that she runs in her home. Thanks to her hard work and effort, she managed to get her own house, and acquire the necessary comforts for her children.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy thread and dye for weaving the blankets that her customers ask for at this time of year. They are cheaper right now, and she has a lot of demand. She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: To buy thread and dye for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells charcoal. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase charcoal supplies to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Elvie hopes to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal supplies.

loans.name: Mary Shirley

texts.es: La señora Mary es socia antigua de nuestra institución ya que se encuentra en su segunda secuencia, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijas  pequeñas, vive en casa familiar. La Señora tiene el negocio de repostería y que entrega a pedido tortas para todo acontecimiento (cumpleaños, bautizo, matrimonios, etc); su negocio  tiene una antigüedad de mas de 5 años   y el crédito que solicitó es para compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus tortas, como harina y leche y el saldo es para el pago de una deuda,  le va muy bien con su actividad ya que el negocio esta creciendo, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Mary is a long-time member of our institution and she is in her second loan cycle. 
 Mary is married and has 2 small daughters and they live in a family home. Her business is a bakery and she bakes cakes for all types of events (birthdays, baptisms, weddings, etc).  She has had her business for more than 5 years and she will use the requested loan to buy ingredients to make the cakes such as flour and milk, and the balance to pay off a debt.  Her business is going very well and is growing.  Mary is very hard-working and appreciative of the institution that is offering her the support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake cakes such as flour and milk, and to use the balance to pay off a debt

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 39 years old. She has two children whom are in primary and secondary school. She transports construction materials and raise pigs for a living. She gets 4,300,000 VND from her jobs per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy car and some others vehicle to transport construction material.

loans.use: to buy car and some others vehicle to transport construction material.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a food vender.  She prepares a variety of food for sale.  Some of the food is banku and vegetable soup.  Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water until it is the consistency of a smooth whitish paste.  

With years of expereince in this business, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, fish and vegetables, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Banku’ and soup. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a terrazzo floor designer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase more maize and cassava, fish and vegetables, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Banku’ and soup.

loans.name: Etornam

texts.en: Etornam is a small-scale engine oil seller and a petty trader in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe). She has had some formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Etornam has been working as a petty trader for close to 4 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. Etornam as a very determined young woman. She saw the need to introduce the sale of engine oil to her husband’s auto mechanic shop when she realized that her husband and her customers buy from a shop nearby. Her husband had never sold it but ends up selling on credit, and he later stopped. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of engine oil, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all of her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase additional engine oil, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand.

loans.name: Louv

texts.en:
Y. Louv is a happy mother of a large and busy family. She has five daughters and one son who all live at home. Y. Louv currently sells fruit near a school that is close to their home. She earns about $3.75 from this each day. Y. Louv's husband is a security guard and he earns a salary of $50 per month. Their four oldest daughters all work in a local factory and each earn a salary of $90 per month. Their 15 year old daughter and 7 year old son are both still attending school.

This large bustling family is currently facing transportation problems, and therefore Y. Louv is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase two motorbikes which cost $500 each. These motorbikes will allow her daughters to safely get to work each day, as well as allow her husband and other two children to get to work and school. Ultimately, this will also allow the family to eliminate the cost of using motorbike taxis.

In the future Y. Louv would like to expand her fruit sales business near the school to include selling water cane. This is popular with the children in the area, and she believes it will help to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase two motorbikes.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a low income person from Agsu district. He is married and has 2 kids. He is 36 years old and is a handicapped man. He started his business in 2000. In 2006 he borrowed a loan from Normicro Agsu branch amounting $500 and used it for business expansion. Now he applies for $1000 to open a new business.

loans.use: to start new business

loans.name: Serafín

texts.en:
Serafin has been running a hardware store from his home for 8 years with the help of his wife and children. Serafin sells his diverse array of hardware products to his clients 7 days a week from 7am to 10pm. Serafin is asking for a loan to expand his business by buying paint, cables, light bulbs, tubes, and other products. He needs to do this because his clientele has increased and there are no other hardware stores in the area. By expanding his business, Serafin will be able to satisfy his clients' needs. Serafin, 34, is married with 3 children. His wife and kids help him run the business because they know that this is where the money comes from that allows them to get an education and food. In addition to his business, Serafin knows how to build homes. When he is asked to do some construction work, he always goes because this adds to his income and helps to improve his home and the lives of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Serafín tiene su ferretería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 8 años donde su esposa he hijos lo ayudan en su atención. Serafín brinda sus diversos productos de ferretería a sus clientes todos los días de la semana y los atiende desde las 7AM a 22PM

Serafín solicita crédito con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio en comprar pinturas, cables, focos, tubos y otros. Ya que su clientela se ha incrementado debido a que no existe otra ferretería cerca de donde esta ubicado. Y Serafín de esta manera podrá cumplir a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.

Serafín es casado tiene 34 años y 3 hijos. La esposa y los hijos lo apoyan en el negocio por que ellos saben que es su fuente de ingresos que les permite seguirles dando mejora alimentación y educación. Adicionalmente a su negocio Serafín sabe el arte de construir vivienda y cuando lo llaman para alguna obra siempre esta para no dejarla pasar, ya que es una oportunidad de obtener otros ingresos que sumados a la ganancia dada por su negocio mejoran mas su calidad de vida la de su familia y hogar.

loans.use: To invest in products to sell

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
A. Doreen is a married mother with 3 children. She comes from northern Uganda. Her husband works as a police officer. As a hard working lady, she does not sit home without supporting the husband. She makes paper beads, to earn more income to support her family.

She joined Life in Africa in 2005. Since then she has been an active member during group production. She participates in about 3 activities a day. She feels she has a lot more free time and wishes to occupy this time with business. At the barracks where she stays, there are many people who use charcoal stoves for cooking. For this reason, she wants to start selling charcoal for more income.

She requests a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings, which she will repay in 7 months. This equals a loan request of USD150. Her budget is as below:

15 sacks of charcoal, each at 15,000 shillings, which equals 240,000 shillings in total;

Empty sacks, each at 1000 shillings, which will equal 15,000 shillings in total;

This totals 255,000 shillings.

For this business she does not need transport because lorries keep moving around selling charcoal to resellers. She will also use her outside store for keeping the charcoal. On top of that, she has already saved 5000 shillings to top up this business.

loans.use: Buying Charcoal

loans.name: Afes

texts.en:
Afes Aliyev is a 31-year-old married farmer who has small sheep herd. Afes lives in the southern Azerbaijani region, Saati, in Alisoltanli village. He is an internally displaced person from Nagorniy Karabakh, who fled to Saatli during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He sells mutton to the local and capital traders and he is very successful in his business because meat is in high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use it in homes and cafes a lot. Afes has eight years experience in this field.

Now Afes has decided to expand his business and purchase one milk cow and fodder. He is going to sell dairy products like milk and yoghurt. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, married and has three children. Eldar is engaged in cattle-breeding. He established his business 15 years ago. He wants to borrow a loan from Normicro to buy grass for his cows because it’s difficult to buy grass for cows in winter. Eldar needs $500 for his plans to feed his cows for the cold winter.

loans.use: To expand cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Te You

texts.en: Mrs. Te You S., age 54, is a housewife who also grows rice crops.  Her husband is a blacksmith and also works digging wells, earning around $8 each day.  They have eight children, some who are married and some  who are students.  She would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase a rice-grinding mill to more efficiently separate the rice from the husk and not have to perform the process manually, which involves crushing the rice husks with her feet.  This mill will increase the output she can sell.

loans.use: To purchase a rice-grinding mill.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: My name is Shazia B.. I am married and gave birth to my first child, a girl, seven months ago. I live with my family in Lahore, a large city in Pakistan. My husband builds homes for a living, and needs to buy a machine to polish tiles. There are five other members of my loan group, all of whom are eager to expand their businesses. I feel very happy to be working with them and to apply for a loan with their help. My group members are Zainab Bib, who needs a loan for her husband’s cosmetics store; Simki B., who needs a loan to repair her husband's rickshaw;  Rani B., who needs a loan for her husband's construction supply business; Naseem B., who needs a loan for her husband’s fruit cart; and Kalsoom B., whose husband needs to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and other items

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es:
Vladimir works the nightshift as an administrative secretary at a public school in the city of La Paz. He lives in the Villa San Antonio zone on the east side of La Paz. This is the third time that he has requested a loan. The amount requested will be used for purchasing phone stalls for an Internet service center that he has in the same area where he lives. That way, he can improve his monthly income; by working at a state school he makes the minimum national wage. The credit analysis we performed allows him access to this credit since he has experience in economic activities, which will help him to obtain income and cover this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Vladimir trabaja como secretario administrativo en un colegio fiscal de la ciudad de La Paz (turno de la noche). Vive en la zona Villa San Antonio, ladera este de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de cabinas telefónicas, en un centro de servicio de Internet que tiene en la misma zona donde vive, y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos mensuales ya que al trabajar para un colegio estatal tiene el salario mínimo nacional. . El análisis de crédito que efectuamos le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su actividad económica, la misma que le servirá para obtener ingresos y para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase phone stalls

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
K. Jamshed is 33 years old. He is married with three children.

Jamshed cooks kebab and other national meals like plov, lagman, and oriental dumplings. Jamshed is a very experienced cook. Currently he is renting a café but for 2 years he has safed money to purchase a private café. But he needs the additional funds for this. Jamshed requests $950.00 US dollars for the term of 12 months. Jamshed thanks everyone supporting him in his wish to run his own café and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase a private café.

loans.name: Hea

texts.en: Mrs. Hea S., 43, is a mother of four children and works as a housewife staying at home looking after the children and cooking food for the family members. Her husband Mr. Kong Kan, age 50, is a cow broker in the village, earning around $10 a day in revenue. One of their children is a construction worker and the rest are students. To expand the cow business, Mr Kan needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more cows for resell when the price is high.

loans.use: To purchase more cows for resale when the price is high.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Before becoming an entrepeneur, Adelaida worked during four years selling personal hygiene products in an itenerant market stall. Eleven years ago she began to manage the pharmacy.

Her husband is a registered nurse who decided to open a small pharmacy. According to Adelaida, her husband´s clients would visit his office at home and requested the prescriptions be sold in the same location. As time passed, the pharmacy grew along with her husband´s patients. Eventually, they decided that she would take care of the pharmacy which allowed her husband to take on a second job as a teacher in a local school.

In the future, Adelaida wants to expand her pharmacy by adding non-pharmaceutical products.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: To expand her pharmacy by adding non-pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Anorgul

texts.en:
Anorgul B. is 48 years old. She is married, and the couple has three children, only one of whom is still under their care. Anorgul has worked in agriculture for fifteen years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. She grows rice, wheat, peas and other crops. Each year Anorgul grows enough to feed the family and sells the surplus.

Anorgul’s husband, who appears in the photo, helps her sell the yield. The farm generates a steady income and with it Anorgul is able to support her family. Anorgul is asking for a loan of 1000$ US Dollars to be repaid over a term of 7 months. Anorgul would use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Anorgul thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan fully and on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Carmen sells typical products of the high plains in the Andes such as pasankalla, a local popcorn with a sugar coating, toasted noodles , toasted rice, etc. She has two children who can study because of her work. Some time ago she purchased a small house in the city of El Alto. She is a hardworking woman and punctual in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA CARMEN VEND. PRODUCTOS TIPICOS DEL ALTIPLANO COMO SER LA PASANKALLA, FIDEO TOSTADO, ARROZ TOSTADO, ETC, LA SEÑORA TIENE DOS HIJO UNO CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD LSO HACE ESTUDIAR Y HACE ALGUN TIEMPO SE COMPRO UN CASITA EN LA CIUDAD D. EL ALTO, ES UNA MUJER MUY TRABAJADORA Y PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married with two school-aged children. She is 32 years old and owns and operates a grocery shop in the local market. Vida sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, and biscuits. She wants a loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders to expand her business.

Vida hopes to increase her income from the expanded business in order to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the community trust group called “Ebe ba mu” (It shall come to pass.) The group guarantees loans through shared repayment pledges and provides assistance for members to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supply groceries such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, and evaporated milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Diatou D., 43 ans est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle souhaite un prêt pour renforcer son capital de commerce de tissus teints « Thioup », de tissus « Wax » et en même temps de bijoux de moindre qualité. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarisation de ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Diatou D., age 43, is married and the mother of eight children. She would like a loan to bolster her business capital for dyed "thioup" cloth, "Wax" fabrics, and at the same time, semi-precious gems or jewelry. This business will enable her to improve her living conditions in terms of health and schooling for her children. She is going to repay this loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by and resell dyed "thioup" cloth, gems, and "Wax" fabrics

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeu Y. is 26 years old and married with two children. She owns a stand near her town selling baby duck-eggs to people passing through. A baby-duck egg boiled up to 100 Celsius tastes very delicious and it's awesome with the tastes of liquid inside the egg. With her business activity, she can make around US$ 6/day of net income.

Moreover, Soeu Y.'s husband runs a carpentry shop producing wooden items such as tables, chairs, cabinets, wardrobes, and so on and he can typically make about US$ 10 each day in gross income.

Mrs. Soeu Y. has applied for a loan to expand her business. Any leftover money will be used to purchase a motor-bike to use for her business transportation needs.

loans.use: To expand her business and purchase a motor-bike to use for her business transportation

loans.name: Isabela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Isabela M. from Mbeya. She is married and has three children between the ages of one and five. Isabela owns and operates a small stall from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch, and then roasts and sells these fish. Fish are plentiful in the waters around the city and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet. She is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of $240. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more fish. Isabella thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Kokoudavi

texts.fr: Vivant actuellement dans le village, K. Kokoudavi est marié et père de trois enfants. Il fait le commerce des houes avec lesquelles les paysans labourent les champs. Il est agriculteur lui-même. Afin d’aider ces confrères dans leurs activités, il veut stocker des houes qui ne coûtent pas grand-chose en saison sèche et les revendre en saison des pluies où les houes coûtent extrêmement chères. Ce qui lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfices et ainsi améliorer la situation actuelle de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Currently living in the village, Kokoudavi K. is married and the father of three children. He sells hoes that the peasants use in the fields. He is a farmer himself. In order to help his fellow workers, he wants to stock up on hoes during the dry season when they are not expensive and sell them during the rainy season when hoes are extremely expensive. This will enable him to make a greater profit and improve his family’s current situation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of agricultural tools

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es: La Sr. Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 17 años de edad ambos los tiene estudiando, casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privado y doña Nolvia trabaja como supervisora. Los planes que tiene para su familia es dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para su futuro. El préstamo que se solicita es para terminar la construcción de su casa brindándole seguridad y protección. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic realizara sus planes y lograra mejorar su nivel de vida social.
texts.en:
Nolvia is 37 years old and lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children of 2 and 17 years old, both of whom she has studying. She is married and her husband works in a private business and Nolvia works as a supervisor. The plans that she has for her family is to leave her children with an inheritance for their future. The loan that she requests is to finish the construction of her house, bringing security and protection to her family. Thanks to the loans from AFODENIC (a Kiva field partner), she will accomplish these plans and will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish her house

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Lomé, Mme M. Aissatou est une revendeuse de produits de beauté. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer grâce  aux revenus de sa vente. En vue d’agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire sa  clientèle, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer ses activités en s’approvisionnant en marchandises. Les revenus tirés de ses affaires lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Lomé, Mrs. Aissatou M. sells beauty products. A married mother of three (3) children, she is able to contribute to the household expenses thanks to the income from her sales. With the aim of enlarging her business and better satisfying her clientele, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to strengthen her sales by supplying herself with merchandise. The income drawn from her business will allow her to better meet the needs of her family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty products

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mr. Moeun M. is a villager in the Ro Leak Village in the Kampong Cham Province. He is a director in the local school. Aside from this career, he is also a construction foreman. With this, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough construction supplies for his current job. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy those supplies. He hopes to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Vorn Un, is a housewife. Mr. Moeun M. is 61 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is a jewelry repairer while the other helps with the family business. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Samha

texts.en:
Samha owns a small charcoal store and is a cloth seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tujitegemee Group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Every day she works at her business from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and cloth for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Samha is 39 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 25, 22, 20, 16, 15, 10, 9, and 5.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and cloth for her business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella S. owns a small piggery. She is 32 years old and has 7 children. She has been in the hog raising business for 12 years now. From her business, she was able to pay for her family's needs as well as the tuition, books and miscellaneous fees of the schools. Her husband is a farmer. He grows rice to feed and clothe his family. Bella knows that they have to work hard for their family. She wants to have all her children graduate from college to be able to find better jobs in the future to support their future families. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 6 piglets and 7 sacks of feed. Some of the loan will go to her children's education. The loan will definitely help Bella expand her pig business and start a new one for additional income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 6 piglets and 7 sacks of feed.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Badenya, avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Mancourani  l’un des quartiers central de la ville de Sikasso (3e région du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités telles  l’achat vente de poissons, de fruits et légumes, de l’encens etc. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe. Tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs de 50 kg gousse   d’encens , 300kg de fruits,  500 kg de  légumes. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marche de Sikasso et dans les villages voisins avec les producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues en détail, au  grand marché de Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et l’investissement dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Badenya ambitionnent être chacune une commerçante grossiste à Sikasso.
texts.en:
The women of the Badenya group, with an average age of 38 and on average 2 children, live in traditional families in Mancourani, one of the centrally located neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third region of Mali).

They have various businesses, such as selling fish, fruit and vegetables, incense, etc. So as to satisfy the demand of their clientele, they work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 6th group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan, they expect to buy 5 50-kg sacks pods of incense, 300 kg of fruit, and 500 kg of vegetables. They do their buying at the big market of Sikasso and in neighboring villages from the farmers. The merchandise is sold retail, at the big market of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 12,000 F CFA which will be used for the needs of their family and for reinvesting into their businesses.

Each of the women of the Badenya group hopes to be a wholesale merchant in Sikasso.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is married with three children and her husband works as a mason. Since 1989, Paulina has traded goods such as clothing in Elmina.

Paulina will use the loan to purchase additional clothing to sell and, with her newly gained profits, plans to reinvest back into her business and also save some money for her future.

She was out of stock when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Edson

texts.es:
El señor Edson vive en casa propia en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como jefe de producción en una empresa grafica, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material de estudio en su rama gráfica y de esta manera mejorar su nivel de educación para poder percibir un sueldo mejor.

No es cliente de Impro, éste es su primer crédito, pero por el carácter social puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
Mr. Edson lives in his own home on Antofagasta Street in the Pasankeri neighborhood in La Paz. He works as a production manager in a graphics firm. The loan he's requesting is to purchase study materials in his graphics branch and to thus improve his level of education to obtain a better salary. He's not an IMPRO client. This is his first loan, but through his social character he can access one.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of study books in his field in order to improve his salary

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a tailor and she also sells drinks. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She hopes for the loan of N40,000 to purchase a sewing machine and more drinks. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more drinks

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: Eloina tiene 50 años de edad, vive modestamente en su casa propia donde tiene su taller instalado. Su familia tambien vive con ella y tambien sus nietos. Eloina tiene su taller de confeccion ubicado en su casa por lo que ya no tiene espacio para su trabajo por lo que esta construyendo un cuarto para su taller. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad y clientes fijos. El credito sera invertido en la construccion de su taller de confeccion.Es una buena cliente de agrocapital que cancela sus cuotas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
