Eloina is 50 years old, and lives modestly in her own house where she has her workshop installed. Her family also lives with her, as do her grandchildren. Eloina has a dressmaking workshop located in her house, because of which she now doesn't have room to work, so she is constructing a room for her workshop. She has many years of experience in dressmaking and secure clients. The loan will be invested in the construction of her workshop. She is a good client of Agrocapital who pays off her loans with punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
A. is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and their three children in Saida, southern Lebanon.

A. has owned a tow truck for nine years. He requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his truck. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

A. is special in his work because of his punctuality. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Добрая и трудолюбивая женщина с 20 летним стажем в сфере животноводства и переработки молока  Мамлакат Хочибоева подала заявку на КИВА, для того чтобы ее поддержали в сфере ее деятельности. Мамлакат запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони, и планирует потратить ее для откорма скота, за которым она ухаживает в домашних условиях. 
У  Мамлакат 6 детей, ее супруг Чуманазар работает преподавателем в местной школе. Его заработная плата составляет  всего  лишь 250 сомони, поэтому  дополнительно семья занимается сельским хозяйством, а Мамлакат животноводством и переработкой молока.
Ей помогают ее старшие дети.
texts.en:
Mamlakat H. is a kind and hard-working woman, who has 20 years of experience in the animal husbandry and milk processing fields. She put in this request to Kiva to get support in her business. Mamlakat is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni and is planning to use it for feeding livestock that she cares for at home. Mamlakat has 6 children, and her husband, Chumanazar works as a teacher at a local school. His salary is only 250 somoni. This is why the family is also involved in agriculture, and Mamlakat is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. Her older children help her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For livestock feeding

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a business trading chickens. Chicken is a delicacy in the Luhya community where she operates her business. Because she lacks capital, Eunice put a small shed just behind her house inside the Mumias sugar complex. Her dream is to expand to a bigger area.
She is married and has two children. Her chicken business has enabled her to transfer her children from a public school to private school. She now wants to borrow Kshs. 10,000 in order to increase her stock of chickens, as there is a ready market.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is one of FATEN’s long-term clients. She has taken at least seven loans from FATEN, and she repaid all her loans on time and in full.

Marina works out of her house and she does a lot of crafts like chocolate decoration for all events like christmas, weddings and new baby. Also she does wool-knitting for children and newborn babies in addition to embroidery.

Marina needs the loan to buy raw materials because if she buys a big quantity in cash she will get a better price for the materials.

Marina appears in the photo at her house with samples of her products.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials in bulk for her work

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S. is now 60 years old and already widowed. At her age she’ll never get tired of caring for her children although some of them are now having their own families. As a matter of fact, she’s also caring for the families of her children. She will help them as long as she can, especially in financial terms.

Before, Magdalena had no stable source of income, but when she became a member of Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she started her pig-raising business. She used the loan that she received in starting this business. Also she started a rice-retailing business because, in their place, most of her neighborhood can’t afford to buy a whole sack of rice. Instead, they can buy it on a retail basis (per kilo). In that way Magdalena can help her family because of the extra income while she also helps her neighborhood.

Now, Magdalena wants to use her second loan in ASHI to buy things that are needed for the improvement of her two businesses. She will buy a sack of rice, another piglet to raise, and the different pig-feeds and vitamins.

Magdalena hopes that her businesses become stable and that they will give them enough income for their big family. Most of her children now have their own families but two of them don’t have. She wants them to finish their studies so that their standard of living will change.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, another piglet, and pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is a woman of determination and has faith that she can escape poverty. She is a native of the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Elmer who is 49 years old. She is a mother to three, a daughter and two sons.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She decided to join ASHI because she needed working capital for her dying business of selling ready-to-wear clothes. When she received her previous loans, she carefully invested the money in her resale business. She now has regular customers and her business brings her enough income to provide for the needs of her family. She dreams of making her business grow, and she wants to invest more in this business.

Now on her third loan, Julieta is requesting an amount of 15,000 PHP as additional capital to pay for a variety of clothing to sell. She is positive that her business will grow now that she has the support of ASHI and the trust of KIVA lenders.

She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also hopes to renovate her house from the proceeds of her business.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Akpos

texts.en: E. has poultry and sells birds. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more poultry birds to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Jocebel

texts.en:
Jocebel A., 36 years old, is a farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She has seven children. Her eldest child is only 15. She works very hard from morning to sunset to maintain her farm and plant crops beside her rice farm. She says the farm would be better managed if there were enough funds to cover all the farming expenses. That is why she joined the credit program initiated by Community Economic Ventures, Inc. Now, she would like to apply again for a loan of 12,000 PHP. Receiving this loan will go far in improving her harvest.

She joined in CEVI in 2008. She has stayed in the program for quite a long time now because she likes the services offered by CEVI, and it has only a 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Julia Rosario

texts.es: La señora Julia Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Lideres II”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 04  hijos,  02 que aún dependen D. ella.Lleva 10 dedicándose a la venta D. pescado fresco, ubicada en el Mercado central D. su Distrito, llevada por la intención D. ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital D. S/.500 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que en la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad D.  especies.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprara pescado frescos en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los D. la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto D. su clientela. Julia Rosario, manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer a un grupo D. mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Julis Rosario, 50, is a member of the "Mujeres Lideres II" communal bank which is located in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of 4 children, two of whom still depend on her. For ten years she has sold fresh fish from a stall in the central market in her district. Inspired by the need to contribute to her family's income and having 500 soles that were very well invested, she is able still to be engaged in this business but now with a greater variety and quantities of species. With this 1,000 sol loan she means to buy kilograms of locally-produced fresh fish as well as fish from the country's coastal regions like: bocachico (a fresh-water, migratory fish), palometas (pomfret, an important food fish), toa, gamitada (a tasty river fish from the Amazon basin), tilapia, toyo, pejerrey (smelt), to keep her business well-stocked and satisfy her customers' demanding taste. Lulia Rosario is happy to belong to a group of women who have helped her overcome obstacles that at times arose but now she can face with great strength.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fresh fish.

loans.name: Lucia Gabriel

texts.pt:
Lúcia Gabriel C. nasceu em Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 17, 15, 11, 07, 03 anos de idade destes os 4 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família em Boane e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Mudou se de bairro de Mahubo para a sede Distrital de Boane em 1988 com a sua família, devido a guerra de desestabilização. Actualmente é negociante e dona do seu próprio negocio a mais de 10 anos, trabalha das 7h as 17h com ajuda de seus filhos. Vende mais amendoim, feijão manteiga, arroz e outros, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku quando inaugurou a sua sucursal de Boane e decidiu solicitar o seu primeiro empréstimo. Este é o seu 5º Empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, feijão manteiga, açúcar e outros) para reforçar o seu negócio. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 

No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder terminar a sua obra e adquirir mobiliário para a sua residência.
texts.en:
Lúcia Gabriel C. was born in Boane in the province of Maputo. She is 39; married; and the mother of 5 children who are 17, 15, 11, 7, and 3. Her three oldest children go to school. She only studied through 5th grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her family in Boane and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.

She moved from the neighborhood of Mahubo to the district of Boane in 1988 with her family due to the war that destabilized the country. She has now owned her own business for more than 10 years and works from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. with the help of her children. She sells peanuts, beans, butter, rice, and other products. She earns an income of 1,000 meticais per day which she puts towards her family's expenses and saves some in her bank account through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system).

She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku when the branch in Boane was inaugurated and she decided to request her first loan. This is her 5th loan and it is for 20,000 meticais. She will use it to buy products (peanuts, beans, butter, sugar, etc) to strengthen her business. Her previous loans were for 5,000, 8,000, 10,000, and 15,000 meticais, and they were all used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to be able to finish her home and to acquire furniture for it.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell food products (peanuts, margarine, etc.)

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale. Chona is just starting this business.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase livestock feed. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a 34-year-old rice farmer. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is now twenty years old. Juvy wants to give her kids a bright future. She tills her 1-hectare of rice field with patience. She makes sure weeds do not grow at her farm, to keep her crops growing healthy. Like any other farmer, she also wants to have an abundant harvest.

Juvy joined the Kiva field partner, CEVI, in the hope of having access to financial services. Her previous loans were used to finance her farm. Now she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to be used for her farm. This loan will help immensely to grow Juvy’s farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs in order to sit more customers in her restaurant.  Mary is 45 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs in order to sit more customers in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install a roof on his house.

loans.name: Tynymkan's Group

texts.en:
In general, women are considered to be strong and responsible, and their attitude to life is stable, even in difficulties. Here is a story about one woman, which is an example of bravery and self-confidence.
After her marriage, Tynymkan M. never dreamed she would suffer. As the eldest child in her family, she was responsible – and that is why she did not think much about marriage. However, kidnapping is common in the country; Tynymkan was kidnapped, but she still thought about her family and her brothers and sisters. Unless her siblings married, she took care of them. She also decided to take care of herself because she was getting older.
Finally, Tynymkan gave birth, little knowing that her happiness would not last much longer. Her husband died the same year from a heart attack. At that moment, it seemed her life was totally destroyed. However, her child motivated her to move on. Her son became an adult and graduated from university. But life is very cruel, and on the way home, he fought with a group of scum who mutilated him forever. He is now 40 years old and an invalid.
The situation was unimaginable. However, Tynymkan took a loan of 15,000 KGS and bought three sheep for fattening and reselling. Now her life is not so bad, and she is requesting another loan to increase her number of cattle in order to sell them and help her child.

Aynagul B. is 39 and married. She has five children, and her husband works as a welder for a company. Her elder daughter works in a café as a waitress while the rest are still at home. Five years ago, they bought some cattle with her husband's salary and began their business. They are planning to increase their number of cattle so that they can educate their children. They want to take a loan in order to buy fodder.

Aynur J. is 39, a widow, and has two children who both attend the local school. She is planning to apply for a job and marry successfully. She is requesting a loan for dental treatment.

Aygul J. is 38, married, and has five children. Her husband works as a driver in a company. She wants a loan to buy building materials in order finish their house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen L. D. M. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Osicala, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, y dos hijos D. 8 y 5 cinco años D. edad, y una pequeña niña D. 1 año D. edad. Carmen se dedica a la venta D. productos plásticos, como depósitos para comida, o para agua como también pequeñas sillas. Así mismo venD. deferentes tipos D. cosméticos. Todos estos productos los comercializa D. manera ambulante, obteniendo ganancias diarias, las cuales en su mayoría son invertidas en su familia y en el hogar, situación la cual le impiD. en gran manera invertir en el negocio, lo que le dificulta crecer. Es por esta razón por la cual Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo a Integral, D. manera que pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. cosméticos, D. manera que tenga la capacidad D. ofrecer diferentes tipos y precios D. maquillajes, lo cual le permita abarcar más clientela. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza a diario por el bienestar D. su familia, ya que ella desea poder darles todo lo mejor a sus tres hijos, D. manera que nunca les haga falta lo más básicos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old and lives in the municipality of Osicala, located in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and two sons, ages 8 and 5, and baby daughter, age 1. Carmen sells plastic products, such as food or water storage containers. She also sells small chairs and different types of cosmetics. She sells all of these products on foot, making a daily income, most of which she must spend on her family and on household expenses. This makes it difficult for her to invest in her business and making it difficult for her to grow it. For this reason, Carmen is requesting a loan through Integral, so that she can have the necessary funds to buy cosmetics in bulk, so that she can offer various types at various prices, allowing her to attract more customers. Carmen works hard every day for the well-being of her family. She would like to give only the best to her three children and ensure that they are never in need of their basic requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 51 years old and is married with two children who are above the age of school.

Hawa sells charcoal to earn a living and has been involved in this business for ten years. She also rears animals to earn extra income. She was previously running a retail shop before she ventured into these businesses.

Hawa has previously taken three loans from Faulu Kenya to expand her business and for household expenses. She hopes to expand her business and improve her living standard in the future.

Hawa has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary S., a 45-year-old resident of Trapeang Chrey village in Kandal Province, owns a 1.50 hectare field upon which he cultivates rice. He currently lacks sufficient funds to support the farm and is therefore requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field. His wife, Mrs. Pov Yinh, stays at home and takes care of their two children, one a seamstress in a garment factory, the other a student in the local school. Sary's wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 4 ciclos de funcionamiento. Las socias se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Inquilpata, la comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.    

Carmen Rosa, tiene 31 años, es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos y es natural de la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos gallinas, chanchos y patos. Primero los cría, los alimenta y después los vende en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Carmen Rosa es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar animales como por ejemplo cuyes que le cuesta 10 soles el par y después los vende  cada uno a 20 soles, ella manifiesta que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación que brinda la Asociación.  

Carmen Rosa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Maria de Inquilpata”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. This Communal Bank has been in operation for the past four loan cycles. The members meet every 30 days in the community of Inquilpata, which is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Carmen Rosa is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. She is a native of the community of Inquilpata in the District of Anta, Department of Cusco. Her main business activity is raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and ducks. After raising and feeding them, she sells the animals at “El Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata” in Anta every Friday.

Carmen Rosa is a hardworking and enterprising mother who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed. Through her daily efforts, she is able to support her family. She needs a loan to buy animals. For example, a pair of guinea pigs costs 10 PEN and she can sell each one for 20 PEN. She says she is happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, and training that Asociación Arariwa has provided.

Carmen Rosa is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Purevchuluun

texts.en:
Purevchuluun S., 33, is married and is the mother of three daughters. She and her family live together in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia and have been living together in their current home for eight years. Her oldest two daughters, aged 9 and 7, attend a local primary school.

Purevchuluun operates a beauty products trading business in her town. She started her business in 2001 with a working capital of 150,000 MNT. With a lot of hard work and determination, today her working capital is 800,000 MNT. She has gained valuable experience and has built a loyal customer base over the past nine years. The whole family supports her business.

Since Purevchuluun started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her children's education fees. She is an open and very hardworking person.

Purevchuluun would like to expand her business and create her own convenient workplace in the future. She has requested an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her beauty products trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Nidia Isabel

texts.es: Nidia Isabel es una persona muy carismática, ella tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad es venta de repostería y comida. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella se siente satisfecha por lo que ha logrado. Es jefa de su negocio y toma muy buenas decisiones, es por ello que sus ventas van mejorando además sus clientes se van satisfechos por sus deliciosos platillos. Su clave de éxito es hacer los preparativos desde las 4:00 de la mañana y su punto de venta se encuentra en su propio hogar. Este es el motivo del  financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas, pollo, harina entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con mejorar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia Isabel is a charismatic person. She has two children and all of them work selling desserts and food. Nidia started this business more than 13 years ago. She is satisfied with what she has accomplished. She runs her own business and makes good decisions, and because of this her sales have improved and her customers are satisfied with her delicious food. The key to her success is preparing her dishes starting at 4:00 in the morning, and she sells her products out of her home. This loan will be used to purchase supplies like different grains, juices, soda, chicken, flour, and other foodstuffs. She dreams every day of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for restaurant/bakery

loans.name: Phai

texts.en: Mrs. Phai Y. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is a big pot and tamarind seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ron Yi, is a horse cart driver who supports the family through his small income. In order to make her transportation easier, Mrs. Phai Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle. This couple has a child who is just two years old.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Sok Khom's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people who live in Reang Chuor village in Kandal province. Mrs. S. Khom P. is the group leader, selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Sovannara Cheng, are farmers who own more than five hectares of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. To improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. S. Khom P. is asking for a loan to buy soil to fill in the front yard. She is the mother of two children who both attend the local public school. On the day of the loan disbursement Mrs. S. Khom P. was busy working. Instead, her husband, Mr. Sovannara Cheng, received the loan for her. The photo above includes Mrs. S. Khom P.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill in the front yard

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida J. is a 43 year old woman who runs her men's clothes business and has been doing this for the past years. She rents a shop in Agsu central bazaar. She brings clothes from Baku city, which is about 1.5 hours away from her home. She goes for a trip every month and her current income is 180-200 AZN per month. Khalida is married and has three children. She has applied for 1000 AZN in order to increase her profit and to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her income.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas junto a su esposa tienen 4 niños menores de edad de los cuales cuidan a diario. Sus inicios se dan por que ninguno de los dos tenía experiencia profesional y juntos deciden iniciar este medio de vida para generar ingresos para su hogar, pues siempre están pensando en sus hijos que necesitan  estudios y otras cosas que son muy importantes. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de maíz, comal, bolsas, cal entre otras cosas necesarias para la elaboración de sus tortillas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y poder obtener una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Maria Ines is 37 years old. She has a business selling tortillas. She and her husband have 4 dependent children, who they care for daily. Their business came about because neither of them had professional experience. Together they decided to start this way of making a living to generate income for their home, since they are always thinking about their children and their need for schooling and other very important things. The loan they are requesting is for the purchase of corn, a comal (a ceramic dish or metal hotplate used for cooking tortillas), bags, lime and other items they need to make their tortillas. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to open a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is a married woman who is 35 years old. She has four children who are between 4 and 15 years of age. She is married to a businessman and their four kids all go to school.

Julienne owns a small shop where she sells household items. With this loan, she hopes to reinvest in her business by buying more household items and by buying beans, which she has not sold before. She is also thinking of having a bar in the future when she gets more profits in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying more household items for her shop

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Señora  Bertha vive en  casa propia  en el Barrio Primero D. Mayo, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta D. ropa principalmente  variedad D. chompas y otros desD. hace tres años en un carrito, en el mercado la cancha, no tiene puesto fijo, este crédito es para la compra D. variedad D. ropa D. temporada, su mercadería la compra en la ciudad D. la Paz, viaja hasta la ciudad a realizar sus compras y a veces compra D. Paceñas que llegan a la ciudad para vender al por mayor, su esposo también es comerciante ellos  trabajan con capital separado, la Sra. Bertha es muy trabajadora y responsable y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha lives in her own home in the neighborhood of “Primero D. Mayo” (First of May). She has three children and earns her living by selling clothes, primarily sweaters and other garments. For the past three years, she has been selling her merchandise out of a small cart at the La Cancha Market since she does not have a permanent stand.

With this loan, she will buy a variety of seasonal clothing. Bertha acquires her merchandise in the city of La Paz, so she must travel to that city to purchase these items. Occasionally she buys in the city of Paceñas, where she goes to sell her products at wholesale. Her husband is also a merchant, but they both have their separate capital from which they work. Sra. Bertha works extremely hard and is responsible. She expresses her appreciation for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. sells provisions, banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) and rice at Elmina. She has received senior high education. She is a widow and has eight dependents.

Adjoa has been selling provisions, banku and rice for two years and responsibly takes care of her family with the income she gets from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Garcés del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito con mayor población de la región Lambayeque, es a su vez el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la venta de frutas en el Mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado mayorista de la región) ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de frutas de estación como manzanas, mandarinas, peras, etc. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y le hace sentirse activa y útil a su familia. Actualmente cuenta con clientela fija y es conocida en el rubro.

Dina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más frutas de modo que pueda surtir su negocio con frutas de temporada como fresas y naranjas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Dina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que diariamente se esfuerza en su negocio para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Dina is a 47 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and two children in the Garcés area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It's the most populated district in the Lambayeque region. It is also the district with the highest poverty rates, and is characterized as a commercial area. 

For four years she has been selling fruit in the Moshoqueque market (the regions's wholesale market). She offers her customers every type of fruit in season such as apples, tangerines, pears, etc. The business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses and it makes her feel active and useful in her family. At present she has regular customers and she is known in the area. 

Dina wants to grow her business by buying more fruit so that she can supply her business with seasonal fruit such as strawberries and oranges. To meet her goal, she has found it in her  best interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a  loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

Dina is a very hardworking woman who works hard every day at her business to continue helping her family get ahead. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa previously and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible when it comes to making his payments.

loans.use: To purchase fruit in season to grow her business selling in the market.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Hazel es una  mujer, dedicada al comercio,  de venta de ropa nueva y ropa usada, en su casa de habitación, desde hace dos años, iniciando con dinero propio de su liquidación como conserje de un hospital. Pues por ser de edad avanzada renuncio, con el objetivo de poner su propio negocio.
Pues siempre ha tenido otros ingresos ya que lleva varios años alquilando un cuarto, lo que ha ayudado a sus cuatro hijos. 
Para aumentar la inversión busca financiamiento, lo que ha venido a comprar más ropa variada, como suéteres, sabanas, que se vende mucho por tener un precio accesible y por ser de buena calidad.
Afodenic ha sido quien ha dado la oportunidad de crecer en venta, lo que se ha beneficiado ya que ha logrado el crecimiento. Con este préstamo comprara dos pacas de ropa y ropa interior nueva.
texts.en:
Hazel is a business woman who has been selling clothing both new and used from her home for the past 2 years. She started out with her own capital funds, from a separation package she received from her past work as a janitor in the hospital.  Given her advanced age she quit that job and set up a business of her own instead. She has always had other sources of income. She has many years renting out a room in her house and this have helped to provide for her four children. 

She wishes to expand her business and to this end she seeks a loan. She will purchase a variety  of clothing items such as sweaters and shirts, items that sell very well for its comfortable  pricing and good quality. 

Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has given her the opportunity to increase her sales and it has been of great personal benefit. This loan will be used to purchase two loads of clothing and new undergarments.

loans.use: To purchase two loads of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wilmer Iban

texts.es:
Wilmer Iban G. G. tiene 33 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 2 hijos.

Wilmer pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Wilmer el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y hacer una casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Wilmer Iban G. G. is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. He has two children.

Wilmer is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Wilmer is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. He purchases his supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in his community. Wilmer is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of his family. His dreams include buying land and building a house.

Wilmer enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Nueva Integracion Group

texts.es: Emily es una señorita de 23 años y la secretaria del grupo “Nueva Integración”, la cual está soltera y desde muy pequeña le gusto ser la profesora en los juegos de niños, ahora a su edad ha seguido con esta vocación la cual le ah llevado a estudiar en la Universidad de “La CANTUTA”, indica que desde que salió de la escuela ha trabajado en el “I.E.P. EULE” animada por su tía, lleva ya 6 años trabajando en la escuela y con los prestamos de Edaprospo paga sus estudios y últimamente ha comprado una moto la cual hace taxi en la zona y lo trabaja su papá. El grupo lleva 2 años de conformados y van en su cuarto préstamo, pero Emily se ha adherido al grupo hace un mes, junto a ella son nueve los integrantes de este grupo que  debe su nombre a la zona en la que viven “Nueva Alianza” y que están felices por contar con la ayuda de Edaprospo y el capital que les brinda para mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
Emily is an unmarried 23-year-old who is secretary of the “Nueva Integracion” (New Integration) Group.  From a very early age, in childhood games she always wanted to be the teacher.  Now at her present age, she has pursued this vocation, which led her to study in the University of “La Cantuta”.  This has meant that since leaving school, Emily has worked in the “I.E.P. “EULE”, motivated by her aunt.  Emily has worked in that school for 6 years, and she paid for her studies with loans from Edaprospo.  And now, finally, she has purchased a scooter to serve as a taxi in the zone and her father drives it.

The group has existed for 2 years and is in its 4th loan cycle.  But Emily has only belonged to the group for a month.  She is one of 9 members of the group, which owes its name to the zone they live in, “New Alliance”.  

They are happy to count on the help of Edaprospo and the capital it offers to improve their lives.

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is a widow taking care of four children. She makes corn dough for sale in Elmina. Ama uses her income to provide for the basic needs of her family. She is asking to use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare corn dough to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare corn dough

loans.name: Mrs. Muong Sam Oeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong S. O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the nine members of this loA. group who will each use their portion of the loA. for different purposes. All the members who make up this village bank loA. are located in Prey Khla village, Takeo province. 

Mrs. Muong S. O. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow both rice and bananas on to sell to support her family while her husband is a laborer who earns a small salary to support his family, too. In the rice field, it is time to grow rice but she has little money for this purpose. To improve production, Mrs. Muong S. O. is asking for a loA. to do farming. She will use any remainder of the loA. to buy a bicycle for her children to ride to school. She is a mother of five children all of whom are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To do farming

loans.name: Alvin Xandrell

texts.en:
Alvin Xandrell C. is from the village of Brgy. Banganan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 19 years old. Alvin Xandrell is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Alvin Xandrell owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Alvin Xandrell has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP when he sells one of his raised animals.

In 2009, Alvin Xandrell joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alvin Xandrell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell. Alvin Xandrell is requesting a new loan of 34000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Alvin Xandrell from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of  his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 18 años, es un joven emprendedor que siempre ha querido trabajar para tener su propio dinero por eso su primer trabajo fue vender legumbres en un mercado ubicado en el bloque 6 de “Flor de Bastión”. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana trabaja ahora en su propia tienda ya que el esfuerzo que dio hace años atrás le ha dado resultados no solo con su dedicación sino también con la ayuda de su papa que realiza esta actividad de vender víveres. Actualmente trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 12h00 del medio día. Vende víveres como arroz, legumbres, granos, aceite etc. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio para seguir reuniendo dinero por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, legumbres. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con abundante mercadería.
texts.en:
Mario, age 18, is an enterprising young man.  He has always wanted to work to have his own money.  His first job was selling vegetables in a market at block 6 of Flor de Bastión.

Living in a periuban zone, he now works in his own store.  The effort that he made years ago has given him results.  With dedication and help from his father he sells provisions.

He currently works from 5:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.   He sells provisions like rice, vegetables, grains, and oil, etc.  He wants to continue with his business in order to keep on saving money.  He wants to use the loan to buy rice and vegetables.  In the future he wants to expand his business with abundant merchandise.

loans.use: Rice and vegetables

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over ten years, she has operated a cashew nuts sales business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanatumu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be a reliable seller of cashew nuts in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a taxi driver living and working in Rafah in Gaza Strip. Muhammad has been driving a taxi for nine years now in the city of Rafah. He is the father of one daughter and three sons. Muhammad wants to pay his car license renewal fees and make a few repairs on the car to keep it in good shape.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in front of his house.

loans.use: For license renewal fees and car repair

loans.name: Korb

texts.en:
Mrs. Korb V. works as a recycle materials seller and a pig breeder to earn money to support her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sophen Heng, is a fisherman and a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. 

In the rice field, the couple has a problem because the land has infertile soil.  To improve their rice production, Mrs. Korb V. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for their rice farm, and to buy more recycle materials for resale. 

Mrs. Korb V. is a mother of three children, two are students and the youngest one is still only 2 years old. She was born in 1983. She and her family are living in Pongro village in Takeo province. Her husband is pictured in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luis es comerciante de golosinas (dulces) las mismas reparte en tiendas y colegios de la ciudad de La Paz; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de gran variedad de dulces y chicles (chewing gums), pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos. Vive en alquiler en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciado y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Luis is a candy merchant who distributes his products to stores and schools in the city of La Paz.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a wide variety of candy and chewing gum.  This business provides a source of income to cover his children’s expenses.  Luis lives in a rental property in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced and has four children.

loans.use: To purchase candy and chewing gum in bulk.

loans.name: Marriane

texts.en:
Marriane is 35 years old, married and has five children. Her oldest child is 12 years old.

Marriane is a farmer. She has been growing rice and corn for eleven years now. She sells her harvest to the market. Marriane works hard for her family. She wants her children to finish college and have bright futures.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old engaged woman from Lebanon. She is living on her own. She has been working as a private teacher since 2001. She likes her occupation because she feels that she is helping the students to get the needed education. She mostly receives students at her house. She has been active in this profession for the past 15 years and she works hard to be able to handle the heavy life expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to arrange a special room with all the necessary educational equipment so that she can work with students properly. She is a very careful woman and has special concern for children’s education.

loans.use: to arrange a special room with all the necessary educational  equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, beans and cooking utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta lives the village of Ciriaco Pastrano, Oroquieta City. She is 59 years old, married and has five grown children. For the last ten years she has made a living by running a general store where she earns about 2,000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Modesta is applying for her second loan from PMPC, for 14,900 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue she makes from this loan to continue expanding her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 33 años, vive con sus hijos y su madre,tiene casa propia que cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el caserío La Payesa que pertenece al distrito de Túcume a una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

María se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino (ovejas) desde hace 3 años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas están en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de las distintas ciudades.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta de sus ovejas, podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia. 

A solicitado un préstamo María a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para  comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados para sus animales  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de los mismos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea quesu negociocada vez crezca  para poderles dar otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, 33, is a mother living with her children and her mother.  She has a house of her own that only has electricity located in Payesa which is part of Túcume District and is located an hour from Lambayeque Department.  This zone is dedicated to farming, cattle raising, crafts and tourism.

María has been raising sheep for the last three years.  The corral where her sheep are is in her back yard.  She raises her animals with balanced feed like natural grasses and once they reach optimum size and weight she sells them in markets in various cities.  With money she gets from the sale of her sheep she will be able to meet her daily household and family expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan through the Seed Capital program to buy more animals and balanced feed for them thus assuring good growth and weight gain for them and a better quality of life for her family.

María is well known in the area for being a hard working person who with much dedication hopes to see her business grow in order to be able to provide her children with other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Maksatbu's Group

texts.en:
Maksatbu, 42, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul and has 8 children. Very few of her female acquaintances have a college education or work in a high position. Maksatbu also wasn’t lucky enough to get educated and work for the sake of society. However, eight years ago she made an important decision, and, thanks to that, her life took a different direction. She rented a small space in a nearby market and stocked it with a variety of consumer goods to sell. Maksatbu values the quality of the product much more than its price. She realized that she was right when more and more customers got attracted to her unique goods of a high quality. 

The initial capital was 30,000 soms, which was alot for Maksatbu eight years ago. Nevertheless, she managed the business well and receives a profit of 10,000 soms monthly. She hopes to increase the goods circulation in the near future. 

The loan from Kiva will help her increase her range of goods and help her purchase an automobile from the generated profit. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits génériques (paracetamol, efféralgan, nifluril). Ayaba est mère de 01 enfant. Elle a ouvert  sa boutique en 2008 pour venir en aide aux populations. Ce prêt l’aidera à renforcer son activité. Elle s’approvisionne dans une société de produits génériques.
texts.en: A retailer of generic pharmaceuticals (Paracetamol, Efféralgan, Nifluril), Ayaba is the mother of one child. She opened her shop in 2008 in order to help people. This loan will help her to bolster her business. She is supplied from a generic products company.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 61 years old and married with six children. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past twenty years and also buys and sells rice grain and livestock.

Milagros has already borrowed and repaid fifteen loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to stock in her store.

loans.name: Badiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badiya (qui veut dire parenté en Mandingue) a été créé le 15 Juin 2009 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 27 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier, solidarité et entre aide caractérise ce groupe. Elles ont des restaurants et font du petit commerce.

Madame Yandé (debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite) est responsable. Elle est âgée de 35 ans, est célibataire et sans enfant cependant elle prend en charge sa mère  et ses sœurs.


Elle est gestion d’un restaurant dans son quartier, activité qu’elle exerce depuis trois ans.

Son  nouveau prêt va lui permettre de renforcer son activité par l’achat  d’un stock de riz et divers produits pour son restaurant.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’augmenter son épargne en partie et de améliorer les conditions de vie de sa mère et de ses sœurs.
texts.en:
The Badiya (meaning 'relations' in Mandinka) group was created on 15 June 2009 after the launch of their local village loan fund. It comprises 27 women who all live in the same area; solidarity and mutual help characterize this group. The members have restaurants and run small retail businesses.

Ms. Yandé (standing fifth from the left in the photo) is the leader. She is 35 years old, unmarried, and has no children, but takes care of her mother and her sisters.

She has been managing a restaurant in her area for three years.

Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business by stocking rice and various products for her restaurant.

The profits will serve in part to increase her savings and to improve the living conditions of her mother and her sisters.

loans.use: To strengthen her business by stocking rice and various products for her restaurant.

loans.name: Romulo Jorge

texts.es: Rómulo   tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos la cual sigue apoyando al  menor de ellos, Rómulo trabaja como hornero en una panadería  donde lleva 4 años laborando en dicho rubro, también nos cuenta que es músico la cual trabaja por contratos en diversos eventos como fiestas patronales o cumpleaños, gracias a su trabajo ha mejorado su vivienda y ha podido ayudar a sus hijos con sus  estudios. El sueño de Rómulo es instalar su propio negocio de pastelería en su vivienda para así generar más ingreso para su familia. Con el préstamo que adquirió piensa comprarse una máquina para la preparación de sus pasteles. Rómulo agradece a los prestamistas KIVA ya que hacen posible el inicio de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rómulo is 53 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children. He continues to support his youngest child. Rómulo works in a bakery and has been in this profession for four years. In addition, he is a musician and works on contract for different events such as the patron saint festivals and birthday parties. Thanks to his efforts, he has been able to make improvements to his home and help his children with their education. His dream is to establish his own pastry business at home so that he can generate more income for his family.

With the loan he requested, Rómulo plans to buy a machine for making his pastries. He is grateful for the Kiva loans that have made it possible for him to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for making pastries.

loans.name: Zaverio

texts.en: Zaverio is 67 years old and is married with five children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family and educate his children. For fifteen years, he has been growing onions amidst the challenges of price fluctuations. He seeks to diversify his business to grow sweet potatoes so as to target the school and prison markets. Zaverio needs the loan to grow sweet potatoes.

loans.use: To clear land to grow sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a freezer so she can start selling frozen foods.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOUTOURA est composé de 4 femmes mariées et d’une veuve, qui ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles nucléaires. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura à BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de savons, d’habits, de chaussures, de bois de chauffe etc. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
La présidente BINTOU est assise devant les autres membres s’est spécialisée dans l’achat vente de savons de toutes sortes. Avec ce prêt BINTOU compte acheter, 4  cartons de savons de fabrication moderne. 
Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI pour ensuite les revendre  dans le quartier Massabla coura en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The group SOUTOURA is composed by four married women and a widow, who are in average 34 years of age, have five children and live in nuclear families. These women live in the neighborhood of  Massablacoura in BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They are related through family and neighborhood ties .
In order to satisfy their customers demand and increase the level of their activity, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and get into the business of trading with soaps, clothes, shoes, firewood, etc. This is their second group loan and the previous one was punctually repaid. 
Bintou, the president of the group, is sitting in front of the other members; she is specialized in sale and purchase of soaps of all kinds. With this loan Bintou is buying four boxes of modern manufacturing soap.
She gets her supplies in BOUGOUNI and then resells them in the district of Massablacoura, detailing, cash and credit, to male and female customers.
With this loan she plans to achieve a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Abadahemuka/kzr Group

texts.fr:
Theophile fait partie du groupe Abadehemuka et sur la photo est le monsieur qui a de l'argent. Le nom du groupe signifie « les fideles ». Il a 45 ans. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 15 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Theophile est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Dans les prochaines années, Theophile voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Theophile belongs to the Abadehemuka group and is the man holding the money in the photo. The name of the group means "the faithful." He is 45 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 2 and 15, of whom five are in school. His own level of education includes six years of primary school.

Theophile is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use is loan to buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice.

In the coming years, Theophile would like to be the best farmer in his valley. With his profits, he intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Lucia Hermita

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer trabajadora que decidió hace 7 años atrás tener un pequeño negocio de confección de ropa ya que tuvo la oportunidad de tener una maquina industrial usada para arreglarla y así  comenzar con su negocio para poderle dar más tiempo a su familia. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos con un préstamo para comprar materiales y telas para confeccionar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere tener un taller grande y dar empleo a otras mujeres para mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking woman who decided to start a small clothes making business seven years ago because she was presented with the opportunity to get a used industrial sewing machine, repair it and start the business so that she could spend more time with her family.  Gradually, her income improved.

She has many goals for her business so she wants to improve her income with a loan to buy fabric and supplies to make more clothes.  In the future, she’d like to have a large workshop and employ other women to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: C5624 Abunzubumwe Group

texts.en:
Vestine is 54 years old and is a widow with six children between the ages of 17 and 24. She is a businesswoman selling charcoal. Vestine is also the leader of this group, which is called "Abunzubumwe" in the local language. Vestine employs two persons to help her and she has eleven years of experience. She starts her work at 7:00 a.m and works until 6:00 p.m every day. She is the first person on the left in the picture.

Vestine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. Once their businesses have expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and save money for their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bart

texts.en:
Bart is a 37-year-old divorced man with five children. 

He has been in the retail shop business for six months after diverting from the carpentry business. 

His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock, and his goals are educating children and building a permanent house.

Bart needs the loan to buy bread, eggs and detergent for sale.

loans.use: to buy bread, eggs and detergent.

loans.name: Sajida Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Sajida Perveen is 41 years old, a housewife, and spends her time at home managing her household responsibilities. Her husband operates a used clothing business. He purchases used clothes from the clothes market and sells the items to his customers at a profit.

Sajida is the mother of three daughters and three sons. She knows very well the importance of education, and all of her children are literate. Her eldest daughter has completed her BSC degree and joined the nursing profession, while her elder son works with his father in his business. He has also completed his education through the 10th standard. Her remaining four children are currently in school.

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help further the expansion of her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase used clothes in bulk. Doing so will allow him to offer more variety to his customers, thereby increasing his sales and profits. 

Sajida's husband is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Sajida is hopeful that the loan investment will improve it further.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José solicita un crédito para realizar compostura a una de sus maquinas de impresión y además comprar de materia prima como es tinta y papel, así podrá darles un buen servicio a sus clientes. 
Don José  tiene su negocio desde hace doce años y su esposa le ayuda atendiendo el negocio cuando el sr José esta realizando los trabajos que tiene que entregar. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to have one of his printing machines fixed and to buy raw materials for his activity such as ink and paper in order to offer a good service to his customers.
José has been running his activity for twelve years, and his wife helps him by working in the shop when José is preparing the orders he needs to deliver.
He intends to repay the loan with part of the income he earns from his activity, which is the main source of income he has to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to pay for the fixing of one printing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flowers for resale.

loans.name: Lias

texts.en:
Lias, 51, is a married woman who resides in Reussey Keo, a suburb of Phnom Penh city. She lives there with her two single children and sells mixed products from a general store next to her house.  In her store, she sells many products such as sweet things, groceries, soft drinks, ice, snacks, canned foods and other household products, which yields a profit of $2.00 per day.   She also depends on her daughter’s income, who works in a coffee shop, to cover daily financial necessities.

Lias is asking for a loan amount of US$800 to purchase a motorcycle to give possible transport service for her family.  In the future, she hopes to expand her store and sell more kinds of merchandise.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for her family

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es chofer propietario afiliado en uno de los Sindicatos de Choferes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es para la compra de motor para su vehiculo, pues el actual está fallando constantemente. Francisco es soltero y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la zona  de Senkata  de la Ciudad de El Alto. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados anteriormente (son dos, pagados en su totalidad) ya que le ayudaron a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Es la primera vez que solicita que su crédito sea enviado a kiva.
texts.en:
Francisco is a driver/owner affiliated with one of the city of La Paz’s taxi driver syndicates.  The loan is to buy a motor for his vehicle, which now is constantly faltering.

Francisco is single, and he has one child.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Senkata area of the city of El Alto.

He is very happy with the previous loans given to him (there were two, paid in full).  The loans helped him increase his income and therefore helped his family.  

This is the first time that he wants his loan request sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his vehicle that he uses to transport passengers.

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Aura Luz se dedica a la actividad de docencia en el municipio de Achuapa la cual habita ahí mismo desde hace muchos años, tiene mucha experiencia en este ramo en la enseñanza a los niños.

Es madre de dos hijos los cuales ha formado exitosamente ya que son personas de bien al igual que ella los que ya no tiene a su cargo porque son independientes. 

Actualmente, está solicitando su tercer crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda el cual será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, arena, tejas, cemento, alfajillas y pago de mano de obra con el fin de seguir ampliando su vivienda y mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Luz has lived in Achuapa for many years.  She is a teacher there with many years of teaching local children behind her now.

She is the mother of two grown children both successful because--like her--they are useful members of society.  

Sra. Aura Luz is applying for a loan to improve her house.  She plans to pay for construction materials--bricks, sand, tiles, cement, wood, etc.--and labor to add on to her house.  She wants to make the investment because it will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor to improve her house.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: El Joven Rodrigo es un joven emprendedor, soltero su domicilio se encuentra en la zona Barrientos,  vive en la casa de sus abuelos  hace 10 años,  se dedica al comercio de zapatillas, sandalia de mujer y hombre, tiene su puesto en  el mercado de la zona, realiza su venta  6 veces a la semana menos los días sábados, los días de feria en la localidad de  sacaba son  los días jueves y domingo, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería en zapatos por mayor  para estas fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, esta es la única actividad de joven que le ayuda a mantenerse y mantener a sus abuelos, a pesar de ser tan joven tiene que correr con la responsabilidad e ver a su abuelos, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is an enterprising young man.  He is single, and his home is in the Barrientos zone.  He has lived in his grandparents’ house for ten years.  He sells women’s and men’s shoes and sandals.  He has a stall at the market that is in the zone.

He makes his sales six times a week, but not on Saturdays.  Thursdays and Sundays are the local fair days.

He will use the loan to buy wholesale footwear for the festivities this Christmas and New Year .

This is the only activity that he has to help support himself and his grandparents.  In spite of being so young, he has to bear the responsibility and see to his grandparents.  

He is very grateful for the opportunity being given to him through this loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 24, all of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman.

Rebecca has been selling palm oil and plantains for the past 20 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from him. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and plantains for her business.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is 26 years old. She has a little baby. She is a carpenter. She gains from it 4,000,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.
 Quyet is 50 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise pigs.

loans.use: to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for enlarging her carpentry studio and raising her children up.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is 29 years old. She is smart and higher educated person. Nilufar is widowed. Her husband was dead one year ago. Nilufar up brings 2 little children. She is a teacher. She works in a school as a teacher more than 10 years. She is one of the best teachers. Nilufar needs to financial support because her son is ill. He is one year old. Nilufar is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her little son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her little son

loans.name: Jinja Progressive School Boy's Section

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Swaibu. He is the Director of Jinja Progressive Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Jinja with 2500 students. Jinja Progressive Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school requires two systems due to the high population; one will be installed in the dining hall and another in the boy’s dormitory. This loan will be used to install the first system in the dormitory section. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jinja Progressive Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Swaibu ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
