Melecio P. is a tailor from Guayaquil, Ecuador. After successfully paying back his first loan, his is asking for a second loan in order to keep growing his business at the rate he has been going the past six months. With his first loan, Melecio bought essential goods like thread, fabric, and a glass case to exhibit his work.

Mr. P.’s wife acts as his right-hand and helps sew, conduct sales, and purchase wholesale products for custom orders. He was also able to repair one of his sewing machines, which is now used by his wife, who is a seamstress, to help him make suits for his clients. With his increased income, he was able to pay for his son to take a computer course at the Mifex MERIT Center. In fact, his son is putting his new skills to use by offering services to the community, such as typing documents and other computer-related work on a new computer that was installed in his father's shop. He repaid his loan on time, and is now in need of a new loan in order to keep his business growing the way it has been for the past six months. He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy requests from his clientele.

With over 20 years experience making suits, Melecio has come to understand what it takes to be successful. He believes with this extended access to credit, he can continue to provide a better life for his six children, who also help run the tailor shop when they have free time.

loans.use: He plans to increase his inventory and stock up on new fabrics like cotton and wool as well zippers, buttons, and measuring tools to satisfy custom requests from his clientele.

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan is low income person from Kedabek district of Azerbaijan. He is Married and has four children. He came to Baku in 1990. In 1994 he started his business. He wants to receive a loan of $1200 from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Mai has 2 children, 42 and 36. Miss Anh, her first daughter, was married and has 2 children, who are twins. Miss Vui, Mrs. Mai’s second daughter, is  mentally retarded. Mrs. Mai lives together with her two daughters in a hut. Mrs. Mai is old, 82, but she still works to sell confections at her hut. The family has a little land for cultivation, about 2000 square meters to plant rice. Mr. Xuat, Miss Anh’s husband, works as a daily laborer, but the work is not stable. Miss Anh has already repaid a loan of $75 for the project and income increased by about $2.31/person/month. However, average income is low at $9/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $100 to expand the sales of confections and rice planting.

loans.use: sell confections at home

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok P. is 46 years old and sells vegetables for a living--earning approximately $2/day. She lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband, a mototaxi driver, and their 6 children. Two of her children work at a garment factory in Phnom Penh and send back part of their wages to help the family. The other 4 children go to school during the day and help their mother with the crops in their free time.

Mrs. Sok P. would like to take this loan in order to purchase a small piece of land where she can grow more crops. In the future, she hopes to continue with this trend of expanding her landholding so that she can grow more and more to sell to the market. She feels that her farming business will help to send her children to school until they are old enough to find their own jobs.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for growing crops

loans.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Laxmi Kumari M., 57, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, with her husband and five sons. Her husband, Mr. Bal Mukunda M., has no work. He is illiterate and unemployed. Her two younger sons are studying in grades 5 and 6. Mrs. M. and all her five sons make traditional idols to order. They have a lot of orders for making the idols, so they need money to buy raw materials like gold, brass, and wax to make more traditional idols to fulfill the demand. She seeks $300 to buy these raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making idols

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has a child. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin City.

Joy started her own business selling provisions, phone cards, and foodstuffs seven years ago. She needs the loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs, and phone cards for sale

loans.name: Betha

texts.en:
Bertha is a 38-year old entrepreneur who lives in Siaya, Kenya, with her husband and six children. She has also trained as a community health worker to provide home-based care to people living with HIV/AIDS in her area. The cereal selling business that she initiated in 1993 was doing quite well until about a year ago when her husband was laid off and she became the sole income earner in her household. To supplement her income, Bertha set up a fruit and vegetable stand near her home.

Her hard work, determination, and excellent skills have led to her success. Her profits pay the household expenses as well as secondary school fees for two of her children. Bertha plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$800 to buy twenty sacks of grains, particularly maize. As the price of this staple food is currently low, she will buy in bulk now to sell at a larger profit later.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of grains, particularly maize.

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol F. is 52 years old and has a secondary school education. She is a widow with two children. Anorhol has a small store where she sells food products close to her home in the village of Kizil-Kala. She plans to use her loan to increase the assortment of goods sold. Most of her clients live in the village. The loan will allow local residents to obtain the groceries they need without having to go into the center of the region. This way they can save time and money. Anorhol plans to repay her loan within a 12-month period.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Факирова Анорхол, возраст 52 года, образование среднее, семейное положение – вдова, имеет 2 детей. Анорхол рядом со своим домом, в кишлаке Кизил-Кала посторила небольшой магазин по продаже продуктов питания. Полученный кредит она хочет использовать на увелечение ассортимента продаваемого товара. Основными её клиентами являются жители этого кишлака. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать необходимые им продукты питания, при этом не выезжая в центр района, что намного съэкономит их время и денежные средства. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Djuraboy

texts.ru:
Djuraboy A. is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a High School education. Djuraboy has been in the business of raising cattle for the past 5 years. This is his main source of income. He plans to use the obtained credit to purchase several additional animals. He plans to sell animals every 40 to 45 days. The obtained money will be used to purchase young animals. He plans to use the profit from the sale to purchase animal feed and to provide for his family. Djuraboy plans to repay the loan over a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдузоиров Джурабой, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Джурабой занимается разведением и продажей крупного – рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести несколько голов крупного – рогатого скота. Через каждые 40-45 дней он планирует продавать откормленный скот, а на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. Полученную прибыль от продажи он будет направлять на приобретение молодого скота и содержание своей семьи. Это основной вид деятельности, которым он занимается и который приносит ему доход. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Mamoona's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader, Manoona K.. I am married and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. All of my children are below 16 and attend school, except the youngest who is not yet of school age. My husband is a farmer and now he wants to start a sugarcane-juice corner. He therefore will buy a machine that is used to extract the juice. My loan group members and their businesses are: Shamim B., who will use her share of the loan to buy a dairy cow; Abdul Q., who needs this loan to buy a juicer for her husband's juice corner; and Shaheen K., who wants to buy an embroidery machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy machine to extract juice from sugarcane

loans.name: Balyelesa Development Group

texts.en: Clement, age 49, is the chairperson of the Balyelesa Development Group in Mukono. She is married with 7 children, as well as caring for 6 other relatives. She has 3 businesses; she is a farmer growing maize and beans both for sale and home consumption, she makes yogurt, and she has sold milk for over 10 years. She has been able to succeed, especially with the help of her kids at home. She needs a loan to help with her yogurt business, since she intends to get packages with her own label for more sales. She sells the yogurt mainly to the nearby shops and schools, but with the new label, she intends to sell to supermarkets.

loans.use: Clement needs a loan to help with her yogurt business by buying packages with her own label for more sales.

loans.name: Thị Mai

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), 48 years old, is an active woman. She and her husband together they tend a herd of water buffalo, a vegetable garden, sell its product and farm a small patch of rice paddy. They have two school age children. She is applying for a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her ducks. Her G. has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), 33 years old, applies for a loan to invest in egg laying hens.
  • Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), 40 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), 24 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ.
  • Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in her đi chợ and egg laying hens.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Mai (MS: 06030006), năm nay 48 tuổi, chị là người rất năng động trong việc phát triển kinh tế gia đình, chị chăn nuôi châu, trồng rau bán hàng ngày và làm ruộng, chồng chị cùng tham gia vào công việc chăn nuôi và trồng trọt của chị, chị có hai con hiện đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho đàn vịt đẻ. Chị rất thích tham gia vào chương trình. Anh Lưu Văn Bắc (MS: 06030007), năm nay 33 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi cám nuôi gà lấy trứng. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt (MS: 06030008), năm nay 40 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hoa quả, rau và bỏng ngô đi chợ bán. Chị Lưu Thị Lan (MS: 06030009), năm nay 24 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán hoa quả, bỏng ngô. Chị Kiều Thị Hồng (MS: 06030010), năm nay 41 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ bán rau quả và chăn nuôi gà.

loans.use: Invest in businesses

loans.name: Alicio

texts.en:
Alicio (29) is a single man who lives with his mother in Carapegua. Alicio is studying farming administration at the university. Next year he will be done with college and he will make his dream come true. He always wanted to have a degree. 

Hamacas (hammocks) are a type of swing very typical in Paraguay. Usually people take a siesta (nap) on the hamacas (swing). Since it is a tradition, there is always a huge demand for hamacas (swings).

From an early age Alicio started working with his mother in the production of swings and bedspreads. They started selling their products to different craft stores, but then they realized that they could sell on their own, and that would be much more profitable. Alicio is responsible for distributing the swings and bedspreads. Thanks to the increase in income, Alicio bought a car to make the distribution faster and more efficient. 

Alicio needs the credit in order to buy more raw materials such as threads, fabrics and others.

loans.use: Purchase threads, fabrics and others

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina is a young woman who is 24 years old and lives in the village of La Ceiba, in the Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan municipality of Sololá Province in Guatemala. With her contributions to the community she has gained respect for her small business in which she has been selling groceries for 10 years. As her father died when she was an infant, she and her mother continued ahead, passing through various trying times but alway managing to overcome them.

Being young and with positive thinking about growing the business she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan of 7,080 quetzales, money that she will use to increase her business capital. She has quite a bit of customer demand since she is the only person that is selling products like hers in the area. This will enable her to increase her earnings and improve her living condition as well as help her two young brothers to finish their studies. She always has as a top priority satisfying her clients with a variety of grocery products.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Señorita que cuenta con 24 años de edad, con oficios domésticos, con domicilio en la Aldea La Ceiba, Jurisdicción municipal de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, Departamento de Sololá, Guatemala, con sus participaciones en la comunidad se ha ganado el aprecio con su pequeño negocio en la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace 10 años, la cual desde su infancia quedo huérfana de padre, en donde juntamente con su mama salieron avante en la vida, pasando por varias pruebas lográndolas superar, siendo joven y pensando de forma positiva en seguir creciendo en su negocio acudió a la Asociación ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo de Q7, 080.00, quetzales, dinero que utilizara para incrementar su capital en su tienda, ya que cuenta con bastante demanda, por ser la única persona quien se ha posicionado en la venta de estos productos en el lugar donde se encuentra su negocio. Además así podrá obtener ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida como también ayudarse a ella misma y a sus dos hermanitos a que concluyan sus estudios, y lo más importante es de satisfacer a los clientes con una variedad de productos de consumo diario.

loans.use: Increasing capital for her grocery store

loans.name: Frida's Group

texts.en:
Frida is 28 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 1. She became a charcoal and vegetable seller in 2006. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Frida now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa started her business because she needed money to help her husband with the costs of raising their 2 small children of 10 and 2 years old. She started her business 14 years ago, when she borrowed money from a friend and contacted a person from the US that brought packages of used clothing which she then started to sell from her home, and later in the open-air markets.

She needs a loan for US $250, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise because the type of clothing she sells is very popular.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa inició el negocio porque necesitaba dinero para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 2 años. Comenzó hace 14 años, cuando pidió prestado dinero a una comadre y ella le dio el dato de una persona que traía pacas de ropa usada de estados unidos. Empezó a vender en su casa y después en los tianguis.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía porque ese tipo de ropa la piden mucho.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq S. is a 43-year-old man who breeds sheep in Bilasuvar region. He is married with 6 children. It is difficult to keep such a large family in good conditions, but Faiq is working very hard to improve his family's living conditions. His older children help him with looking after the sheep.

Faiq has applied for a $1000 USD loan to purchase 15 sheep for $60 USD each, and fodder for the rest for $100 USD.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Sabina B. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 14 and 24. She is also responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans. Sabina has been running a grocery since 2007 and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sabina currently earns about $200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400USD in order to purchase rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, kerosene, etc. for her store. In the future, she plans to expand business. Sabina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Sabina would like to purchase rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, kerosene, etc., to resell at her store.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: G. Mutabar has always been around farming and farmers. Ten years ago, she decided to grow her own crop of potatoes and onions. After several years of doing this, she and her husband established a family. Now they are surrounded by five children and several grandchildren, and want only to provide the best for all them. To make the most of their farming, they have always sold their products wholesale. Today, however, G. and her husband are thinking of starting to raise and sell animals. They hope to go into this business with the profits from their next harvest. To make this possible, they have applied for a loan of $750 for 12 months to invest in the seeds and fertilizer they need to improve the size of their crop and the quality of their produce. Please help this couple improve the lives of their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel es una persona honesta, y trabajadora ya que lo ha de mostrado no solo dentro del trabajo sino dentro de la sociedad, el esta solicitando el crédito para terminar el proyecto de la división de su casa y la colocación del vitropiso, para asi darle a su vivienda mayor amplitud y comodidad.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is an honest person, and a hard worker who has shown that not only within his work, but within society. He is requesting credit to finish a project partitioning his house and laying down flooring, in order to give his house more space and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete partitioning and laying floor in his house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 52 años, vive con sus dos hijos que son independientes y de familia y con su esposo. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwiches en su casa, inició con este negocio debido a que notó que en la zona en que está ubicada hay gran tránsito de personas, y no fue una mala idea, por lo contrario este humilde negocio le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, no solo porque le gusta conversar con las personas que se acercan a comprar su comida, sino también porque su economía a mejorado a raíz de esta actividad, por lo que se siente feliz en realizarla. Hace casi 5 años que recurrió por primera vez a MFP y está muy contenta por su permanencia en su banco comunal, este ya es su crédito número 11. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco fuera de su casa para tener mayor comodidad para vender.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old, lives with her two grown children who have their respective families and her husband. She has been selling juices and sandwiches for 8 years. She began this business because she noticed that there is a lot of pedestrian traffic in her area, so this wasn’t such a bad idea, and on the contrary this humble business has brought much satisfaction, not only because she likes to talk with the people who buy her food but also because her income has improved because of this business, so she is very happy to have this work. She approached MFP for the first time 5 years ago, and she is very happy to be a member of the communal bank, this is her 11th loan. With the money she will build a kiosk outside of her house in order to have greater convenience to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosc for her business

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Ёкубова Санавбар 1960 года рождения, у нее 4 детей. Старший сын помогает  торговать на  рынке, он заменяет в ее отсутствии. Она торгует конфетами и  печеньями. Ей необходимо было расширить свой бизнес перед новым годом,ее соседка по бизнесу кредитуется в Микроинвесте, она наблюдала за развитием ее бизнеса и решила также получить кредит в Микроинвесте. Сейчас Санавбар погасит последний свой кредит и планирует получит новый займ для расширения торговой точки и  увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Sanavbar Y., 49, has 4 children. Her oldest son helps Sanavbar with her business. Sanavbar sells candies and cookies at a local market. She is completing paying off her previous loan and wants to take a new one to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. sells food supplies like rice, canned products, oil and spices at Coronation near Cape Coast. Leticia has received primary level education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband does printing works. Leticia has been selling food supplies since 1999. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more food supplies to increase sale to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương  năm nay 33  tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ đầu năm 2005. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn, bò tại nhà. Anh Hùng chồng chị ngoài thời gian phụ giúp vợ chăn nuôi còn đi làm thêm nghề xe ôm để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt 2.000.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 1 con bò giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong, 33 years old, has joined the TYM Fund since the beginning of 2005. Currently, she raises livestock at home. Besides helping her out, her husband also works as a driver for hire. Her family's monthly income is 2 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 9 millions VND to purchase animal feeds and a cow to breed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cow

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Composé de deux veuves et de deux mariées monogames, les femmes du groupe Djiguitougou sont âgées en moyenne de 43 ans avec 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes  dans  le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Liées par des relations de voisinage elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de la restauration et la transformation de l’oignon. En plus de ces activités  elles vendent  de temps à autres des draps de lit et des vêtements brodés à base de popeline
 Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elles sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire après avoir bien remboursé les quatre prêts précédents.
 Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter : 5 sacs de mil (dont une partie est transformée en beignets pour être  vendue) ,3 sacs de gombo séchés, 8 sacs d’oignon frais (qui seront épluchés, lavés, découpés en petits morceaux, séchés à l’aide d’un séchoir puis emballés dans des sachets en plastiques).
 Une bonne partie de cet oignon est gardée jusqu’en l’hivernage où l’oignon est rare sur les marchés. Elles se ravitaillent au marché de Médine et à Kindjeli auprès des producteurs et grossistes. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes à domicile ou en ambulant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCA  qui sera utilisé pour  rembourser les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
 Elles ont pour ambitions  d’avoir une maison à usage d’habitation et l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente de draps de lit.
texts.en:
Composed of two widows and two married women from monogamous households, the women of the Djiguitougou group are on average 43 years old and have an average of 5 children. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

Linked by the fact that they are neighbors, they sell condiments, cooked food, and processed onions. Moreover, they sometimes sell bedsheets and embroidered clothing made of poplin.

Wishing to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their 5th solidarity loan, after having reimbursed the other four loans successfully. This loan will be used to buy 5 sacks of millet (part of which will be made into fried cakes to sell), 3 sacks of dried okra, and 8 sacks of fresh onions (which will be peeled, washed, cut into small pieces, dried in a dryer, then packaged up in plastic.)

A good part of this processed onion will be kept until the off-season, where onions are rare in the markets. They do their buying in the market of Médine and in Kindjeli from farmers and wholesalers. They sell for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and of housewives, out of their homes or door-to-door.

They hope to make a monthly, average profit of 45,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover family expenses. Their ambition is to have a house of their own to live in and to open a shop selling bedsheets.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy millet, dried okra, and fresh onions

loans.name: Oduola

texts.en: Oduola B. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. All her children are in school. She and her husband sell planks. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yiriwaton sont au nombre de quatre femmes toutes mariées  majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en  moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et habitent dans le quartier Bananissabakoro  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles mènent diverses activités qui sont entre autres le commerce des tubercules, de poisson, des boissons locales, des fruits, du bois de chauffe, de savons et du charbon de bois.
Afin de pérenniser leurs activités commerciales, elles ont décidé de solliciter la collaboration du programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après huit prêts solidaires tous remboursés sans difficulté, elles sont à leur 9ème prêt.
Elles comptent acheter, 4 sacs de patate, 2 sacs de mangues, 140 kg de poisson, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 1sac de sucre, 4 kg de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée (dableni) et 5 cartons de poudre jus de fruits. Elles  s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Ségou, au marché du château. Quant au  poisson il est acheté au bord du fleuve Niger et quelques fois au marché du château. Une partie des patates et du poisson frais sont frits avant leur vente. Quelques fois une partie du poisson est fumée sur commande. Les feuilles d’oseille de Guinée et les poudres de jus de fruits sont transformées en boissons locales pour être vendus. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à domicile, au bord du goudron traversant le quartier  et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 41.250FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt, la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (médicaments et habillements), l’épargne et l’augmentation du fonds de commerce. 
Elles désirent  toutes avoir une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The members of the Yiriwaton group are 4 married women, mostly living in monogamous families, with an average age of 35 and 4 children. They know each other because of being related and living in the same neighborhood of Bananissabakoro in Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).

They have various activities, among others selling root crops, fish, local drinks, fruit, firewood, soap, and charcoal. So as to make their businesses secure, they decided to seek the collaboration of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After 8 solidarity loans, all reimbursed without difficulty, they are on their 9th loan.

They plan to buy 4 sacks of sweet potatoes, 2 sacks of mangoes, 140 kg of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil, 1 sack of sugar, 4 kg of hibiscus flowers (locally known as dableni), and 5 cases of powdered fruit juice. They do their buying in the big open-air market of Segou, the Château market. As for the fish, it is bought along the banks of the River Niger and sometimes at the Château market. Part of the sweet potatoes and fresh fish are fried before being sold. Sometimes part of the fish is smoked to fill an order. The hibiscus flowers and fruit juice powder are made into local drinks to be sold. They sell on a cash basis and for credit, out of their homes, at the side of the road that cuts through the neighborhood, and on foot, to a clientele made up of men and women.

They each hope to make an average monthly profit of 41,250 F CFA which will be used for the reimbursement of the loan, to cover certain family expenses (medicine, clothing), to add to their savings and increase their working capital. They each desire to have a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen E. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more stock to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rocila

texts.en:
“I started farming 20 years ago. With my one-hectare farm, our family is able to earn 20,000 PHP a month. We use the income from our harvest to pay our children's tuition fees as well as meet their other needs,” says Rocila P., a farmer and mother of four children. Aside from growing rice, Rocila also sells nipa, a kind of plant used in roofing. She had previous work experience in canning but quit her job to manage a farm instead.

Rocila is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will help her grow her harvest and her income. One day, she hopes to buy another hectare of farmland. In that way, she will be able to further support her children's needs.

About CEVI
CEVI helps small business to grow. CEVI provides all its clients not just with loans, but with training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Future Winners Group

texts.en: Jestine W. is 25 years of age, and a high school graduate. She lives in Moulton Corner and is married with 3 children. She sells used clothes at her house and hopes to add new varieties if she receives a loan. She would like to buy slippers upon receiving her loan.

loans.use: To buy slippers for resale

loans.name: Geraldin

texts.en:
Geraldin L. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 22 years old. Geraldin is single. To make a living, Geraldin owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing or Ready-to-Wear clothing to local community members. Geraldin has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geraldin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldin is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Geraldin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 39-year-old mother of five children whose ages range from 1- 17 years old. Her husband is a motorcycle driver while she runs various businesses. It was in 2005 when she first had the opportunity of putting up her own business because of her membership in ASHI.

Four years later, Beverly has made her business grow and has a lot of variety in the goods she retails in her store. The amount of loan she is qualified to make has increased for she has maintained a very good repayment rate, attendance rate, and business rating in ASHI.

Beverly's businesses, such as her variety store that retails rice, charcoal and other basic needs of people, as well as her food-vending business, have brought convenience to people in her community and have brought joy to Beverly since she has at least contributed something to other people.

Beverly's dream of sending all her children to college goes with her dream of making her business sustainable. The opportunity of taking loans is a great source of capital to make these dreams come true, in addition to the income her husband makes being a motorcycle driver.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and other grocery items for her variety store and to finance her food-vending business

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.en: N. Saiyora is married with two children. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market selling women’s clothing, offering a large variety of women’s clothing at reasonable prices. She has been in business for thirteen years. Saiyora has benefited a lot from a year of partnering with IMON International. She now needs a loan of 4,000 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and purchase clothing wholesale for the autumn season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing wholesale for the autumn season

loans.name: Mission 2 Newube Asina Group

texts.en:
N. Asina is representing her group. She is twenty-four years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. 

She has a pool table business, where people pay tokens to play and pass time. She has managed to maintain her pool table business for a year. Now she wants to buy another pool table so she can earn more daily income. Although some people think that it in an unusual business, it provides her with a daily income. She is a creative and hard-working businesswoman who knows how to handle customers and win their attention. Her hope for the future is to educate her children and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy another pool table

loans.name: Nelly Lisseth

texts.es: Nelly Lisseth R. C. de 28 años de edad, reside en Ilopango municipio del departamento de San Salvador, vive con  su esposo y su hija Rebeca de un año de edad, Nelly es de gran apoyo a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ha instalado un comedor desde su casa para cuidar de su hija y poder trabajar, es así como funciona el comedor de Nelly día a día. El destino del crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de insumos para aumentar su producción

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 50-year-old married woman with four children aged between 8 and 28 years. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Annet works in semi-urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. She is a tailor in Nsooba, sewing and selling clothing. She buys her clothing materials from shops in Kiyembe that sell clothing materials at a cheaper price. They are some of the busiest shops in Uganda. She pays for transport costs to and from shopping.

Annet is faced with the challenge of the increasing prices of clothing materials. She pays rent for her business premises at 45000/=. She sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members.

Annet wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Rice farming is the main source of income of Letecia L.. She is 70 years old, living in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with five children. She manages a one hectare rice field. She needs financial assistance to sustain her farm. She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because of its low interest charge for financing. She's requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: agricultural financing

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Mr. Jonas A., who is 29 years old, is engaged in the pig-fattening business. He also manages a farm lot. His wife, Sherilyn, who is 32 years old, is usually at his side, helping him manage their hog-raising business. However, at present she is seven months pregnant and not able to help him clean the pig pens, so Jonas is doubling his time in caring for the animals.

He said that the fattening of pigs is a good business, because at the same time he can work in their field. Due to financial constraints, he was not able to buy a supply of feed for his hogs, so he is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders for the maintenance of his pigs. As an optimistic person, he believes that Kiva lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en: Fatimo is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband sells motor spare parts to support his family. To help, she sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more of a profit during this season. She hopes to become a major drink distributor in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN; she will use the money to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more drinks to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana P., age 30, earns her living by running a general store in her village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. Ana is married and has three children.

In 2007, Ana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI.

Ana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan de _C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “ están en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 21  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité de Mujeres Santa María posee un ahorro gs 2.030.000.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
 Cada una realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a la facilidad que posee cada integrante así Doña Gladyz trabaja en su pequeño negocio que posee en su casa, el negocio es una despensa con todos los artículos de primera necesidad para la casa y es atendida por toda la familia. Así con el apoyo de su familia la señora Gladyz trabaja día a día para mantener a su familia y agradece a la fundación por el crédito concedido.

texts.en:
Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan began this group. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in the area known as the Zone. The group is called Santa Maria and is in its forth loan cycle with 21 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because the members, possessing a great entrepreneurial spirit, are very united, committed, and responsible to each other. Since they began efforts to collect funds for the group the Women of Santa Maria have accumulated an amount of 2,030,000 PYG. They withdraw loans of 300,000 to 1,000,000 PYG to buy merchandise for future sale. Each member undertakes a different activity according to her skills and abilities, so Doña Gladyz works in a small business that she has in her house. The business is a shop with all the items of basic necessity for the home. With the help of all the family members, Señora Gladyz works day by day to maintain her family. She thanks the foundation for the credit extended to her. 1) Rosalina R. - Sells drinks 2) Blanca López - Sale of electronics 3) Jacinta Salguero - Clothing sales 4) Natividad Fernández - Clothing sales 5) Nelly Sánchez – Has a shop 6) Marta P. - Sale of undergarmets 7) María V. - Clothing sales 8) Sinforiana Espínola - Sells cleaning products 9) María Fernández - Sewing. 10) Ubalda A. - Used clothing sales 11) Eusebia O. - Clothing sales 12) Rosana B. - Clothing sales 13) Fidelina Carísimo - Sells jewelery and clothing 14) Delia Oviedo - Sells empanadas 15) María González - Clothing sales 16) Cristina I. - Sells shoes 17) Elsa R. - Sewing 18) Elena M. - Underwear sales 19) Gladys O. – Has a shop 20) Lucia A. - Sells drinks 21) Celia I. - Sells empanadas

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale to meet basic needs like flour, sugar, meat, and oil and other products like clothing, shoes, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old married man. A father of one child, he has been working as a plumber since 1990 maintaining toilets, faucets and centrA. heating. Joseph plans to enlarge his business productivity and expand it. In order to do so, Joseph is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. tools.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Betzabeth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Betzabeth junto a su pareja se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar. Además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Betzabeth necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Betzabeth son construir su casa y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is a member of the Orcasitas II Communal Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with a partner, and has a child. She and her partner are engaged in manufacturing hand-made bricks, selling them in the same location. She also has a grocery story in her house. Betzabeth needs a loan of 900 soles, to be used to pay her workers. Her dreams are to build her house and buy a car, so that her spouse can work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay workers

loans.name: Mrs. Savoen Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has seventeen people whom all live in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Savoen S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Savoen S. is a fabric middleman and her husband, Mr. Ly M., is a driver who is not able to earn enough salary to support his family. In order to improve the family’s living conditions, Mrs. Savoen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabric to re-sell.

Mrs. Savoen S. is the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the other one is too young to work or study.

Mrs Chab P., who is a group guarantor is also present in the photo with the village bank loan members.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to re-sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Isabel es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Isabel vende carne al por mayor, Isabel viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde compra ganado, además Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche.
Los sueños de Isabel son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 37 year old member of the Lirio Communal Bank who is married with 3 children. She sells meat wholesale and travels to different fairs to buy stock. Isabel also has a grocery store at home. She needs a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase sugar, rice, and milk. Isabel's dreams are to purchase a car to transport her products and to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, and milk

loans.name: Eddit  Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Eddit José R. Gutiérrez, actualmente  estudia una carrera universitaria, su estado civil es casado, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, también cuenta con un servicio de bar y restaurante el cual maneja en sociedad con su mamá ofertando una gran variedad de platillos que se derivan de los  mariscos, tales como: ceviches, cóctel de conchas negras y camarón, el crédito lo solicito para la compra de estos productos por aproximación de la época veranera.
texts.en:
Eddit José R. Gutiérrez is currently studying for a university degree. He's married and has two school-aged children. He also has a bar and restaurant service which he manages along with his mother, offering a wide variety of seafood dishes like ceviches, and black clam and shrimp cocktail. He plans to use his loan to buy ingredients in preparation for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients, green vegetables, soft-drinks, fresh produce, and meats

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Françoise est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Françoise vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 12 ans que Françoise s'est installée dans ce quartier. Françoise vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Françoise vend en gros des produits additifs (cubes, assaisonnements, etc.) par le système de distribution. Françoise s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise a obtenu déjà une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Françoise envisage développer davantage son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Françoise sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Françoise A. is married and the mother of three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in the Yénawa borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where they settled 12 years ago. Françooise helps her husband deal with family expenses thanks to the income generated by her activity. To meet her needs, she is a wholesaler of food complements (bouillon cubes, seasonings, etc.) through the distribution system. She resupplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Françoise has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She wants to expand her business and improve her response to customer demand. This is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cartons of food complements ("Maggi chicken" cubes, etc.)

loans.name: Edith Cecilia

texts.es:
Edith tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de 
ropa en su domicilio, la cual inicio aproximadamente hace 4 años, con capital propio 
producto de ahorros. En la actualidad Edith ha incrementado su negocio con la venta de 
golosinas, Edith ya posee experiencia en el negocio con el cual ella  tiene ingresos 
para apoyar a sus padres. Ella posee muchos clientes los cuales son de la zona 
ella les brinda además de buen servicio buenos precios, por este motivo es que los 
clientes regresan a su negocio, sus sueños de Edith son incrementar su negocio iniciar 
la venta de abarrotes, ya que esto hará que sus ingresos se incrementen y así poder 
ayudar a sus padres a reconstruir su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para la compra de 
mercadería.
texts.en:
Edith is 30 years old. She lives in her parents' house. She sells clothing in her home, which she started approximately 4 years ago with her own capital from savings. Presently, Edith has expanded her business with the sale of snackfoods. Edith already has experience in the business with which she has income to support her parents. She has a lot of customers who are from her area. Besides offering them good service, she offers them good prices, and that is why the customers return to her business. Edith's dream is to grow her business by starting to sell groceries. This will make her income increase and thus she will be able to help her parent rebuild their housing. She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Taibat

texts.en:
Taibat is into sells and supply of sarongs to her customers and she has been in the business for the past 30 years. She is 52 years of age and she has 4 children. She lives in Lagos with her children and she is a single mother who struggle to take care of her children in all aspect of life. 

She needs the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell in order to meet her costumers demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support and she promises to pay back her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bufunda Garage, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
M. Muzamira, aged 38 years, has a family of three and has been operating a bicycle repair shop for two years in Nyabuhikye, Ibanda. Through doing this he is able to make 160,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis which he uses to meet his family’s daily requirements including buying food for the family and paying tuition fees.

For a long time, Muzamira’s motive has always been to set up a spare-parts shop as there is a ready market available. This would help him to better progress his mechanic’s job more fairly with the extra expense of purchasing machines from other people but the ability to earn more profit.

Therefore, with this loan, Muzamira hopes to buy more spares for repairing bicycles.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts and open up a shop

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mrs. Korb H. is 35 years old and is a villager who lives in Thma Sa village in Takeo province. She is a broom maker who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ny Sam, is a construction worker who can support and improve his family living through his small salary. In order to support her husband's work place, Mrs. Korb H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to support her husband's transportation. This couple has four children. Three of the children are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: In Chheu Teal village in Kandal province, this group with four members have selected Mr. Phal S. as group leader. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes but in general to improve their businesses for the future.  Mr. S. is 57 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Kim Ang, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops for selling to support their family. Now they have a problem because their field is time to do grow. So to improve production, Mr. Phal S. is asking for a loan to buy bamboo to make pea garden. He is a father of five children, three of whom are helping him to do farming, while the others are attending locale.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to make a pea garden.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 25 años,  vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Lucila de 33 años y su pequeño hijo de un año. Consiente que los cuidados que le brinda a sus cultivos serán decisivos para una buena cosecha, desde tempranas horas de la mañana, sale presuroso a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y piña,  con la ayuda eventual de su pareja. Lleva 2 años empleando las técnicas agrícolas sobre sus terrenos propios, el cual le ha generado buenas satisfacciones por lo que considera rentable su oficio, pues puede cubrir los gastos de su familia, así como ha logrado comprar otro espacio de terreno para cultivar. Lo que más le gusta es observar sus plantaciones siempre limpias, sin maleza que obstruya su crecimiento. Con el tiempo planea tener más plantaciones que le permitan tener mayores beneficios, asimismo quiere instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su casa, el cual sería administrado por su cónyuge, quien de esa manera podría cuidar tranquilamente a su menor hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta feliz de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde lo motivan a ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para echar sobre sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Luis, 25, lives in his own home with his partner Lucila, 33, and their little 1-year-old son. Knowing that caring for his crops will be crucial to obtaining a good harvest, he rushes out early in the morning to take care of his coffee, pineapple, and banana plants; his partner helps him occasionally. Luis has been implementing agricultural techniques on his land for two years; he's been satisfied and considers his business profitable. His business allows him to cover the household's expenses, and he has been able to buy additional land. What Luis enjoys most is seeing his crops clean, without weeds to hinder their growth. In time, he plans to have more crops, which would allow him to earn more. He also wants to have a store at home from which to sell foodstuffs. The store would be managed by his partner, and would allow her to care comfortably for their small child. This is the second loan Luis obtains from Kiva partner MFP. He is happy to be working with his fellow community bank members; they motivate him to save. With this loan, he will buy several bags of fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Amada Petita

texts.es:
Amada Petita S. V. tiene 51 años.  Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 niños, 3 estan casados y los otros tres tienen 16, 18, y 19 anos.

Amada es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Amada se dedica a caseros domesticos, a criar pollos y al cultivo de maíz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao.   

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar el negocio de pollos y para comprar las semillas y abonos para sus cultivos de maíz. Su sueño es seguir adelante y ayudar a los hijos a estudiar (2 estan en la universidad). 

En el poco tiempo libre que tiene, cuida a sus pollos, cocina en la casa, y a veces sale a fiestas.
texts.en:
Amada Petita is 51 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and lives in the Chillanes district in the Bolivar province. She has 6 children. Three of them are married and the others are 16, 18 and 19 years old. Amada is a partner of El Placer rural loan group which is located three hours away from Chillanes. There are 19 partners total, most of them grow corn and cacao. This is their first loan with San Jose Co-op. Amada takes care of her house and housework, raises chickens and grows corn. She buys and sells her produce in Mata de Cacao. She requests the loan to increase her chicken business and to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant corn. Her dream is to move ahead and help her children, who are in school (two of them are in college). In the little free time that she has, she takes care of the chickens, cooks and sometimes goes to parties.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the chicken business and purchase corn seeds

loans.name: Mwanachuo

texts.en:
Mwanachuo B. is a 35 years old lady, who has a road side café in Ganjoni estate.She is married to Abdalla Salim who is a transporter in Mombasa. The couple is blessed with three children. Mwanachuo has operated her kiosk for 10 years.

Mwanachuo was introduced to KADET by a KADET loan officer and this marks her first loan from KADET. With the money she plans to stock up on food stuff for the café and partly carry out some renovations in the premise. She eventually intends to use the anticipated profit to open up a hotel and hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: To stock up on food stuff for the café and carry out some renovations on the premises

loans.name: Ayleen Carolina

texts.es: Ayleen CA. tiene 23  años de edad, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de cosméticos. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 3 años pues siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de productos como lápiz labial, polvos, pinturas de uñas entre otros productos, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos, además de esto desea invertirle un poco al local donde tiene las aves de corral. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Ayleen CA. is 23 years old. She is in the business of buying and selling cosmetics. She started this business 3 years ago and is always thinking about ways to improve her earnings, in order to defray her household costs. She is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of products like lipstick, powders, and nail polish, among other items. Now that she has enough orders, she would also like to invest a bit in the space where she keeps caged birds. Her dream has always been to have a big store located in the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, powders, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Jussely

texts.es:
Jussely, de 26 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Roger de 28 años y su querida hija Ángela de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Jussely, es el cultivo de choclo, papa, arveja, en las chacras que heredó sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. Para más adelante, espera poner un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo actualmente muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jussely who is 26 years old, is a young and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Roger, who is 28 years old, and their dear daughter Ángela, who is 6 years old. They are the reason behind all her efforts. Jussely makes her living cultivating corn, potatoes and peas on the small farm that she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day so that later, when the right moment arrives, she can harvest her crop and sell it at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in carrying it out. She is the one who decides what is best for her crops. She has been doing this work for 9 years. She feels that the most difficult part is transporting her products to the market, since most of the time it is difficult for her to find a ride. In the future, she hopes to have her own stall in the market, since she is sure it would be a way to improve her income. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she will need to be timely with her payments, like she has been with her previous loans. She is a supportive member of her communal bank and is very committed to development of the groups. With the 2500 PEN ($900USD) that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, since that leguminous plant is currently selling very well at market.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Katty Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos se reúne cada quince días, el Banco Comunal Su Bankito.

Para la señora Katty este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y al igual que sus compañeras esta muy contenta y espera seguir por muchos ciclos mas. Tiene 28 años de edad y esta casada hace 5 años, de esta linda relación tiene dos hermosos pequeñitos uno de 4 años y una linda niña de 11 m eses de edad que son su más valioso tesoro. Su esposo es cerrajero y estudia licenciatura en música en la Universidad.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudarse con los gastos de su familia decidió dedicarse a la venta de zapatos el cual lo hace con un sistema de venta puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días de dos a tres horas por día,  dice que se le dificulta un poco porque sus hijos están pequeños y a veces no tiene con quien dejarlos en el momento de ir a realizar sus recorridos, pero igual ella  siempre busca la forma de visitar a sus clientes. También realiza trabajos de belleza ya que tiene un titulo de artesana.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos ya que tiene varios encargos y sabanas ya que también quiere entra en ese negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar su carrera universitaria y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, in the citadel La California in the city of Portoviejo which is known as the city of the Reales Tamarindos, the “Su Bankito” communal bank meets.

Mrs. Katty is in her second rotation with the communal bank and, like her colleagues, she is very happy and hopes to continue for many more rotations.  She is 28 years old and has been married for 5 years.  She has two beautiful children, a 4 year old boy and a pretty little 11 month old girl, who are her most valuable treasures.  Her husband is a locksmith and is studying for his degree in music at the university.

She is a homemaker who, in order to help with the family expenses, decided to sell shoes.  She works via door-to-door sales for 3 hours every day.  She says it is a little difficult because her children are small and sometimes she doesn’t have anybody to leave them with when she needs to do her routes, but, she always finds a way to see her customers.  She also works as a beautician as she has her diploma in this area.  

This loan will be used to buy shoes and bed sheets, as she has various orders that need filling and she would like to sell sheets as part of her business as well.

Her dream is to finish her university studies and own a store.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bed sheets.

loans.name: Kady Jahoska

texts.es:
Kady Jahoska de 27 años de edad, vive en la zona # 1 frente a la casa de la mujer en Nueva Guinea, con su esposo Roger Javier que le ayuda con los gastos basicos del hogar, tienen dos hijos menores de edad: Daniela estudia 4to grado de primaria y Roger de 3 añitos estudia preescolar primer nivel. 

Kady, finalizó la carrera de admnistración de empresa, se dedica a la venta de ropa y comesticos, para ayudar a desarrollar su propia económia familiar,donde ya tiene su propia clientela, actividad que realiza desde pequeña.  Solicita el 2do crédito a AFODENIC mediante la ayuda de Kiva para construir el dormitorio de los dos niños, ya que actualmente duermen en el mismo cuarto de ella. 

su  mayor sueño es crecer en el mercado del comercio de esta manera obetner mayores Ganancias y brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, para que sean personas honestas como ella, preparadas y puedan depender de ellas mismas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Kady Jahoska is 27 years old and she lives in Zone #1 in front of La Casa de la Mujer in Nueva Guinea. Her husband, Roger Javier, helps with the basic expenses of the household. They have two young children together: Daniela is in 4th grade and Roger is 3 years old and is in preschool. 

Kady finished her training in business administration and now she sells clothing and cosmetics. She contributes to the family's economy with the help of her business and she has won herself a good client base. She has had the business since she was very young. She requests a second loan from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) to build a bedroom for their two children. Currently they all live in one room together. 

Her greatest dream is to expand in the market and improve her profits with the goal of improving the living conditions for her children. She wants to see them grow up to be honest individuals as she is. She wants to see them ready to support themselves in the future.

loans.use: To build a bedroom for the kids.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra L. y su esposo son unas personas muy trabajadoras que adquirieron su vivienda de interés social a la cual desean poner el parte de enfrente piso firme, por que en temporada de lluvia y cuando hay aire  entra mucha suciedad. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Alejandra L. and her husband are hardworking people who acquired their home through a government subsidy program. They intend to install a solid floor in the front part of their house as protection from the rainy season and the dirty air.

In order to complete this project, Alejandra is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay for labor to have a floor installed

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana A., a 40-year-old single entrepreneur, has been selling home products for 2 years.  These products are in high demand and are widely used for girls' dowries and for family celebrations. 

Now, Tarana is planning to enlarge her range of goods and is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.  

An active and strongly motivated client of AqroInvest since 2008, her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans.

loans.use: To purchase home products for resale

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.es:
La Sra. Evangelista es propietaria de una despensa en el barrio San José obrero, cuenta con clientela formada, está casada, tiene una hermosa familia conformada por la pareja y sus 4 hijos todos menores de edad.
Ella opto por el crédito con la Fundación para adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio a fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
El Cliente manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
texts.en:
Sra. Evangelista is the owner of a general store in the neighborhood of San José Obrero. She has an established customer base. Evangelista is married and has a beautiful family that consists of her husband and four children, all of whom are dependents.

She opted to receive a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to acquire more merchandise for her business so that she can provide her customers with a wider variety of products. Evangelista indicates she is satisfied with her working relationship with Fundación Paraguaya because of the support she has received to help develop and grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is married with three children. She lives in Isfara with her family and runs her business selling blankets, kerchiefs and towels in the central market. She launched her enterprise 6 years ago. Munira has rich experience working in this business. The first time she applied to IMON International for financial assistance was 6 years ago. Ever since, her business has expanded, and she gained a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity and great potential. 

Munira has consistent credit history in IMON International. We believe her positive standing and strong determination to achieve even higher goals will help her succeed and repay her loan on time. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to expand the range of merchandise

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren T. is from the city of Tabid Ozamiz City. He is 28 years old. Efren is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Efren owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting seaweeds for sale. Efren has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Efren joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efren is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Efren from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha V. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión joyero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Martha se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y el tiempo que tiene disponible ayuda a su esposo en la realización y venta de las joyas que son de plata y acero, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, aprendiendo este oficio de su esposo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la realización de sus joyas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha V. is a member of the 'Medio Ejido' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city has a cold climate and is known for the architectural beauty of its center.  Its people are very kind and maintain their culture and traditions.
