Martha is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 12, 10, 8 and 3.  Her eldest three children study in a school in the city.  Her husband is a jeweler by trade.  They do not own their own home but rent instead.

Martha takes care of her home and, in her spare time, she helps her husband in making and selling his silver and steel jewelry.  She has been in this business for 5 years, learning the trade from her husband.

Martha has been a member of her community bank for one year and she will invest her loan money in buying raw materials for making jewelry.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Marvin is single. To make a living, Marvin owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergents & toothpaste in the local community. Marvin has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. Marvin's name sounds like a name of a man but Marvin is a woman.

In 2009, Marvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21.000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Marvin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods & canned goods

loans.name: Dariya

texts.en:
Dariya is 63 years old and widowed. She sells children's clothing at Trayan market in Ivano-Frankovsk town. She has been in this business for 11 years, and is able to attract many customers through affordable prices and a large variety of clothing.

Dariya is retired but she does not want to stay at home. She wants to continue working and help her grandchildren. So she travels 30 miles by bus to get to the market where she has her business. This business is the only source of income for Dariya. 

Dariya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase spring children's clothing - coats and pants. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mr. Kim B. is a villager in Kakaoh village in Takeo province. He was born in 1965. He owns a rickshaw so that he can earn some money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Long Koem, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Now he wants to breed two cows but his savings are not enough to buy them. So, Mr. Kim B., is applying for a loan to buy two cows for breeding to start a new business. 

He is the father of four children: one is a seamstress in garment factory, one is a laborer and the others are studying in the local public school. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin S. lives with his mother and sister in Brnakot village of Syunik region. Due to high unemployment, Martin can’t work locally. The family's only income comes from growing potatoes, cabbages, and wheat. During the high season he employs eight workers, six of whom are women. The families of those workers benefit from this seasonal income.  To insure he is ready for the busy season, Martin has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and diesel to transport the produce.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and diesel for transport.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy A. is from the village of Calangahan, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Nancy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells coconut shell and wood charcoals in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Nancy is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional charcoals to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoals to sell

loans.name: Jose Jeovany

texts.es:
José, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en Usulután, es empleado, vive con su esposa y su hija, la casa es familiar, trabaja de lunes a viernes y en ocasiones los domingos desde hace tres años, en un comercial.
El solicita un préstamo para complementar la compra de un vehículo, este dinero le ayudara a realizar la compra de este medio de transporte que le servirá para trasladarse hacia su empleo.
Su aspiración es trabajar por ver a su familia en buenas condiciones, que su hija crezca sanamente y darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old. He lives in Usulután. He is employed and he lives with his wife and daughter in a family home. For three years, he has worked from Monday to Friday and occasionally, on Sundays for a company.
He is requesting a loan to supplement the purchase of a vehicle. This money will help him make the purchase of this means of transportation which will take him to work. 
His wish is to work in order to see his family living in good conditions, to see that his daughter grows up in a healthy way and to give her everything she needs.

loans.use: to supplement the purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Abd Al Jabar

texts.en:
Abd Al Jabar is a 33-year-old single man who lives in Chtaura with his elderly sick mother, who has no one except him to take good care of her. He started working 20 years ago; he was too young to work but life's necessities forced him to quit childhood and start another kind of life.
Abd Al Jabar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, for the first time, in order to do necessary maintenance to cars he has already bought for trade. In fact it is easy for him to do this work since it has been his job for the previous 20 years. He works in repairing car bodies and painting them. He hopes to stay capable of taking good care of his beloved mother, and at the same time having his own family and improving his business.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on cars before resale.

loans.name: Stanely Gavole

texts.en: Stanely Gavole L. is 39 years old, married, and has one child. He has been running his farm for a period of about three years with an income of 9,000 KES a month. He also has a grocery store where he sells his vegetables from the farm. This is Stanely's first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a group member. He wants to use the loan to rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings. He hopes to own land and develop it in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to rent more land for farming and to buy seedlings

loans.name: Satelital Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen Rosa  tiene una  librería , esta con su negocio cerca de un año y se siente feliz por que ha prosperado mucho, en su librería vende todo tipo de útiles de escolares como cuadernos, hojas, lapiceros etc. por otro lado también tiene varios oficios que le permiten ingresos adicionales  como dedicarse a la cosmetología y la preparación de tortas, Carmen es muy trabajadora quiere seguir progresando  y  sobretodo ayudar a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación y un mejor futuro es para eso que se esfuerza. Ella pertenece al grupo “SATELITAL” integrado por 07 socias todas son amigas y vecinas de ventanilla – Perú, en esta oportunidad el dinero de su préstamo lo usara para comprar productos para su librería.
texts.en: Carmen Rosa owns a stationery store which she has had for nearly one year.  She feels happy because it has done very well.  In her store she sells all kinds of school supplies such as composition books, paper, pens, etc.  She also has several trades which allow her to make additional income such as cosmetology and making cakes.  Carmen is very hard working and would like to continue making progress, above all helping her children to achieve a good education and a better future.  This is why she works hard.  She is a member of the "Satelital" group which has seven members who are all friends and neighbors.  They all live in Ventanilla, Peru.  On this occasion, Carmen Rosa will use her loan to buy products for her stationery store.

loans.use: to buy stationery products for her store

loans.name: Mabasa Makuru Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 47-year-old Olivia (with the white bandana) from Mutare. She is married and has four children, one is currently attending school.  Olivia runs a cross-border retail business selling clothing and blankets.  Her business has been in operation for 3 years and she employs one other person. She says that the main challenge she faces is lack of working capital. 

Olivia has requested a loan of $400 to boost her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's lifestyle. In the future, Olivia plans to grow her business into a shop.

loans.use: to increase her stocks

loans.name: Qakhraman

texts.en: Qakhraman is a responsible father and loving husband. While young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock from his parents and that is how he earns a living today. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of livestock, he has been able to obtain good results from his business. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. He hopes to continue his dedication to his work, and believes that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. Three previous loans from AqroInvest helped Qakhraman to build his business step by step and reap success from each loan. For this reason, he is turning to you for financial support that will permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: to buy three calves and fodder for them to eat.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.en:
A humble man, Utkir earns a living in the cattle business, working hard everyday to be able to meet his three children's needs. It is important to note that his business requires a lot of physical work mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Utkir continues to work hard and has now come to IMON International to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Shemus

texts.en:
Shemus, a 29-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur, is married to a motorcycle taxi driver and the mother of three children, all in school. The operator of an enterprise called Berwa since 2007, Shemus originally offered only tailoring services but now has expanded to include the sale of fabrics. She will use this loan to purchase additional fabric that she will both sell and use to make clothing.

With her business profits, Shemus plans to pay the school fees for her children and also accumulate savings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yesenia, se dedica al comercio de tamales y cosméticos, está casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 2 y 5 años de edad, tiene 5 años de comercializar con los cosméticos, lo inicio junto a su esposo, trabajan de 7:00am a 4:00pm. 
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de lociones y cosméticos como maquillajes, labiales, este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer al cliente todo lo necesario para satisfacer los gustos.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio competente, mejorar sus ventas y sobre todo las ganancias para su familia, ayudando a sus hijos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yesenia sells tamales and cosmetics. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 2 and 5. Yesenia has been selling cosmetics for five years. She started this business with her husband and they work from 7am to 4pm.

Yesenia is currently requesting a loan to buy lotions and cosmetics, such as makeup and lipsticks. This loan will help strengthen her business and offer her customers everything they need to satisfy their tastes.

Her goals are to maintain a competitive business, improve her sales, provide her family what they need, and help her children with everything.

loans.use: to buy lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is an aggressive and determined business lady who was born in 1965. She is married and blessed with four children. Since 2008, she has been operating a green grocery store to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have expanded her business and to invest into other businesses. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for making finances available to her.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Gorrret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Gorret has a pharmacy business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets.  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Gorret include thieves and seasonality.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pharmacy and also to build other rental rooms. Gorret lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tablets for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children; two attend school while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a meat goat selling business; she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba  habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  4 mois et 14 ans. Il évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce et s’adonne à la vente de denrées alimentaires et produits agro-alimentaires. Il a choisi son activité par amour  en aidant son oncle qui évoluait dans ce domaine. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires destinés a renforcer  son stock de produits , d’élargir son activité, d’accroitre ses bénéfices, et de satisfaire ses besoins familiaux.
texts.en: Samba lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of 5 children aged between 4 months and 14 years. He has been active in the retail sector for over a decade and sells staple and agricultural food products. He loves his line of work, which he chose after helping his uncle with his retailing activities. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since October 2010. He is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs so that he can restock on food products, expand his business activities and increase his profits, which he plans to use to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Le Chateau Group

texts.fr:
Mme Abzeta est la représentante du groupe LE CHATEAU. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 08 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des condiments (choux, piments, aubergines). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne a Kombissiri village environnant. Ses clients sont les revendeurs, les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter 01 sac de choux, 01 sac d’aubergine et 01 plat de piment.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices et investi une partie dans son commerce. Mme ambitionne s’acheter un motocycle pour faciliter son déplacement.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abzeta represents the group LE CHATEAU.  She is married and the mother of 7 children.  The oldest is 24 and the youngest is 4.  Two of her children go to school and she has 8 people in her care.

Mrs. Abzeta sells food products (cabbage, peppers, and eggplants). She has been doing this type of work for 11 years.  She gets her supplies in the nearby village of Kombissiri.  Her customers are salespeople, men and women.

Mrs. Abzeta wants to buy one sack of cabbage, 1 sack of eggplants and one flat of peppers.

She saves her profits and invests a part of them in her business. Mrs. Abzeta hopes to buy herself a motorcycle to make it easier to get around.

loans.use:
to buy one sack of cabbage, 1 sack of eggplants, and one flat of peppers.
.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her carpet weaving and clothes-selling business. She is an expert in her work. She weaves beautifully designed carpets, which sell for good amounts. She sells her carpet and clothes to different shops and earns a good income every month. 

Rukhsana has been in this profession for the past 15 years. With the loan, she will buy thread for weaving carpets and clothes in larger quantity for selling. She is hopeful that the investment will double her business profit.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving carpet and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and is a food vendor. She makes rice cakes, "banana cue" (fried and sold on a stick) and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. Magdalena also grows vegetables to sell.

Magdalena has requested a loan to purchase ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and rice. Magdalena hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as oil, bananas, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in a suburb area of Phnom Penh city. 

She has spent most of her life in cultivating rice crops on her own farmland. Her husband runs a motorcycle taxi in and around the city of Phnom Penh. This couple has given birth to 10 children. Currently, six of her children are single and live with her in Reussey Keo commune. It’s quite a big family and it’s hard for them to improve their standard of living. 

Thorn will use the $400 loan from HKL and Kiva for her farming business to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. 

In the future, Thorn hopes to provide her children a good standard of living and support their educations well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Arianne

texts.en:
Arianne and Joshua have started an afternoon tutoring program and educational resource center called HYPE -- "Helping Young People Excel" -- in a shopping center in New Orleans East within a two-mile radius of five public elementary schools and two public high schools.  Arianne and Joshua have a combined experience of working with children of all ages for 16 years, Arianne as a credentialed sixth grade math and science teacher and Joshua as the organist and mentor for young congregants at their church.  

This past summer 2011 they ran a successful summer school program and helped 25 kids, some of whose reading levels jumped several grades.  Starting in January 2012, Arianne will be home-schooling several children during the school day at HYPE's facility.  HYPE will distinguish itself from other tutoring services by offering a personalized approach geared to each individual student and his or her learning abilities. 

Joshua and Arianne will use their Kiva loan to purchase a road side sign, a facade sign for HYPE's store front, plus office equipment and marketing materials.  Arianne and Joshua have no children of their own, but over the years they have nurtured the minds of hundreds of children.

loans.use: to purchase a roadside sign, a facade sign, a copier, a shredder, a laminating machine and marketing materials.

loans.name: Chegulo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chegulo Farmers Group in Western Kenya! Prisca is the facilitator of the Chegulo Farmers group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Prisca takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Prisca had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Prisca was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Prisca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Prisca repay her one Acre Fund loans and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Chegulo Farmers group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Prisca with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is single  

George has been running a drugstore for 3 years. He has 1 employee. George heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients, outreach and promotion by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 to purchase more drugs and other items. George has no other source of income.

In 5 years time, George would like to expand his drug store. 

His major challenges include low income for adding stock. 

George says that, if God blesses Finance Sudan to continue in South Sudan, there will be a future for them.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs

loans.name: Preng

texts.en:
Preng is a 61-year-old married man and a loving father of 5 children, living in the Baray district. He is in the business of cultivating rice and potato crops within each season of the year. He typically earns an average of $3.00 per day and tries hard to support his family. 

This time, for his 3rd loan from HKL, he is borrowing KHR2,400,000. He plans to use the loan to buy stocks of cashew nuts from the local villagers’ plantations. This project will create a good income for the family when the market increases its demand. With the increase in income, Preng will use it to expand his farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Gloria Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Micaela es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este trabajo como operaria en otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de un telar, y tener otra persona trabajando, en este nuevo telar, ya que espera mejorar y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria Micaela is married, 33 years old, finished her primary school education, and has one child. She devotes herself to weaving traditional clothing and began this business as an agent in another business. She has ten years of experience to date, and counts on the support of her husband who works in housing construction. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase a loom, and to have another person working on this new loom, since she hopes to improve and continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a loom and hire another person to work the loom.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Catherine has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Catherine also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Catherine's Group will be able to receive a total of nine solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer and a solar light

loans.name: Alba Sobeyda

texts.en:
My name is Alba R., I sell men's and women's clothing ( T-shirts, shirts, blouses, skirts) and stuffed animals. I have had my business for 3 years, and I have many customers who enjoy the quality of my products. My business generates an income which allow me to support my children. My goal is to expand my inventory and to have a larger selection of items. With the profits I would improve my shop/store, support my children and their education.

Loan Use: Purchase men's and women's clothing, stuffed animals, bags.

Mi nombre es Alba R., me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero (camisetas, camisas, blusas, faldas) y peluches, actividad que hago hace 3 años, cuento con mucha clientela ya que les gusta la calidad del producto. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mis hijos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y poder tener mayor surtido de producto. y con las ganancias poder mejorar el local, sustentar a mis hijos y el estudio de ellos.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para caballero y dama, peluches, bolsas

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia took a loan for her father Mohammad Zaman, who has a wood shop in the bazaar. Here he sells all kinds of wood.

Zakia is single and lives with her family in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan.

Zakia does not have an education but she knows quilt making. Now, she helps her father increase his business and buy more wood so that he can improve the family income. Once she has finished repaying this loan she wants to take a 3rd loan cycle for herself.

loans.use: Buying wood, axes, a cart

loans.name: Susal

texts.en: Susal M. owns and operates a small market in his neighborhood in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Susal’s mother (pictured) is a retired school director who occupies a lot of her time by helping her son run the small market. Susal is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory as well as make some minor repairs to his shop.

loans.use: To increase quantity and variety of inventory. Minor repairs to shop.

loans.name: Chein

texts.en: Mr. Chein K. H. is 28 years old and, along with his wife, holds down two different jobs.  His main job is as a mechanic, fixing mostly motorbikes and some cars.  He earns $3.50/day in this business. His wife and he also raise some pigs on their plot of land.  These businesses combined give them just enough income to support themselves and their three children.  Mr. Chein K. H. plans to use this loan to purchase some motorbike spare parts and some more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for his shop and more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla H. is 60-year-old farmer who lives in the southern part of the Azerbaijan Saatli region. Seyfulla is married and has four children. He keeps one buffalo and has twelve years of experience in his animal breeding business. He started his business by borrowing money from his friends. Seyfulla used to keep calves for meat production and cows for dairy production.  Keeping cattle for long time brought him good income and with this income he purchased land and now he breeds cattle fodder to the local farmers. Seyfulla applied for $900 USD to purchase one milk cow and a baby calf. The estimated cost for the cow is $700 USD and for the baby calf is $200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and baby calf

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 21 years old and already has his own barber shop. He is a very ambitious micro-entrepreneur who works hard to make it on his own. Hassan offers his services to the inhabitants of the neighboring area. Hassan lives in Baalbeck in the Bekaa regoin. Hassan wants to enhance his business and therefore needs $1000 to improve the decoration of his shop. He is aware that the image of a barber shop, and the comfort it presents, are as important as the services he offers.

loans.use: Improve the decoration of his barber shop

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn T. V., 32, is a widow and lives with her two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She runs a stand selling women's clothes, earning around $6 each day in revenue.  Mrs. Thorn T. V. is currently applying for a loan amount of $1000 to expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her client needs, and to use any remaining money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more fashionable clothes to satisfy her client needs and the leftover of the money is used to reinvest in her business.

loans.name: Juan Nelson

texts.es:
Mr. Q. is a single father of 5 children. Because of having to support his children’s education and the difficult situation to raise a large family he decided to put a tailor business in his home.

With much effort, he began his business with savings, investing in the purchase of a sewing machine to do his work.

As of today has has had loans with Ceprodel which have given him good results, bettering the condition of his children’s lives and acquiring new machines to do his work. His goal is to expand his business by buying new machines and contracting expert help to help him work in this important business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Q. es padre soltero y con 5 hijos a su cargo. Por la necesidad de apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y por la situación difícil que atravesaban decide poner su negocio de sastrería en su hogar de habitación.

Con muchísimo esfuerzo, empieza su negocio con ahorros invirtiendo en la compra de una maquina para realizar sus trabajos.

Hoy en día ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel los cuales le han dado buenos resultados mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y adquiriendo nuevas maquinas para realizar su trabajo. Su meta es ampliar su negocio comprando nuevas maquinas y contratando personal experto para que laboren en este importante negocio.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.ru:
Ashurali M. is 31 years old, has a high school degree, is married and has no children. He is making his living by raising and selling cattle. Ashurali is planning to use his loan to purchase two calves. After fattening, every 40-45 days, he will sell the calves and use the money to purchase additional animals. He is planning to use the income to support his family and pay back his loan. Cattle sales are the main source of revenue for his family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Масконов Ашурали -31 год, образование среднее, женат, детей не имеет. Клиент занимается разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 2-х бычков .После откормки, через каждые 40-45 дней он будет продавать их , а на вырученные деньги приобретать новое поголовье. Прибыль полученная от продажи бычков будет использоваться на содержание своей семьи и погашение кредита. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником его дохода.

loans.use: purchase of two calves for fattening and sale

loans.name: Kabumbi Iii D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aida N.. She is currently in the business of selling timber and is requesting a loan to purchase more timber to sell. Aida is 30 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 1 to 6 and only one goes to school. Each week, Aida makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a timber cutting machine. Aida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy more timber and the loan was paid back on time.

Aida is joined in her small group by Sarah N., Faida N., Loy N., and Sarah N.. Sarah N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to invest in the business. Faida N. is currently operating a business selling timber and wants a loan to buy a timber cutting machine. Loy N. operates a retail shop business and wants to add stock to the shop. Sarah N. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To expand timber business

loans.name: Faga 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 9 women of Faga 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business's development and help each other guarantee on-time payments. Aiulu T. (33, married, 4 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a knife, an axe and a knife filing in order to increase production of taro and bananas, staples of the Samoan diet. Her husband does the farming. She sells the produce once a week at the Salelologa market.

Vaivao L. (54, divorced, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a bush knife, an axe, a knife filing, a mixing bucket and rubber gloves in order to increase production of taro. Her children help her with the planting.

Vaelua I. (76, married, 7 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a can and a wheelbarrow in order to help her and her husband farm taro.

Faalogoifo S. (43, married, 4 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a bush knife and a filing in order to expand her taro business.

Kuka T. (31, married, 3 children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, bush knife, wire, pesticides and knife filing in order to increase her production of taro.

Elena L. (25, married, 2 children): purchase a sewing machine, weed-killing sprayer, pesticides and a mixing bucket. She will use the new equipment to raise taro and make puletasis (dresses) and T-shirts.

Tala S. (25, single, no children): purchase a weed-killing sprayer, pesticides, a spade, a bush knife, an axe and a knife filing. Her brothers do the farming and she sells the taro once a week.

Molly T. (35, married, 4 children): purchase a stove, oil, kerosene, pots, salt, plastic bags and bananas. She is starting a banana chip business. She will sell the banana chips 6 days per week.

Tagi A. (23, married, 1 child): purchase a weed-killing machine, barbed wire, pesticides, 2 bush knives and knife filing in order to increase her taro-selling business.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, knives, etc…

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 43 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2000. At that time her family farmed a small rice paddy and raised few poultry. She took out loans to invest in raising domestic pigs. Gradually she gets a nice pig farm that outputs 4 times a year, each time from 10 to 20 pigs. Her average income is 200USD a month. She would like to apply for a loan of 1200USD to buy feed and piglets. She lives with her husband and two children in Yên Cường, huyện Y Yên.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc, 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2000. Kinh tế gia đình khi đó chủ yếu là làm ruộng, hoạt động chăn nuôi chỉ nhỏ lẻ do thiếu vốn. Sau khi được vay vốn, chị Ngọc tập trung vào chăn nuôi lợn. Qua các năm tham gia, chị đã mở rộng chuồng trại và mỗi năm cho xuất chuồng từ 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa từ 10 đên 20 con. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Ngọc khoảng 200USD. Hiện nay giá thực phẩm trên thị trường đang tăng, chị muốn vay thêm 1200USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc. Chị Ngọc đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại xã Yên Cường, huyện ý Yên.

loans.use: Buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dieynaba N. is a member of the village bank of Mbousnakh in Thies. She has already taken out 10 loans and repaid them without difficulty. She would like to expand her little cereals business by purchasing millet, peanuts, and niébé (a type of peas). Her income permits her to improve living conditions for her family. Dieynaba is requesting a loan which will be reimbursed in one single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dieynaba N., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Mbousnakh à Thiès. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 10 prêts remboursés sans difficulté. Elle veut renforcer son activité de commerce de céréales en achetant du mil, arachide et niébé. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Dieynaba sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
business selling foodstuffs

commerce alimentaire

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Mr. Met S. repairs motorcycles and bicycles in his area, from which he can earn $8 per day. Mr. S. works hard every day and provides good repair service, because he has a lot of experience in motorcycle and bicycle repair. His income is not enough to support the family’s expenses, so his wife helps to generate more income by selling porridge and coffee. She earns approximately $10 per day from these activities.

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase grocery inventory so that his wife can sell it alongside her porridge. He plans to use the remainder of the loan to fund a new business for his daughter.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory so that his wife can sell it alongside her porridge

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is married and has two children, Juan, age 16, and Karina, age 8. His wife is a homemaker. Ever since he was a child, he has liked to work in carpentry. He wanted to provide his family with a better quality of life than the one that he had, so he started his own business 7 years ago. He makes bed frames and other furniture in his patio, and little by little, thanks to his efforts, he has been able to help his business grow by increasing his clientele.

He needs a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase lumber to make more furniture. With your support, Mario will continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene dos hijos uno de 16 años se llama Juan y una de 8 años llamada Karina,. Le gusta trabajar en la carpintería desde niño había deseado que cuando tuviera su familia les daría una mejor calidad vida que la que el tuvo, comenzó su negocio hace 7 años en el patio de su casa fabricando bases para cama, y otros muebles, poco a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido hacer crecer su negocio incrementado sus clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar madera para producir más muebles. Con tu apoyo Mario seguirá con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase lumber

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua A., a 35-year-old woman, is married and has four children. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. She needs the loan to enable her to re-stock her shop with more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc., to scale up sales. She is hopeful that she will be able to make enough money to sponsor her kids' education.  She would be thankful for the support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Abdul Bashir

texts.en:
A. Bashir is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has worked for the government for a long time. He lives in a rental house because his salary is not large enough to build or buy a house. He wants to build a house but it is too difficult, so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy materials to build his house as soon as possible.

He wants to thank both kiva and AFSG. He is very happy that he is going to be the owner of a house at the end, and he wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: La Profesora Suarez de 49 años de edad es originaria de Cuapa, Chontales, trabaja para la Escuela Politecnica 17 de Julio en Juigalpa, con 21 años de servicio; soltera, tiene 1 hijo graduado de Ing. Agrónomo, desempleado, para ayudarle a su madre y asumir sus gastos se está dedicando a la siembra de frijoles, sandia y repasto de un pequeño hato.   La profesora está solicitando su crédito el que utilizará para mejoramiento de su vivienda que está ubicada en Cuapa donde habita su hijo, comprará persianas de vidrio y aluminio para evitar que se le filtre el agua, ya que sólo tiene los protectores de hierro, todos los créditos anteriores los ha invertido en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Professor Suarez, 49 years old, is originally from Cuapa, Chontales, works for the July 17th Polytechnic School in Juigalpa, with 21 years of service. She is single, and has one son who graduated in Agricultural Engineering, who is unemployed, to help his mother to increase her earnings he is dedicating himself to the sale of beans, watermelon and repasto from a small stand. The professor is looking for a loan which she will use to improve her home which is located in Cuapa where her son lives, she will buy glass and aluminum blinds to avoid getting water, because now she only has iron bars. All of her previous loans she has invested in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glass and aluminum blinds

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est âgée de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalime, une ville à 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Les besoins des clients devenant de plus en plus exigeants, Komi souhaite alimenter sa boutique afin de répondre à leur exigence. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits qui, lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A. is 45 years old, married and the father of three children. He runs a small general store in Kpalime, a town situated 120 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With customers becoming ever more demanding, Komi would like to increase the range of his stock in order to better meet their requirements. He is counting on this opportunity to increase sales and consequently his profit so that he can better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Callutaca  de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja como maestro albañil en la universidad de la Localidad.
Vive junto a su esposa, y sus dos hijos de 22 y 16 años respectivamente. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Juana makes a living raising cattle, whose milk is commercialized at the Andina Milk Industrialization Plant. She lives in Callutaca in the Andes, about two hours away from the Bolivian capital city of La Paz. Her husband teaches construction at the local university. They live together with their two children, ages 22 and 16. The loan will be used to purchase a good stock of cattle to increase their production of milk and thus their income. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Impro, and her evaluation qualified her as a recipient.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mr. Som C. was born in 1980 and he is now a bed maker in Trapaing Lompeak village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. His wife, Mrs. Toam Preun, is a housewife. They have three children, one of whom attends the local school while the others are one and three years old.  Since the bedmaking business is going well, Mr. Som C. wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy the supplies and equipment needed to expand.

loans.use: To expand a bedmaking business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida J. is 27 years old, married, and lives at Owaon, Dapitan City. She is blessed with one child. At her young age, she wants to prepare abetter future of her only child as well as for her husband who is a farmer.

She joined Paglaum MPC because she wanted to save and use the other financial services that the Cooperative offers. Later, she realized that she wanted to help her family so she applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP to raise hogs. She found out this was a good business, and she can make money from it but her capital is insufficient. She applies for a 7,000PHP loan to buy pig fattening materials & feed. 

This business has been an achievement for her because she is able to expand her business on her own with the help of Paglaum MPC. She wants to own many high breed pigs someday. She also wishes that her child will be proud of her when she gets older.

loans.use: To buy pig fattening materials & feeds

loans.name: Patience Efua

texts.en: Patience Efua M. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through senior high. Patience sells clothing and fabric; she is a seamstress who is specialized in sewing ladies wear at Ntabetil near Abura, which she has done since 2006. Patience uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family's financial needs. Patience will use the loan to purchase a variety of  fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing work . With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to reinvest back for the expansion of  her trade.

loans.use: Patience will use the loan to purchase a variety of  fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing work .

loans.name: Nguyen's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Ánh sinh năm 1955, (Mã số: 010107030019). Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và các con đã đi làm công nhân. Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, ngoài ra chị còn đi chợ bán rau, bán hàng khô có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập của gia đình chị là: 3.000.000 VND/tháng. Chu kì này chị tham gia vay vốn với mức vay là: 4.578.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Trong nhóm chị còn có:
 Lê Thị Đông sinh năm 1970, (Mã số: 010107030020). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp, chu kì này chị tham gia vay với mức vay là: 4.142.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Hoạch sinh năm 1954, (Mã số: 010107030021). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và đi chợ bán rau. Chu kì này chị tham gia vay mức vốn là: 4.142.000 VND
 Nguyễn Thị Xính sinh năm 1953, (Mã số: 010107030018). Chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và đi chợ rau. Chu kì này chị tham gia vay mức vay là: 4.142.000 VND
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen T. A. was born in 1955. She currently lives with her husband and her children, who are all workers. Mrs. A.'s main job is farming. Besides, she also sells vegetable and dry food at the market. Thus, her family has a stable source of income of 3,000,000 VND/month (or 180 USD/month). For this loan cycle, Mrs. A. wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (or 276 USD) to raise chicken. Other members in her group are: Mrs. Le T. D., born in 1970, is a farmer. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 250 USD) to raise pigs. Mrs. Nguyen T. H., born in 1954, is doing farming and selling vegetables at the market. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 250 USD) Mrs. Nguyen T. X., born in 1953, is doing farming and selling vegetables at the market. She also wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 250 USD)

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chan nuoi, nong nghiep

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Sindiya de l’association Benkadi sont en majorités des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de KOULIKORO république du Mali.  
Pour des raisons commerciales (le commerce des fruits et légumes), elles se sont découvertes les unes les autres. Avec l’idée d’augmenter leurs ressources financières afin de pouvoir acheter plus de produits, elles ont adhéré à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Ces femmes sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter 300 kg de bananes, 150 kg d’aubergines, 400 kg de choux et 200 kg d’oranges.  
Ces produits seront achetés dans les jardins potagers de TINGOLE et ses villages environnants pour être revendus à FANA en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ces femmes espèrent obtenir chacune  par mois, un bénéfice de 6.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour entretenir les enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sindiya group of the Benkadi association are mostly married women, who average 30 years of age and 4 children. They live in extended traditional conjugal families in the TINGOLE village, in the FANA subprefecture, prefecture of DIOÏLA (KOULIKORO region, Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through their businesses (they sell fruits and vegetables). In view of increasing their financial resources to be able to purchase more products, they joined Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their sixth group loan. Out of the previous loans, four were for agriculture, and all previous loans were repaid without problems.

With this loan, these women intend to buy 300 kg of bananas, 150 kg of eggplants, 400 kg of cabbages, and 200 kg of oranges. These products will be purchased from vegetable gardens in TINGOLE and in the surrounding villages, to be retailed for cash in FANA, to a clientele comprising both men and women. These women hope to turn a monthly profit of XOF 6'500 (ca US$ 14) each, to be used to provide for their children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 300 kg of bananas, 150 kg of eggplants, 400 kg of cabbages, and 200 kg of oranges

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Мамадчонова Гульчехра молодая девушка, которая занимается завозом и продажей веников. За товаром ездит сама Гульчехра в город Истаравшан. Она имеет своих поставщиков, которые иногда сами привозят ей товар.  Но во время мониторинга Гульчехра отсутствовала, была в отъезде за товаром. На снимке её мать, которая замещает дочь в её отсутствии. Гульчехра хочет, получив кредит  поехать за товаром и привести побольше партии веников по оптовым ценам. Гульчехра очень приветливая девушка , которая обслуживает клиентов на высшем уровне, поэтому у неё много знакомых клиентов , которые покупают товар именно у неё.
texts.en:
Gulchehra Mamadchonova is a young woman who is in the business of selling besom brooms. She obtains her goods herself in the town of Istaravshan. She also has suppliers who seldom deliver the goods to her. During the business monitoring, Gulchehra was gone to get her products. The photograph shows Gulchehra’s mother, who helps her daughter when she is gone. Gulchehra wants to use this loan to purchase and deliver brooms at wholesale prices. Gulchehra is a very friendly woman and provides great customer service to her clients. This is why she has many clients who purchase goods only from her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brooms at wholesale price

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school. Elizabeth’s husband is a palm nut and cocoa farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Elizabeth is a farmer and trader. She trades in smoked fish and tilapia. She purchases the goods from nearby towns and sells at a tabletop in the market square. She has been in business for four years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and to help her children through school.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk to sell at market.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is fifty year old man, married and the father of four children. He trades in cassava, plantain, maize, millet, palm oil, and yam. Kwame is convinced that his business can grow with increased working capital. He is requesting loan to buy baskets of tomatoes, groundnuts, bags of maize, and tubers of yam to increase his stock. He hopes to improve his income so he can finance the education of his children. 

Kwame belongs to the community group called Sure Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another to act as social collateral to access a loan, and provide encouragement to repay it.

loans.use: To procure food items

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of only two borrowers, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Kim T., is 44 years old. She currently sells flowers to people who come to eat in restaurants, and she is earning an average of US$ 5 profit per day. She usually buys various kinds of flowers from farmers, making them into bouquets and selling them retail, while walking around the village.

Kim T. is married with three kids who are attending school, while her husband works driving a motorcycle taxi. Because their current income is not enough for their family’s daily expenses, Kim T. would like a loan of US$ 300 in order to buy piglets to raise. This will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. The other borrower is Mr. Sem S., who is asking for a US$ 300 loan as well. He wants it to add to his savings to replace his existing motor that has broken.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Margarita Gaudiosa

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene 66 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores, tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Margarita  se dedica, con la ayuda D. sus hijas, a la preparación y ventas  D. menú (comida), ha logrado instalar en su vivienda un restaurante.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”, lo invirtió en la compra insumos para la preparación D. sus menús como: arroz, aceite, azúcar, papas, fideos, etc.
Con la ayuda D. este préstamo empezó a comprar sus insumos  al por mayor y así poder estar abastecida y generar mayor  ganancia.
Con este crédito D. S/ 1,700 soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra por mayor D. insumos para la preparación D. menús.
Margarita  tiene como sueño, incrementar su clientela..
texts.en:
Margarita is 66, and she lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a college education. She has four children who are economically independent of her. Margarita, with her daughters’ help, makes and sells meals. She has set up a restaurant in her house. She received her first loan for 300 PEN from Las Emprendedoras II, her Community Bank. She used it to buy supplies like rice, oil, sugar, potatoes, noodles, etc. for the preparation of her meals. With the help of this loan, she started to buy wholesale supplies. This way she is better supplied, and she generates greater earnings. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy wholesale supplies for meal preparation. Margarita’s dream is to increase the number of customers she has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for meal preparation

loans.name: Holmamad

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Холмамад закончив текущий займ хочет получить следующий , на увеличение скота.Сейчас у него две коровы и несколько десятков баранов.Поэтому он хочет купить молодых породистых баранов и откормив их продать с прибылью.Он благодарен инвесторам за финансирование и понимание.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Holmamad has completed his current loan and wants to take out a new one to increase the number of cattle. At this time he has two cows and a few tens of sheep. This is why he wants to buy young pedigree sheep and after feeding them to sells them and make profit. He is grateful to the lenders for financial support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Orif

texts.en:
E. Orif is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. Married with four children, he and his family live in Isfara, Tajikistan where he works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. Orif has been working in the market for four years, and his business enjoys stability and consistent growth, providing the main income for his family. He enjoys working for himself. Today Orif would like to ask for a loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory.

We believe Orif‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Orif’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for selling.

loans.name: Mamur

texts.en: K. Mamur has a minivan which he uses to provide transportation services. Having attended to this business for fifteen years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car but, after time and having made certain savings, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main and considerable income for his family allowing improvement in their living conditions. Currently Mamur’s minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 3,000 Somoni to purchase spare parts. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of his family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Sumail

texts.pt:
Sumail J. nasceu no extremo norte do pais (na província de Cabo delgado a 3.500km de Maputo), tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho de cinco anos de idade. Primeiro estudou e parou na 5 classe e retomou neste no curso noturna. Vive na casa própria com sua esposa.

Saiu da província de Cabo Delgado sozinho para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida em 1996. Viveu em casa de um familiar conterrâneo e depois emigrou para áfrica do sul a procura de emprego. Não foi bem sucedido tendo resolvido voltar a boane para iniciar uma actividade de rendimento. Durante a sua estadia na áfrica do sul aprendeu a profissão de cabeleireiro. 
Actualmente possui um salão de cabelaria onde trabalha há mais de 5 anos de experiência e rende aproximadamente 5.000,00MTpor mês que aplica no sustento da família constituída e pagamento de credito.

Nunca tinha levantado empréstimos em bancos, este é o seu segundo credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 11.500,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, pedra e outros). O primeiro credito foi para compra de cimento e blocos no valor de 6.000,00MT que pagou sem problemas.

Espera reembolsar em tempo recorde para aceder a mais empréstimos. Quer ver a sua casa de alvenaria terminada para posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Sumail J. was born in Cabo Delgado, 3.500km from Maputo, in the extreme northern part of Mozambique. He is 39, married and the father of a 5 year old boy. He droped school in 5th grade. He lives with his wife. He left Cabo Delgado to go to Maputo in 1996, searching for a better life. After that, he migrated to South Africa looking for work. While living there, he learned how to be a hairdresser, and then went back to Boane and started his own business. Now he owns a hair salon, and for the past 5 years he's been cutting hair and making around $5.000,00MT (U$ 175) per month, which he uses to support his family and pay back loans. This is his second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 11.500,00MT (U$425) to buy construction supplies (cement, rocks, etc). The first loan was used to buy concrete and blocks in the amount of 6.000,00MT which he paid back without a problem. He hopes to make the money back in record time in order to apply for other loans. He wants to see his brick house finished so he can improve it later on.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (concrete, rocks, sand)

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo M. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misa mis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Ireneo is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ireneo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meat products  in the local community. Ireneo has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 20,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ireneo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ireneo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ireneo is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ireneo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Darng

texts.en: Darng S., 61, is married and lives with her two children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works as a motorbike mechanic and makes US$2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Darng S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 that her husband needs to purchase some mechanic's tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 44 years old. She is engaged in a food vending business in their village. Since her income is not sufficient, she decided to look for another source of income so she now also an AVON dealer. She earns 25% from any products that she purchases. She is trying her best to cover her family’s expenses. She has a child in college, and one is presently in elementary education.

Sonia's husband died a few months ago. She has to double her time and needs to work hard. Sonia needs additional capital in order to continue operating her business as her source of income. Her income in her business serves her to assist in covering her family’s living costs. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

location.town: San Pedro, San Pablo, aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy, 35 years old, is the married mother of three children:  King Arvie, 15 years old,  Christian Loyd, 14 years old, and Carlos John, three years old. Their family resides in the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is in front of a resort.

Novy has been engaged in cross stitching for almost ten years now, creating different designs through various colored threads.  When she sells one design of her work, she earns a net income of Php 2,000.  Because she wishes to produce and sell more products, she is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from KIVA lenders to buy more cross stitch materials. Novy dreams of strengthening her business and producing a bountiful income so as to support the schooling of her children. She hopes that lenders will grant her the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy more cross stitch materials

loans.name: Jamiru

texts.en:
Jamiru is 33 years old and is married with two children. His wife has a grocery store that she also uses to support the home.

Jamiru sells VCDs and rechargeable phone cards both wholesale and retail to his customers. He has been in this business of five years.

Jamiru hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He hopes to own a rechargeable phone card company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris, 44 years old, is married and lives with her husband and four children. Three of her children are currently in school while her last born is learning a trade. She is a food vendor and serves food like rice with gravy stew. She says demand for food is on higher side but she does not have adequate fund for expansion. She has been in food production for twenty years and her business is located at a strategic site in the community lorry park. She wants to use the loan to buy meat, bags of rice and firewood to produce in larger quantities and increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her children's educational needs. This Christmas season, she is sure to turn over the loan positively and hopes to pay on time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Delia A. del Barrio San Juan de _C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Santa María “ están en el Cuarto Ciclo   con 21  integrantes , es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para recaudar fondos para el comité, el comité de Mujeres Santa María posee un ahorro gs 2.030.000.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para su posterior venta.
 Cada una realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a la facilidad que posee cada integrante así Doña Gladys trabaja en su pequeño negocio que posee en su casa, el negocio es una despensa con todos los artículos de primera necesidad para la casa y es atendida por toda la familia. Así con el apoyo de su familia la señora Gladys trabaja día a día para mantener a su familia y agradece a la fundación por el crédito concedido

Venta de Bebidas.
2 Blanca López.

  Venta De Ropas.

Venta de Empanadas
texts.en:
Delia A., from the San Juan neighborhood in Ciudad del Este, took the initiative to form this group. She brought together neighbors and friends to form the group in the tax-free zone. The name of the group is “Santa María,” it has 21 members, and is in its fourth loan cycle. This group is known in the neighborhood for the members’ unity and solidarity and sense of responsibility towards each other. The members are all endowed with an enterprising spirit, as is evidenced by their efforts to raise funds for the group. The Santa María Women's Group currently has 2,030,000 guaranis (PYG) in savings. The members can take out a loan of 300,000 to 1,000,000 guaranis to purchase merchandise that they will subsequently sell. Each member engages in different activities, according to her abilities. Thus, Doña Gladyz has a small store in her own house where she sells basic household goods. It is tended by the whole family. Gladyz works daily to maintain her family, thanks to their assistance. She is very grateful to the foundation for the loans received. 1 Rosalina R. Sells Beverages 2 Blanca López Sells Electronics 3 Jacinta Salguero Sells Clothing 4 Natividad Fernández Sells Clothing 5 Nelly Sánchez Sells Groceries 6 Marta P. Sells Underwear 7 María V. Sells Clothing 8 Sinforiana Espínola Sells Cleaning Products 9 María Fernández Seamstress 10 Ubalda A. Sells Used Clothing 11 Eusebia O. Sells Clothing 12 Rosana B. Sells Clothing 13 Fidelina Carísimo Sells Jewelry and Clothing 14 Delia Oviedo Sells Empanadas 15 María González Sells Clothing 16 Cristina I. Sells Shoes 17 Elsa R. Seamstress 18 Elena M. Sells Underwear 19 Gladys O. Groceries 20 Lucia A. Sells Beverages 21 Celia I. Sells Empanadas

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods: flour, sugar, meat, oil and others such as: clothing, shoes, jewelry, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.en: Jocelyne has owned an electronics shop since 2008. She has been involved in this field for the past 10 years. A mother of one child, she opened this small business to help her husband with the family's income. Today, Jocelyne is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy additionA. electronic equipment in order to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: To buy additional electronics equipment

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en el sector Capote del distrito de Picsi, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante a pesar de las limitaciones económicas de su familia, le llevó  a trabajar como obrero de construcción hace 20 años.
