Durante todo este tiempo esta actividad ha sido su principal fuente de sustento y le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Poco a poco se ha ido haciendo conocido en el medio y ahora su trabajo es valorado por la responsabilidad y eficacia con la que es realizado.

Adicionalmente trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando pequeñas áreas de cultivo que arrienda con mucho esfuerzo para sembrar arroz una vez por año. Miguel desea adquirir algunos equipos e instruentos que faciliten su trabajo de operario de construcción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona honorable y muy estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su familia un futuro estable y prometedor.
texts.en:
Miguel, 43, is a father who lives with his wife and two minor children in the Capote neighborhood of Picsi district, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get ahead despite his family's limited economic resources, led him to work as a laborer in construction 20 years ago. During all this time this activity has been his main source of support and has helped him to get his family ahead in life. Gradually, he has become well-known in the construction field and now his work is highly valued for the responsibility and efficiency that characterizes it. In addition, he farms on small plots of land, that he leases with much effort, in order to grow rice once a year. Miguel would like to acquire some tools and equipment that will facilitate his construction work. This has led him to seek his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He is an honorable person who is held in high esteem by his neighbors. His greatest wish is to offer his family a promising and stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and tools.

loans.name: Gwenotwom B Anena Kevin Group

texts.en: A. Kevin is a hardworking business woman, age 30. She is blessed with four children, of whom three are going to school. She owns a restaurant and she has been operating it for over five months. She is using this loan to purchase food (rice, millet flour, maize flour, sauce, and so forth) for her restaurant business. Her dream is to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Maria es soltera, tiene 63 años y 1 hijo, Maria vende panes típicos en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas, además Maria se dedica al hilado de lana.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y lana.
Maria sueña con mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank. Maria is single, 63 years old, and has a son. She sells traditional bread in the city's bus terminals every morning; she also knits wool. Maria needs a 1000 sol loan to buy bread and wool. Maria dreams with making home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread and wool.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi  H. is 33 years old.  She sells charcoal and used clothes.  Her business is just one year old.  She has learned how to manage her business through Faulu Kenya.  Mwanaidi uses her profit to support her family and pay wages to her employee.  She wants to add stock of charcoal and clothes for sale so she has requested for a loan of Kes.15,000 from Faulu Kenya. In the future Mwanaidi hopes to expand her charcoal business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad G. is a 28-year-old single man from Ramallah. He is currently living with his parents and five siblings, two of whom are in school while another has entered college. Their income is currently coming from their father, who is a construction worker. 

Mohammad has been working in an electronics store since 2008; he does everything from selling phones and electrical appliances to fixing computer parts. He is hoping that throughout this loan, he will be able to buy all the appliances that he lacks in order to be able to improve the status of his shop.

loans.use: Spare parts for mobiles and laptops

loans.name: Lucricia

texts.en:
Lucricia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboang Del Sur. She is 60 years old. Lucricia is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lucricia owns & operates a restaurant where she serves meals for breakfast, dinner, and lunch to customers in the local community. Lucricia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucricia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lucricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used towards working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Lucricia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Lucricia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en:
Philomina is 52 years old and a widow with 4 children. Life as a widow is very challenging. She sells drinks and cooked foods to be able to support her children by meeting their basic needs.

Philomena needs the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She hopes to grow her business to become a world class restaurant in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lolita del Socorro U. D.  de 33 años desde muy temprano sale a la carretera los altos a vender frutas como sandilla, melón, papaya, elotes, jocote, mango, coyolito y piña entre otras. Negocio que inicio desde hace seis años y en el que le ayuda su hijo mayor de 15 años después de clases.
Ella con el crédito comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. is 33 years old. She leaves very early for the Los Altos road to sell fruits like watermelon, melon, papaya, beans, jocote, mango, palm fruit, and pineapple, among others. She started the business six years ago. Her oldest child, who is 15, helps her after classes. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of fruits so that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seasonal fruits

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth H. is 38 years old and is a villager who lives in Sman Muni village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller and also a silk weaver at home.  Her husband, Mr. Reth Vong, is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectare of land to cultivate rice. With these businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to increase income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Sareth H. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer to support her husband's farming. This couple has three children: two are students in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 42 years old and single. To make a living Carlito runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. Carlito is just starting his business.

Carlito recently joined HSPFI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlito is requesting his first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional inventory. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Maria De Los Ángeles y Ángela Mercedes. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante por lo que así puede tener una gran variedad de clientes, pues inicio desde muy joven hace 25 años, fue así que logro conocer a su amiga Ángela por lo que juntas han salido adelante y aprovechado su amistad para realizar financiamientos por lo que ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene 15 años, en este negocio. Actualmente solicitan este crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisetas, vestidos y trajes. Juntas sueñan con tener un negocio más estable para su actividad.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles and Ángela Mercedes belong to this solidarity group. María sells clothes in the streets and for that reason, she has a wide variety of customers. She began 25 years ago while very young. This is how María came to know her friend Ángela and, as a result, they are advancing together, taking advantage of their friendship to gain financing. Ángela also sells clothes and has been in this business for 15 years now. At present, María and Ángela are requesting a loan to buy underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, and suits. Together, they dream of having a more stable business for their activity.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING UNDERWEAR, PANTS, BLOUSES, DRESSES, AND SUITS TO SELL

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Xiomara del Socorro M. Martínez tiene 46 años y vive  con su cónyuge e hijo de 19 años, en el popular barrio 7 de Abril al suroccidende de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a vender queso y  pan.  
Xiomara M. nació en Zambrano una población del departamento de Bolívar, desde que tenia 13 años se residenció en Barranquilla, allí estudió hasta décimo grado y continuó haciendo un curso de técnica en Belleza, a sus 21 años contrajo matrimonio  y con el conocimiento de esta actividad,  empezó a generar mayores ingresos al hogar, pero desde hace 5 años se dedicó a la comercialización de panes, que produce su esposo en una panadería donde es empleado y también vende de queso  que  compra en Zambrano y lo trae para venderlo en Barranquilla.  Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en comprar queso por mayor cantidad y productos de panadería para diversificar su oferta, con los créditos recibidos ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos y ha podido hacer arreglos locativos a su vivienda, así mismo aporta mucho mas a su hogar y eso es bueno para que entre todos logren ser exitosos.
Xiomara sueña con tener una casa propia y trabaja todos los días con esta propuesta en su mente por eso en cada persona ve un cliente y siempre está presta a ofrecerle sus productos.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Socorro M. Martínez is 46 years old and lives with her husband and 19 year old son in the trendy April 7th neighborhood in southwestern Barranquilla. She sells cheese and bread.

Xiomara M. was born in Zambrano, a town in the Department of Bolívar. She moved to Barranquilla when she was 13. There she studied through the tenth grade and continued taking technical courses in cosmetology. At 21 she got married and began her existing business in order to generate more household income. Five years ago she focused on selling breads that her husband produces at the bakery where he is employed. She also buys cheese in Zambrano and brings it with her to sell in Barranquilla.

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in the purchase of cheese in large quantities and baked goods so that she can diversify her offering. With the loans she has already received, Xiomara has been able to increase her earnings and make repairs to her home. In addition, she has been able to contribute more to the household which helps everyone in her family become successful.

Xiomara dreams of having a house of her own and works every day with that goal in mind. She views each person as a potential customer and is always ready to offer her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & baked goods to sell

loans.name: Perss

texts.en: Perss B.  is currently in the business of selling bags of maize flour, rice and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Perss is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a store of goods.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, a quienes mantiene sola, ya que lleva bastante tiempo separada de su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo, Carmen logró recuperarse económicamente, luego que cayera enferma y no pudo administrar su tienda de venta de maletas, ahora tiene un locutorio, donde ofrece servicio de llamadas nacionales e internacional, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, el cual le ha resultado muy rentable y beneficioso, además por estar en una zona estratégica donde son muchos los clientes que acuden a su establecimiento. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, además sus hijos en ocasiones les ayuda en la atención del público. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer por largas horas dentro de su locutorio sin poder salir. Con el tiempo espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una nueva cabina, para poder atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 3 children. She cares for them alone, as she has been separated from her husband for a long time. With great effort, Carmen was able to recuperate financially after she fell ill and was unable to run her suitcase sales store. She now has a telephone booth in the wholesale market of Tarma city, where she offers nation-wide and international calls. This has been very profitable and beneficial, as it is in a strategic location where there are many customers. She most enjoys attending to her customers, and her children occasionally help her with customer service. She has been doing this for 2 years and finds that her greatest difficulty is having to spend long hours in the phone booth without being able to leave. With time, she hopes that her business will grow and offer her better income. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to repay all her quotas on time; she is ready to do so, since she does not want to drag her community group down. She is very beloved in her community group because of the solidarity that she demonstrates. With the 1000 soles she is requesting she will purchase a new booth in order to be able to attend to more customers at once.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a new booth to better offer her call service

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael M. is from the village of Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 24 years old. Michael is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Michael operates a transportation service. Michael has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Michael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Michael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa T. is applying for additional Php 14,000.00 pesos to accommodate the increasing number of customers ordering  Ready to Wear (RTW) dresses and clothes. This is her second loan with KIVA. She is so grateful to serve all her customers on time and that is why she is applying for another capital loan to supply the demand. She is happy that as a member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. – a partner microfinance institution of KIVA in the Philippines that she can easily access this capital. She is also a good and active member of the institution. 

She will use the loan to buy new RTW products and expand her market to other municipalities. She will buy RTW products in bulk and at a discounted price to her customers on an installment basis. Her customers will pay her at a set retail price for a period of one month in two installments. Her profit from this business supports her husband with their daily needs especially with the school expenses of their 5 children. Her children are all studying, with 4 in college and 1 in high school. She is hoping that ASHI and KIVA will continue to support her with her plans and dreams.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear clothes

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
la sra. Gumercinda C. V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la colonia Flor del Campo y se dedica al comercio vende productos de uso personal como ser cosmeticos, cremas, prefumes, lociones etc.
los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de donas y pastelitos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cremas, perfumes, lociones y cosmeticos. desea tener un inventario mas grande y asi tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias las cuales necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Gumercinda C. V. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Flor del Campo.  She dedicates herself to selling personal products such as cosmetics, creams, perfumes, lotions, etc.  On weekends, she makes and sells donuts and cakes.  

She will use the loan to buy creams, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.  She would like to have a larger inventory, in order to increase her sales.  This will augment her income so she can cover the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase creams, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan Ernesto Mejía A. y su esposa cuentan con la venta de hamburguesas con papas a un bajo precio desde hace 1 año aparte de esta actividad distribuyen queso asadero y chorizo a su conocidos.
Ernesto desea invertir en producto para negocio de hamburguesas por que es el que le esta generando mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan Ernesto Mejía A. and his wife have been selling hamburgers and fries at a low price for 1 year.  In addition to this activity, they distribute cheese (queso asadero-mild, chewy cheese) and sausage to their acquaintances.

Ernesto wants to invest in products for his hamburger business to generate more profits.

loans.use: To stock his hamburger business.

loans.name: Glenda Nuvia

texts.es:
La Sra. Glenda Hernández se dedica al comercio tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “los 4 Hermanos” negocio con el que cuenta con mas de 6 años de experiencia y administración del mismo.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable y sus condiciones de vida han mejorado en gran manera y esto debido al apoyo que recibe de su esposo.
Doña Glenda esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos que junto a sus esposo están trabajando para darles una buena educación, don Rigoberto esposo de Doña Glenda se dedica a la agricultura ya que la zona donde vive es productiva de granos básicos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Glenda is a shopkeeper. She has a grocery store that she runs from her home under the name "Los 4 Hermanos" ("The 4 Brothers"). She has more than 6 years experience running this business. 
Her business has grown notably and their quality of life has improved greatly, and this is due to the support that she receives from her husband. Glenda is married and is the mother of 4 children. Together with her husband, she is working to give them a good education. Glenda's husband, Rigoberto, works in agriculture and the area where they live is known for its production of grain crops. 
She will use this loan to buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, aceite, refreshments, juices, dairy products, meat,  lacteos, carnes, sausages, pastas, soups, flour, corn meal, and tortillas.

loans.name: El Rincon De Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité El Rincón de las Amigas se dio mediante la formación del comité La Familia del barrio San Salvador el cual se encontraba en su segunda reunión de formación y la cantidad de integrantes superó el máximo permitido por lo que se formo dos comités.
 Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el noveno ciclo del programa. 
La señora Rossana es una de las integrantes, ella cuenta con un negocio en su casa, donde ofrece artículos  generales. 
Gran parte de su tiempo lo dedica a la atención de su negocio, pero la ayuda constantemente su familia en todas las tareas que tiene.
Actualmente cuenta con la opción de elaborar comestibles para vender a sus clientes ya que acuden en su negocio en todo momento y quiere aprovechar esto para aumentar sus ingresos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumo que estará utilizando en la venta de  comestibles, especialmente carnes, aceites, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
The El Rincón de las Amigas (The Girlfriends’ Nook) committee came about through the formation of the La Familia (The Family) committee in the San Salvador neighborhood which was in its second organizational meeting.  The number of members surpassed the maximum allowed so two committees were formed.  It currently has 15 members who are in their ninth cycle in the program.

Rossana is one of the members.  She has a store in her home selling general merchandise.  Much of her time is spent tending to the business but her family helps constantly with all the chores she has.

She now has the option of preparing food to sell to her customers since they come by the store at all hours and she wants to take advantage of this to increase income.

She is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she will use in meal preparation, especially meats, oils, vegetables and others.

loans.use: To buy meat, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Saiyohatdin

texts.en:
Saiyohatdin is married and the father of three children. He is a farmer. Together with his wife they are engaged in the business of raising and selling cattle and also grow wheat and potatoes. He is hopeful of making progress in his business and providing for his family's needs. For that reason, he wants to invest in his production, expand his crop fields and improve the quality of his products. Saiyohatdin knows that if he takes care of his land and works diligently he will reap excellent products that will have a better reception in the marketplace. The request Saiyohatdin makes is to purchase seed, fertilizer and young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is 47 years old and married with 11 adult children. She is from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

Myrna joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. Myrna will use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Marcia Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia C. es socia del banco comunal Arco Iris, vive por la comunidad de 3 Marías en donde su gente en especial los adultos se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su gente en la ciudad ha encontrado un trabajo con el cual ayudan a la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora. Marcia tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Marcia labora en una fábrica en donde realiza Jeans, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 y media de la tarde de lunes a viernes. En su casa se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos los que vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unas ventanas para su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos detalles para terminarla por completo. Su meta el de terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Marcia C. is a member of the 'Arco Iris' (Rainbow) community bank.  She lives in the community of '3 Marías' whose inhabitants, especially the adults, work raising animals and farming.  Many of the community's residents have also found work in the city which allows them to help their households financially.

Marcia is 28 years old, married and has 2 children aged 9 and 8.  Her children are studying in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works as a construction worker and, through their joint efforts, they have managed to build their own home.

Marcia works in a factory where she makes jeans.  She has been doing this job for 4 years.  She works from 8.00am to 5.30pm, Monday to Friday.  At home she raises pigs and chickens which she sells in her community.

Marcia has been a member of her community bank for 6 years and she will invest her new loan in buying some windows for her home since she and her husband are still lacking some details in order to finish it completely.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy windows

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan D. S., 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has two children, both of whom are already enrolled in college and are living at home helping her manage the household and run the business. By the grace of God, Susan has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 28,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Susan dreams that her children will be able to finish their education soon. She also hopes that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Madame Ayawa  est née à Baguida et habite quartier  Avépozo. Elle a 44 ans et est mère de 2 enfants. Elle fait la vente de produits de beauté, Bazin et couche pour bébé. Elle a débuté cette activité en 2003 et achète ces marchandises au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite, elle revend à la devanture de  son domicile. Elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt  pour acheter un lot de produits de beauté,  3 douzaines de Bazins, et 5 douzaines de couches pour bébé.
texts.en: Madame T. was born in Baguida and lives in the  Avépozo district. She is 44 years old and the mother of two children.  She sells cosmetics, Bazin (damask fabric) and baby diapers. She started this business in 2003 and buys her merchandise at the Lomé Grand Market.    She then sells her merchandise in the storefront of her home. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy a supply of cosmetics, 3 dozen Bazins, and 5 dozen diapers.

loans.use: To buy Bazins, cosmetics and baby diapers

loans.name: Benefrida

texts.en:
Benefrida A. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Benefrida is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Benefrida owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Benefrida has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Benefrida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benefrida is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benefrida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana Jessica

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia D. banco comunal Nuevo Edén, D. Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años.  Su esposo es técnico de sonido.
Lleva muy poco tiempo trabajando con los prestamos de Manuela Ramos pero ya tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa que ha ido surtiendo cada vez que saca su préstamo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 soles comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de galleta, 1 paquete de fideos para sopa, 1 bolsa de fideo tallarín, ½ saco de azúcar, ½ saco de arroz, ½ caja de leche, 10 casilleros de huevo, 2 bolsas de caramelos, 1 caja de chiche, 1 bolsa de chupetín.
Juana está convencida que para lograr algo hay que trabajar duro y dedicarse por entero y lo primordial... saber manejar su dinero y saber cómo invertirlo.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido incrementar su capital de trabajo y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 34, is a member of the Nuevo Eden community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  Her husband is an audio technician.  She has only worked with Manuela Ramos for a short time, but she's already managed to establish a small corner shop.  The shop is located in her house and she's used past loans to stock it with the merchandise she sells.  With this new loan, for S/.1,000.00 soles, she will buy cooking oil, snacks, pasta, sugar, rice, milk, eggs, candy, etc., all for resale.  Juana believes that you have to work hard to succeed and she understands the basic principles of success . . . know how to manage and invest your money.  Thanks for Manuela Ramos, she has been able to increase her working capital and grow her small business.

loans.use: to stock general store.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de poissons et de condiments.                                                                         
ALIMATA C., la présidente du groupe,  compte acheter des poissons avec les revendeurs de la ville. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are all married women who average 29 years of age and four children each. They live mostly in nuclear families in the town of Fana, sub-prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship and friendship. They are on their second group loan, which they will use to buy fish and condiments for resale.

Alimata C., president of the group, plans to buy fish from local resellers. She conducts her sales daily from her home and at the market, for cash or credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments, pay contributions to social ceremonies, and reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Maira Nieto

texts.es:
Maira tiene 35 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos, se dedica a atender un chalet donde vende productos domésticos, aprendió este negocio por sus amistades quienes la apoyaron para que diera inicio al negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para el chalet, satisfaciendo así la demanda de los clientes, y mejorando la condición de comerciante.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, ampliarse con otros productos y generar ingresos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maira is 35 years old. She lives with her children  in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután. She works in a chalet where she sells household products. Se learned this business from her friends who supported her and got her started.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy products for the chalet, thus satisfying customer demand and improving her status as a trader.

Her aim is to grow the business, expand to sell other products and generate income for her children.

loans.use: to buy products to stock up the chalet.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for ten years. During this time she has obtained many repeat customers who come again and again to buy clothing from her. 

There is a high demand for this type of clothing, so Zoya is going to continue developing her business. She has got enough energy and enthusiasm for this. Zoya also hopes that two her sons will continue this business in the future. 

Zoya would like to borrow 10,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase more seasonal clothing for sale. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for sale

loans.name: Lillian Auma

texts.en:
Lillian Auma is 32 years old married to Fredrick O..  She has been running her tailoring and retail shop for a period of about three years with an income of 10,500 Kenya shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member.  She wants to use the loan to buy textile materials and stock of sugar, maize, rice, and beans for the retail shop.  She hopes to improve her family’s living standard and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy textile materials and stock of sugar, maize, rice, and beans for the retail shop.

loans.name: Marina Beatriz

texts.es:
Marina tiene 26 años de edad, ella es casada y vive en el distrito de Olmos, conocida como la ciudad de limón, que está ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Marina se dedica ala venta de abarrotes, ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece  en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad.   El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, Marina se dedica a ésta labor desde hace varios años en los que ha adquirido experiencia en el rubro. Con estas actividades  ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Marina ha venido experimentando la ha  hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500  nuevos soles.

Marina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Marina is 26 years old, she is married and lives in the Olmos district, known as the city of Limon, which is located 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Marina makes a living selling groceries.  She has a small general store which she runs from her home.  She offers varied basic merchandise to her neighbors and customers.  The business has a very good customer base.  Marina has been doing this for several years and has developed experience in this trade.  With this activity she helps her husband to financially support the family.

The increasing demand that Marina has been experiencing for the store has made her want to expand it by acquiring more products.  For this reason she has come to request a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Marina is a hard working woman with good character, the people that know her have high regard and affection for her.

loans.use: to broaden her business by acquiring more merchandise.

loans.name: Elisol

texts.en:
Elisol is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food vending business, selling chicharon (fried pork rinds) in the Philippines for 10 years. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as pork skin and spices for her business. Elisol earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes and frozen products.

Elisol has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients.

loans.name: Consessa

texts.en:
Consessa is 40 years old. Her husband is a technician. Consessa  owns a general store in which she sells different kinds of items commonly used at home such as sugar, salt, matches  and a few snacks. She has been running this shop for the past three years and her business is going on well. This business, together with her husband, has enabled her to educate and feed her family and meet all the needs of her business. 

She needs a loan to expand her business by buying more items and stocking enough to reduce transport expenses and hence make more profit. She plans to buy a few things needed for her family with the profit she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar, salt, etc. to stock her store.

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.en:
Hazratkul makes a living using his taxi to transport people around Penjikent and surrounding areas. Personal vehicles are too expensive for most people to afford in Tajikistan. Transportation services such as buses and taxis like Hazratkul’s provide a valuable means of getting around for many, many people. Hazratkul currently makes around $10-$20 per day, enough for him to support himself and his family. Hazratkul has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to help him with some maintenance on his taxi. He has been in business for 11 years and has put a lot of kilometers on his car. Eventually he’d like to purchase a much newer car, but until that time, this loan will help him keep his vehicle in good working order. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain his taxi

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, a 30-year-old married man with no children, has been buying, selling, and repairing shoes to make a living since 2006. Grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving him finances to inject into his business, Alex is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy leather, a sewing machine, and shoes.

In the next five years he wants to establish another shop so that he can advance his dream of opening multiple outlets in the country.

loans.use: to buy leather, a sewing machine, and shoes.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Beth has a small retail shop, which she has had for five years. She is a teacher by profession.

To help expand her business, Beth has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of this loan from BRAC, Beth hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Beth hopes to expand her business. Beth is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio requires a loan to buy diverse inventory, such as shoes and secondhand appliances. He sells them mostly in his house and by walking (specially the shoes). He has been running his business for two years. Antonio lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.

Antonio has taken out four loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past two years. All of the loans have been paid back in full. He has used these loans to diversify the products that he sells. He is very excited about taking out this loan so that he can continue to grow his business.

Antonio says that his favorite thing is to do business and his most important challenge is to establish his business. He hopes to have solvency to solve any needs in the coming future. He has two children who live with their mother. They have been living separate for a long time. Even he said it is not a problem to provide for everything his children need.

loans.use: to buy shoes and secondhand appliances.

loans.name: C9237 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Fidelite is 46 years old and is married with nine children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling products such as:fruits and vegetables, beans, Irish potatoes etc. She is the team leader of this group which is called "Abishyizehamwe" in local language which means in English "Being together". 

In the picture, Fidelite is the second person on the right side. Her business hours are from 7am until 6pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her. She has four years of experience in this business. 

Fidelite and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by purchasing large quantities of products such as: vegetables and fruits, beans etc for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their future. They will be also able to pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of products such as: vegetables and fruits, beans etc for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 26-year-old young man, who is married and has one son. Ahmad owns a barber shop and he wants to purchase a barber kit in order to improve his service for his customers. Ahmad has not enough money to pay for a new barber kit, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Ahmad takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay easily to purchase a new barber kit and serve his customers better and so work extra to increase his income. Ahmad is photographed in the barber shop he owns.

loans.use: To purchase a barber kit in order to improve the quality of his service.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 57 años es casada y tiene dos hijos que tiene 22 y 28 años, vive con su familia en Cayambe que est+a a una media hora de Otavalo en el norte de Ecuador. Carmen se describe como una persona trabajadora y responsable.

Carmen trabaja con su esposo en la producción de ladrillos, ya son 4 años que solicita créditos a Fodemi, el actual crédito es para la compra de leña para la quema de ladrillos lo cual se hace para que el ladrillo se endurezca y su uso sea el óptimo.

Su sueño es que su negocio de la producción de ladrillos perdure y crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old.  She is married and has two children who are 22 and 28 years old.  She lives with her family in Cayambe, which is half an hour from Otavalo in the north of Ecuado.  Carmen describes herself as a hard-working and responsible person.

Carmen works with her husband producing bricks, and has been requesting loans from Fodemi for the last four years.  The current loan is for the purchase of firewood for firing the bricks, which is done so that the the brick hardens and becomes optimized for use.

Her dream is for her business to last, and for it to grow more every day.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for her brick kiln.

loans.name: María Manuela

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años divorciada, vive y trabaja con su madre al sur de la ciudad de Quito, capital del Ecuador en la parroquia "Guamaní". Esta parroquia es una de las más grandes de la ciudad y muy populosa. Aquí están situadas algunas grandes fábricas de alimentos (franquicias y locales) e incluso ensambladoras de autos.

Junto a su madre María vende comida en un mercado cercano a su vivienda, la jornada es larga y nos cuenta que hay días en los que las ventas son bajas y esto las perjudica mucho. Sin embargo ellas quieren seguir trabajando y para atraer más clientela quieren arreglar su puesto de comida y así tener mayores ingresos. Por esta razón ella acudió a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un crédito que le ayude con sus planes de inversión.

María aún piensa en sus hijos que ya están casados y nos dice que "quisiera tener salud para seguir trabajando" y poder así ayudar económicamente a sus hijos
texts.en:
María is a 46-year-old, divorced woman.  She lives and works with her mother in the south side of the city of Quito, capital of Ecuador, in Guamaní Parish.  This is one of the city’s largest parishes and it’s very densely populated.  Large food factories (franchises and local) are located here as well as auto assembly plants.

María and her mother sell food in a market near their home.  The work day is long and she tells us that some days sales are low which is problematic for her.  Nevertheless, they want to continue working and, in order to attract more customers, want to make some improvements to their food stall to have more income.  Because of this, she called upon Fundación Alternativa in search of a loan that will help her with this investment plan.

María still thinks of her children who are all married and she tells us: “I’d like to stay healthy so that I can continue to work” to help her children economically this way.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her food stall.

loans.name: C2197  Abizeye Yesu Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 27 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. He is the leader of this group, which is called “Abizeye yesu” in the local language. In the picture, he is in the middle in the white shirt.

Jean Baptiste sells charcoal and he has been working for three years. His business is open from 6 am until 5 pm every day.

Jean Baptiste and his group have requested a loan from the Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. With any profits from the loan, Jean Baptiste and his team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses, and start saving for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda, 36, is married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Gilda is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Gilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Gilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 36 years old and is married with a four year old child. For the past four years, he has been farming in his home area of Nkubu, Central Kenya. Nicholas grows maize, beans, and bananas on his farm along with milk that he sells to the local market. He also operates as a chemist in the local market and his major business challenge is the high rate of animal disease.

Nicholas is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into pig farming business by buying pigs and feed. This is his second loan request with Juhudi after promptly repaying his first 30,000 KES loan. Nicholas says that his new venture will strengthen his farming business and generate more income due to the high rate at which pigs reproduce. He will use his income to pay for his child’s education and he plans to buy more land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 25 años es una madre soltera de una niña de 6 años. Ella y Yamila, su hija, viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro. Mónica nació en el seno de una familia agricultora. Por esa razón aprendió las labores del campo. En sus parcelas de terrenos cultiva café y plátanos. “El café se cosecha una vez al año, pero con el plátano ya tenemos 2 cosechas al mes”, menciona. Con el apoyo de personal al que contrata, para las labores del campo, puede darse el lujo de atender un pequeño negocio en donde expende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, gaseosas, etc. De esa manera cuida a su hija dentro de su casa. Mónica considera rentable la siembra del plátano, ya que la arroba la vende a 6 soles, y cada quincena cosecha 30 arrobas. Por su parte, con el café obtiene ingresos mayores. Las 4 parcelas de terrenos le ofrecen 60 sacos de café de 100 kilos. Cada kilo lo vende de 10 a 15 soles. “Depende de la temporada”, puntualiza. Con el tiempo, esta abnegada madre, quiere consolidar su negocio y no descuidar sus cultivos. Además anhela ver a su hija, educarse en buenos colegios. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, por lo que confía en que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas designadas. “Los Cafetaleros”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que afirma sentirse cómoda y a gusto. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, los que consistirán en sacos de arroz, azúcar, carnes, conservas, gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
25-year old Mónica is the single mother of a 6-year old daughter called Yamila. They live in their own house in the district of San Luis de Shuaro. Mónica was born into a farming family so she learned how to work the land. She grows coffee and bananas in her fields.

“Coffee is harvested once per year,” Mónica explains, “but we harvest bananas twice per month.” With help from labourers on contract to do the farm work, she can afford the time to run a small business selling basics such as rice, sugar, meat, and soft drinks. This allows her to look after her daughter in the house.

Mónica says that bananas are a profitable crop as she sells an arroba (unit of weight between 11 and 16 kg depending on the region) for 6 soles, and she harvests 30 arrobas every two weeks. The profits from coffee are even greater. From her four parcels of land she gets sixty 100 kilo bags. Each kilo sells for 10-15 soles depending on the season.

As time passes, this disciplined woman wishes to put her business on a more sound footing while not neglecting her farm. As well, her greatest wish is to see her daughter educated in good schools. 

This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is confident that she will be able to make the repayments on time. “Los Cafetaleros” is the name of her community bank, and she notes that she feels comfortable with the group and enjoys being with them. She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, meat, canned food, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, canned food, and soft drinks

loans.name: Vania

texts.es: La socia Vania; continua con su negocio propio en artesanía, la socia elabora bellas muñecas de trapos con mantas tejidas, y ella también vende, espejos, y mantas tejidas con lana de alpaca, lana de oveja y lanas sinteticas; la socia también vende gorritos de lana, tejidos a mano, la socia aprende todo el arte y le esta yendo muy bien, la socia tiene un stand en el centro de la ciudad, la socia en esta ocasión y como su negocio es nuevo esta implementando siempre el local y los productos de arte. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de telares, de muñecas de trapo, de adornos tipicos, de llaveros y otros para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Vania continues with her own handicraft business. She makes beautiful rag dolls with woven blankets, and also sells mirrors and woven blankets made with alpaca, sheep, and synthetic wool. Additionally, she sells hand-knitted wool hats. She is learning about all aspects of handicrafts and things are going well for her. She has a stand in the center of the city. At this time, and because her business is new, Vania is always helping out at the stand and with her hand-crafted products. She is requesting the loan to invest by purchasing a loom, rag dolls, typical ornaments, key rings, and other items to increase her sales.

loans.use: to invest by purchasing a loom, rag dolls, typical ornaments, key rings, and other items to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze, 30, is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the electricity bill. 

Mbodze operates a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge is competition from other retail shop operators.  In the future, she would like to access bigger loans to boost her business.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000,  Mbodze wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 32-year-old mirror hawker in Voi. He is single and has been in the business for the past ten years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers and this marks his first borrowing to enable him to expand his business. He plans to purchase more stock of mirrors and use the anticipated profits to repay his KADET loan and be able to have a permanent shop for his mirrors. He hopes to have a big and more profitable business and a happy, satisfied family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of mirrors.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is married with 3 children. Isidra is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Isidra is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of  PHP 12000 to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Isidra has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Isidra hopes to have enough savings for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer and bottles of pesticide

loans.name: Nancy Olinda

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 10, 6 y 4 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.

Ella además de ser una gran madre y ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, las cuales compra sin terminar y ella les da un bonito acabado, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, las artesanías las compra a artesanos de la zona ya que según ella son de la mejor calidad que hay. Lleva 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanías, pinturas, laca y otros materiales para darles el acabado correcto. Lleva cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y crecer cada día mas en el.
texts.en:
In La Pila in Montecristi the “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” (For the Future of Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.  This place is very well known in the province and in the country because of its rich traditional culture.  In this place one can find a great variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants following traditional customs.

We met Nancy, 31, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 10, 6 and 4 years old.  The two oldest attend school and her husband’s a laborer.

Besides being a great mother and housewife she’s also a merchant.  She sells decorations and ceramics.  She has a stand at home where she sells all types of crafts that she buys unfinished and she adds pretty finishing touches to them.  She works every day from 8am until 5pm.  She buys the crafts from local craftsmen because according to her they are the best quality.  She’s been in this line of work for 3 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy more crafts, paint, lacquer and other supplies to give them the correct finishing.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because interest rates are very low.  Her dream is to stay in business and to grow more in it each day.

loans.use: to buy crafts, paint, lacquer and other supplies.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, the married mother of a one-year-old daughter, describes herself as an honest person who operates a grocery store selling vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business, located in a busy area, for 10 years.

Ann's biggest business challenge is the high cost of vegetables and fruits, and she will use this Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits. Ann's business goal is to run a well-stocked grocery store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Maria Celina

texts.pt: Maria Celina's financial situation was precarious before she started taking loans. She is a single mother of 5 children and hard worker. Her initial activity was sand extraction, where sand is gathered from natural beaches and sold for use in the construction industry, a practice that harms the environment and provides insufficient income. Today she has a new job selling produce at the central market. Her first loan was 25,000CVE that was reimbursed on time, and she continued to increase her loan amounts until she reached the maximum amount ASDIS offers, 500,000CVE. She is a resolute, determined and honest person. So ASDIS is always supporting her in her development by providing training and offering new services. ASDIS aims to finance her to create self-employment and empowerment.

loans.use: sales of agricultural products

loans.name: Kavule Kwekamba Womens Group

texts.en:
Kyaza is 38 years old and married with five children, and he lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He deals in a retail business, selling mainly sugar, rice, maize flour, ground nuts, cooking oil, and soft drinks. He also operates a bakery and motorcycle transport for additional income. 

He has future prospects of educating his children and building a residential house for the family but is faced with challenges of inadequate capital that hinder expansion of his business. Kyaza is hardworking and operates on a busy street in town. 

He is requesting a loan to buy wheat, cassava, and maize flour for the retail and bakery businesses.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cassava, and maize flour for the retail and bakery businesses.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Born in 1994, Clara, a young lady from Chouf, lives with her parents in an apartment in their hometown.

Her father is a retired army officer and receives a monthly pension, and her mom works as a promoter for a well known makeup brand.

Clara is single and started a home-based business working as a makeup artist in 2012. She also gives private lessons to young students at home during her free time.

For the first time, Clara is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pound loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy new makeup products that she uses a lot. With the help of this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her work and increase her income, which will allow her to pay the last settlement of her university tuition before she graduates.

Clara has a lot of determination. She is a grade-A student and is working hard to improve her business and at the same time in order to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy new makeup products and tools for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Maria del Socorro is a 42 year old woman, she is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Since she was young she likes sales. In the beginning, she only sold shoes that her brother made, but last year she complemented her sales by offering products such as nutritional complements (Herbalife) and has seen such excitement from her clients. She started her business in order to be self-sufficient and support her family, because her children were little kids at that time.

Nowadays her clients who buy nutritional complements have been increased and that why she is requesting a loan of $475 USD for working capital to invest in merchandise and to be able to supply the orders requested by her clients. She wants to repay in a term of 3-6 months.

ESPAÑOL

Maria del Socorro es una mujer de 42 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es un trabajador del área de la construcción. Desde joven a ella le han gustado las ventas, inicio hace 17 años con las ventas de zapatos que fabricaba su hermano, pero desde hace un año complementa sus ventas ofreciendo productos que son complementos alimenticios (Herbalife) y tiene mucha aceptación entre sus clientes. Ella inicio su negocio con la idea de tener ingresos propios y ayudar a su familia, ya que sus hijos estaban muy pequeños en aquél tiempo.

Hoy en día se han incrementado sus clientes que le compran los complementos alimenticios y es por eso que solicita un crédito por $ 475 USD para capital de trabajo, para comprar inventario de productos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrece pagarlo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is a 55-year-old widow who specializes in producing and selling peanuts to local markets and individuals on request. This business is successful as Temukisa also sells at the local market and businesses in her village.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 4 children.  She sells watermelon in the market and her husband is a security guard.  Together, they earn about $12/day.  S. will use this loan to buy some sugar cane and a juice cart so that she can start a new business.  She is confident that she can sell a lot of juice and boost her income so that she will be able to send her children to high school.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane and a juice cart

loans.name: Tadjeddin

texts.en: Tadjeddin A. has been running his cattle breeding business for 10 years.  He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has two children. He wants to expand his business in order to cover all his family expenses, so he is requesting a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam J. is 33-year-old trader who owns his market where he sells toiletry products and beverages. Islam is internally dislocated person who fled to Saatli during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Saatli region is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan and Islam lives with his wife and two children in a refugee town. Islam started his business in 2004.  Toiletry products sells very well and Islam decided to expand his business and open a new food section in his market. He applied for $1200 USD to purchase his first consignment of food.

loans.use: To broaden his store by opening a food section

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieyuwa E. is 33 years old, married mother of 5 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs to people living in her community. She has 10 years' experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 400 to enable her to buy a larger quantity and variety of foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her little shop

loans.name: Aydin

texts.ru:
Born in 1957, Aydin A. lives in Agsu. He is married and has 6 children. For more than 30 years, Aydin A. has been a barber. More than 5 years ago, he opened his own barber shop. To service his customers better, Aydin needs to purchase modern tools. He applied for this loan to finance the purchase.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуллайев Айдын.Родился и проживает в г.Ахсу.1957 года рождения.Семейный. Имеет шестерых детей. Более тридцати лет занимается в сфере обслуживания- мужской парикмахер. Более пяти лет тому назад открыл личную парикмахерскую.Для качественного обслуживания населения ему не хватает современного оборудования и поэтому он нуждается в кредите.

loans.use: To purchase modern barber tools

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, a native of the Tilali district of Puno, Peru, devoted herself to agriculture and ranching alongside her family for many years. But to improve their quality of life, they decided to leave their home village. Since then, they’ve been living in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to her initiative and interest, she decided to get into selling fuel, rapidly making her family one of the main providers of fuel in the area. Mrs. Virginia and her family wish to continue with their work, which is why they hope to rely on additional cash to invest in their prosperous business. With the goal of making their plans into reality, they turn to your kind heart and united support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Virginia, es natural del distrito de Tilali - Puno, hace algunos años se dedicaba junto a su esposo e hijos a la agricultura y ganadería, pero por mejorar su calidad de vida, decidieron partir del pueblito que los vió nacer.Desde entonces radican en la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a su iniciativa e interés decidió incursionar en la comercialización de combustible, convirtiendo a su familia en uno de los principales proveedores de combustible de la zona.El deseo de doña Virginia y su laboriosa familia es seguir progresando con esta labor y es por eso que desean contar con mayor capital para invertirlos en su próspero negocio.A fin de concretar sus planes recurren a tu buen corazón y solidario apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of fuel.

loans.name: Amanda Aida's Group

texts.en:
Amanda and Yeni have been members of the community bank “Amaqella” for five years and eight months respectively. In that time they have learned how to be punctual, productive, and to save. In addition, they have learned about respect and how to respect themselves as well as others.

Amanda is 50 years old and has five children. She sells a variety of different foods from a cart in Ayacucho. She has been running this business for 17 years. In addition, she travels to markets around the region to buy food staples such as grains and cheeses, which she sells in Ayacucho. Before that she was a city official in the town of Huamanga. She was unable to continue in Ayacucho, because she does not speak Quehua, the indigenous language of the area.

Yeni is 28 and has two children. She is a nurse, but is currently concentrating on raising her children. She and her husband have a business selling CDs and DVDs. Her husband also works in the country part of the time growing vegetables.

Amanda and Yeni need loans of 800 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying bread, cheese, vegetables, and CDs. The community bank emphasizes he importance saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Amanda and Yeni are saving to buy land and improve their homes. Their dreams are to give their children a better life.

loans.use: Amanda and Yeni need loans of 800 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying bread, cheese, vegetables, and CDs.

loans.name: Evgeni

texts.en: Evgeni M. is 38 years old.  He is married and has two sons. Evgeni is a saw mill operator and for many years has had a small workshop for wooden materials. He works alone, although sometimes one of his sons helps him. Evgeni wants to buy a new motor saw to improve his work, and has applied for a loan of $775 (1,000 BGN).

loans.use: To buy a new motor saw.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zahida P., and I have lived all my life in Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: three boys and two girls. Both of my daughters are married, and the boys are currently working. Unfortunately, I could not educate my children due to our impoverished conditions. I cut almost 100 bags daily out of cloth on order from a factory, which then stitches them on machines. My husband drives a horse cart, a popular means of transport here in Pakistan, but he sold his horse for our daughter’s marriage; we now need a loan to buy a new horse.

The women in my group who will share in the loan are: Sajida B., who sews bags; Rubina H., who will pay off the remaining installment for her business; P. Q., who intends to expand the family plastic pipes manufacturing business, and Fazeelat B., whose husband sells fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a new horse.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with 4 children, ages 25, 20, 18 and 15 years old. Mwanaidi owns a small grocery store and she sells clothes. She started in 1990. Every day, she works from 7am to 12.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is a very hard working woman and her anxiousness to progress motivates her daily work harvesting grasses for cattle feed. For a long time she has been the principal source of income for her family; now with the help that all of you can provide her the opportunity to begin growing potatoes and corn in her fertile field.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sus ansias de progresa la motivan día a día a dedicarse a la agricultura sembrando pastos para la alimentación del ganado. Durante mucho tiempo esta ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia; ahora y con la ayuda que vosotros podéis brindarle la oportunidad su radio de acción para iniciar la siembra de papa y maíz en sus fértiles campos de cultivo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
