Ban M., 44, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Van Vuth, and their four children. Two of their children are students in the local school and two are able to help support the family by working at the garment factory.

Ban M. sells vegetables in the market each day, making three dollars, while her husband makes five dollars each day as a farmer. She has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a tractor that she can both use and rent to other farmers for some extra income. It is common in Cambodia for people who own a tractor to rent it out to other farmers and it can turn into a profitable business venture. She believes that this will be a good investment for her family to improve its standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. was born in 1950. She is one of three wives and a mother of eight children, all of whom are above the age of 15. “My son and his wife died leaving me with a young baby”, she further explains, “So my husband and I are left to take care of the family. My children are not doing anything to bring in a living and my husband is a subsistence farmer who brings no income to the family.”

Diana has been a member of GHAPE for three years now and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in buying and selling palm oil, pigs, and farming crops like beans, maize, cassava, corn, and potatoes. The profits have helped her to pay school fees for her children and to take care of some of her family’s other basic needs.

Diana is requesting a loan of $300 to expand her palm oil and pig businesses and to increase the size of her farm by adding more land. She is convinced that her business is going to succeed because nearly all households need palm oil to cook, and people come from far and near to buy them. Her farm currently provides her family with all the staple crops they need, and if she farms more land, she may be able to sell the surplus.

She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: Farming cassava, pigs and poultry. Buying and selling palm oil.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola is a member of the La Familia (The Family) Communal Bank, situated in Jr. Calle 16 Mz. 1 Lt.4, of the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 55 years of age and is the mother of one daughter. She is a widow. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, Lola decided to invest in the sale of clothing and prepared dishes.

Currently, Lola continues with her clothing business and the sale of grilled foods on Saturdays, Sundays and special occasions.

With this loan of S/ 1.500, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase clothing merchandise such as one dozen men’s shirts, undergarments, two dozen polo-type shirts, two dozen women’s pants, one dozen women’s tops and half a dozen of women’s sneakers.

Lola is not discouraged despite certain difficulties in her life and is extremely grateful to count with the support of a bank like Manuela Ramos, which gives her the opportunity of receiving a loan that enables her to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lola, pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Jr. Calle 16 Mz.1 Lt.4, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años es madre de 1 hija y es viuda, Lola con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de mercadería de ropa y comida

Lola, en la actualidad continúa con su venta de mercadería de ropa y venta de parrilladas los días sábados, domingos y días particulares.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1.500 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mercadería de ropa, como 1 docena de camisa para caballeros ropas interiores 2 docenas de polos para caballeros, 2 docenas de pantalones para damas, 1 docena de blusas para damas y ½ docena de sniker para damas.

Lola, es una mujer que no desmaya a pesar de ciertas dificultades que se le presentó en su vida y esta completamente agradecida de poder contar con un banco como Manuela Ramos que le da la oportunidad de brindarle préstamo ya que gracias a ello puede hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Азимуродов Рустам родился 24 сентября 1963 года, женат. Он торговец обуви уже много лет и в его ассортименте можно найти все разновидности обуви, начиная от самых современных для деловых встреч и заканчивая для самых маленьких джентльменов.  А торгует он на рынке «Хайр» города Вахдат и помогает ему в этом жена. Азимуродов закупает товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон».  У Рустама в рынке есть лавка и у него есть мечта, как у любого начинающего предпринимателя, он хочет купить себе магазин. В связи с этим и с целью расширения наименование товаров ему бы хотелось получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Rustam A. was born on September 24, 1963, he is married. He has been selling shoes for many years and all kinds of shoes could be found in his assortment starting from very modern business shoes to shoes for little gentlemen. He sells on the Hayre market in the town of Vahdat and his wife is also helping him. Rustam buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Kovron. Rustam has a vendor space on the market and like any beginning entrepreneur he has a dream to have his own store. To make this possible and to expand the variety of offered merchandise, he wants to get a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni ($1,175USD).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal shoes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. habite à Ouakam et vend du couscous depuis maintenant six ans. Elle peut gagner certains jours jusqu'à 5000 fcfa. Elle est mariée et avec ses recettes elle s'occupe de sa famille et gére ses propres besoins. Elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Awa D. lives in Ouakam and has been selling couscous for six years now. On some days, she can earn up to 5,000 francs CFA. She is married, and through her income, she takes care of her family and her own expenses. She is requesting a loan to bolster her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in couscous

loans.name: Kokumo

texts.en:
Kokumo A. is 28 years old and married with a child.  She owns a phone booth where she sells phone accessories and rechargeable phone cards.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  

She is requesting the loan amount of $425 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support, and LAPO microfinance for their business training.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Lima

texts.en: Lima A., 57, is married with six children.  She has three years of experience in the taro, taamu, banana business. She sells to the village people and to the public two days per week. She is a new member, and she has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala.  SPBD loans are Lima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: Purchase more farming equipment to maintain business improvement

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay.
Catalina es casada, tiene 49 años y 9 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias y pueblos de donde compra cereales, quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también vende flores de manera ambulatoria. Además en temporadas vende tuna al por mayor y menor.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tuna por cajas.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su casa, cultivar papa en sus tierras y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Community Bank Ollantay. Catalina is married. She is 49 years old and has 9 children. She goes to fairs in different towns to purchase cereal, cheese, to later on sell them at the markets of the city of Ayacucho. She also sells flowers on the streets of the city. During prickly pear season, she sells this product as a retailer. Catalina needs a 750 soles loan, which she will use to purchase prickly pears in boxes. Catalina’s dream is to make home improvements, farm potatoes and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prickly pears in boxes

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa Z. vive en Zacatecoluca departamento  La Paz, Josefa vive con sus dos hijas que son madres solteras y sus nietos, Josefa se dedica a la venta de mariscos, todos los días sale desde muy temprano de su casa al muelle El Malecón, para comprar de las pesca más fresca luego se desplaza para vender sus maricos  en el  mercado del pueblo donde ella reside. Ahora Josefa solicita un crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de mariscos y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Josefa Z. lives in Zacatecoluca, in the department of La Paz. Josefa lives with her two daughter, who are single mothers, and her grandchildren. Josefa sells seafood: every day she leaves home very early for the El Malecón pier in order to buy the freshest fish. She walks throughout the village market of her village to sell her seafood. Now, Josefa is asking for a loan to buy fish in larger quantities and therefore make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood for retail

loans.name: Top's Group

texts.en:
Saroen leads a group of three borrowers. She has four children, all of whom are single. One works in a garment factory, one works as a Global Apparels Limited employee, and the other two are students. She is a good manager and a responsible neighbor. She has recently had difficulties with her family's transportation. The family cannot always use a motor taxi driver. Saroen is taking out a loan to buy a motorbike for their transportation. 

The other group members are C., age 46, and P., age 19.  C. is employed as a garment worker, and is taking out a loan to renovate her house. P. is also a garment worker, and is applying for a loan to build a kitchen. They all live in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's transportation

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Bancomunal Las Palmeras.
Patricia es conviviente tiene 43 años tres hijos de 20, 19, y 1 año, sus hijos estudian en el instituto y también trabajan. 
Patricia trabajó desde mucho tiempo lavando ropa y cocinando en casas, hasta que decidió ponerse a vender  ropa usada y ropa nueva en pista nueva.
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para la compra de ropa usada y ropa nueva.
Desde que esta en Finca, Patricia aprendió a invertir su dinero y ahorra, su economía ha mejorado.
El sueño de Patricia es tener un local para su negocio de ropa.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the "Las Palmeras" community bank. Patricia is in a common-law marriage; she is 43 years old and has three children aged 20, 19 and one. Her older children study as well as work. Patricia had been working for a long time washing clothing and cooking in private homes, until she decided to begin selling second-hand and new clothing. Patricia needs a loan of 600 soles to buy used and new clothing. Since joining Finca, Patricia has learned to invest her money and now her financial situation has improved. Patricia's dream is to have a set locale for her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en:
Adebayo is 43 years old and married with three children. Adebayo sells engine oil from a tank and he makes a good profit. He hopes to expand this business.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario T. S. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Filomena Tambo y sus cinco hijos.
Mario es constructor, realizando trabajos en construcciones particulares y su esposa teje guantes para una asociación de artesanos de su barrio.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un baño en su vivienda, dado que realizaron la instalación de alcantarillado en su domicilio.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mario T. S. owns his house, which is in the Llojeta zone, the western side of La Paz city. He lives with his wife, Filomena Tambo, and their five children. Mario is a builder, he works on private construction projects and his wife knits gloves for an artisan's association in their neighborhood. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a bathroom in their home, since they have finished installing a sewage system for their house. This is Mario's third loan request and the analysis of his application favorably qualifies him to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: E. Adèle est née vers 1981 à Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Adèle est mariée à AGBODJALOU Jean-Marie, un cuisinier de profession. Adèle et Jean-Marie ont deux enfants: Falonne et Mariella. Falonne est scolarisée et Mariella n'a pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école. Adèle habite avec sa famille le quartier AGLA à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est la coiffure que Adèle mais elle n'a jamais exercé. Adèle s'est plutôt lancée dans la vente de vêtements et de tissus. C'est de façon ambulante à travers Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin que Adèle vend ses articles. Adèle va s'approvisionner en vêtements et tissus à Lomé, Capitale du TOGO, pays frontalier au Bénin. Adèle a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Aujourd'hui encore, Adèle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour agrandir son étalage de tissus.
texts.en:
E. Adèle was born around 1981 in Abomey, in Zou County. She is married to AGBODJALOU Jean-Marie, a cook by profession. Adèle and Jean-Marie have two children: Falonne and Mariella. Falonne is in school, and Mariella is not yet old enough to go to school. She lives with her family in the AGLA district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Adèle is a hairdresser but never working in that trade. Rather, she got started in selling clothing and fabrics. In an itinerant manner, she goes throughout Cotonou selling her merchandise. She goes to stock up on clothing and fabrics in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. Adèle has already had two loans with ALIDÉ for boosting her working capital. Today, she's requesting this third loan to expand her display of fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bolts of Hitarget cloth (12 meters each)

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda I. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su hijo Miguel de 24 años edad y su hermano de 55 años de edad ambos trabajan como albañiles. Arminda se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos que los consigue viajando hasta la frontera que colinda con Guatemala ya que allí logra conseguir precios más bajos permitiéndole obtener mejores ganancias, Arminda solicita este crédito por que quiere aumentar su inventario ya que posee poca variedad de estilos y tallas de sus productos, Arminda ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente donde ha sido puntual en todas sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Arminda I. lives in the department of Ahuachapan together with her 24 year-old son, Miguel and her 55 year-old brother who both work as masons. Arminda sells clothes and shoes which she buys travelling to the border of Guatemala as prices are lower there and allow her to increase her earnings. Arminda requests this loan in order to increase her inventory as she has little variety of styles and sizes. Arminda has been punctual in repaying prior loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply inventory.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mercedes tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah, casada, y con dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad que cursan la, su esposo es pensionado. Su negocio es la venta de enchilada y otra variedad de fritanga anteriormente vendía productos de cosméticos, tiene un año de vender comida, lo inicio con el propósito de obtener mejores ganancias ya que la comida se vende diario, este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, bloques, hierros, cemento entre otros para construir un cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones junto a su familia. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para lograr su objetivo de mejorar su vivienda como ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 37 years old, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married, has two children ages 10 and 14 who are in school, her husband is a pensioner. Her business is selling enchiladas and other fried snacks. Previously she sold cosmetics. She has been selling food for a year, and began with the idea of obtaining greater income because food she can sell daily. This is her fourth loan cycle with Afodenic. She will invest in buying construction materials such as: rock, sand, blocks, iron, cement and other items to be able to build a room and have better living conditions for her family. She is grateful to Afodenic for its support in helping her achieve her objective of improving her home in turn helping her school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Isedra

texts.en: Isedra M. is from the village of Zone 17, Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has ten school-aged children. Isedra owns and operates a carenderia (a stall selling cooked food) and a sari-sari (variety) store, selling specialty food products and grocery items in the local community. She has been engaged in her businesses for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In July 2009, Isedra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 17, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo  trabaja en una empresa de refrescos llamada Mendocina S.R.L. ahí desempeña el cargo de supervisor de área, su esposa se dedica a la compra venta de refrescos, esas son la fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija, vive en de sus padres, esta  ubicado en la Las Lomas de la ciudad de La paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de refrescos así la esposa tendrá mas mercadería para poder comercializar.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Reynaldo.
texts.en:
Reynaldo works in a refreshments business of called Mendocina S. R. L. He works there as an area supervisor. His wife is dedicated to the purchase and sale of refreshments. They are the source of income with which they pay for the maintenance of their small daughter. He lives in his parents home, which is located in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase refreshments so his wife will have more merchandise to be able to market. This is his third loan with Impro. His good payment history allows Impro to approve another loan requested by Reynaldo.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy refreshements for resale

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe D. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 36 years old. Ma. Fe is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Ma. Fe owns and operates a business where she makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. Ma. Fe has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ma. Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ma. Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is a villager from the An Doung Samreth Village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows rice and vegetables. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and it is far from an irrigation system. To solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rent a water pump. She will use the rest of money to buy three cows for breeding. 

Her husband, Mr. Chea Chhorn, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Sopheap S. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, two are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a water pump

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem Koeum is 43 years old and sells cakes in the local market to earn a living and is able to make US$3.5 of profit every day. She has six children, three of who are employed and three other are in school. Her husband, Chhoun Vorn, 36, is a motor-taxi driver who is able to make US$2.5 every day. Kem is asking for a loan of US$1000 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her husband. The old motorbike is fixed many times and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a hard-working person and over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to help her husband with family expenses. She is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and after fattening sells in the local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Mukaddas is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni for purchasing calves. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna sells "chicharon" (dried pork skin)  in their village.  She is already a widow and left to care for an eight-year old son named Mark, an elementary student.  Lorna would like to avail a loan PHP5,000 to expand her business so she can earn income which will allow her to buy additional educational materials for her child who is studying. She hopes that she could avail of the loan amount she is requesting.

Lorna is hoping that she could sustain the needs of her child. Through her business she could improve their way of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S., 52 years of age, is a widow having two children: Emiliano, 31 years of age, and Mayflor, 28 years of age. Nenita lives in the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, in Isabela province.

Nenita is contented with what she has right now. She want to spend her time in her business, because her two children are already married.

Nenita manages a vegetable-vending business, selling at the public market of Cauayan City. Her weekly net income is Php 300. She wants to obtain a loan of Php 5,000 for her additional requirements in her business.

Nenita continuously gains patience and a strong determination for the success of her business. She said that being diligent is her way to reach her goals in life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital in her vegetable-vending business

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 50 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a commercial tailor. She sells groceries and drinks to earn a living. She is a hard working woman. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 30 years old, is married, and is the mother of two children. Currently one is in school and her last born is still breastfeeding. Yaa lives with her children in the Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Yaa is a petty trader who loves selling goods, the business which is her source of livelihood. She has been selling foodstuffs like tubers of yam, maize, etc., for six years now to support her family. She treks to farming communities like Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana to buy her stock of foodstuffs. Sometimes she spends days in the villages just to buy a large quantity of foodstuffs. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, Yaa wants to bulk-buy tubers of yam, maize, etc., to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extension of work

loans.name: Afde Group No. 19

texts.en:
Afde group No.19 is led by Ms. Maymouna D., aged 50.  Since her husband's retirement, she has been working as a vendor to make ends meet.  Like many women in the market, she sells palm oil and smoked fish.  Ms. Sarr D., aged 40, is the group's treasurer.  She also sells smoked fish, in addition to various vegetables and has been active in the trade for 17 years.  She is married and the mother of five. The other three members of the group are: Fatou Kébé, who has a small breakfast stall, Aissatou N. and Awa N. who sell vegetables.  Each member recieves a loan of 100,000 FCFA to reinforce their activities.

L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by twenty entrepenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.

loans.use: To finance her fish-selling business

loans.name: Agar

texts.en:
Agar A. is from the village of Dicoloc,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Agar is married. To make a living, Agar owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, juice pack, candies,soap & toothpaste in the local community. Agar has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agar is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Agar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 57 year old father of three children.  He has seen two of his children through school and his last born is in college.   He was formerly employed in a construction firm before he ventured in a metal fabrication business.

His business has been running for ten years and he employs three people.  He also earns extra income from farming.  He feels that Faulu Kenya is a very wonderful MFI and even wished that he would have joined a long time ago as he claims that he would have achieved his dreams.

He requests Kes.50,000  to buy metal to add to his stock.  He hopes to own a factory which deals with metal fabrication in the future.

loans.use: Add stock of metal for welding business

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Don Marlon es un hombre de negocio, de 32 años de edad, vive en el barrio Reparto Schik junto  a su esposa y un hijo de 12 años de edad, el cual cursa la primaria. Su negocio es la venta de películas, dvd de música, de videos, controles, carcasas, portacd, y lo que le encarguen sus clientes, el inicio este negocio, con dinero de su trabajo pues se dedicaba a la construcción, trabajo cansado las dificultades es que había semana en donde no trabajaba por falta de proyectos, lo cual comienza ahorrar y pone su  venta de cd, el cual poco a poco comenzó a invertir, ahora solo se dedica al negocio, otras dificultades es cuando se va luz y no puede probar la música a sus clientes en donde se le bajan las ventas por la desconfianza del cliente que el disco le salga malo. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar accesorios de celulares, películas, música, controles, batería para radio, cargadores de celulares y otros que le generen ganancias. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras en el local de sus ventas ya que es cerrado de zinc y teme que se le metan a robar es por eso le urge las mejoras que espera pronto hacer para mejor beneficio  de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon, 32, is a businessman. He lives in the Reparto Schik neighborhood with his wife and 12-year-old son, who is in elementary school. Marlon sells movies on DVD, music DVDs, videos, remote controls, cases, CD cases and whatever else his customers order from him. He launched his business using savings from his job in construction. This was exhausting work and often he would go for weeks without any job offers. He started to put away some savings to set up his CD sales shop. Gradually, he invested more and now this is his sole source of income. Among his challenges are power failures. When this happens his customers are unable to sample the CDs and his sales drop because they don’t trust that the CD will be in good condition. He will use the funds to buy cell phone accessories, movies, music, controls, radio batteries, cell phone chargers and other items that will generate profits. His plans are to make improvements to his shop because it’s currently just secured with zinc metal sheeting and he fears that robbers could gain access. For this reason, improvements are urgent and he hopes to do them for the benefit of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy DVDs, CDs, cell phone cases, chargers, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Anaran wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Seeman wants a loan to buy items (shaving blades, scissors) for her family's barber shop. Manzooran wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. 

Suraiya is the group leader of the above-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Suraiya owns & operates her sewing clothes business. She sews clothes of her neighborhood ladies and generates income. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 

Suraiya’s husband's name is N. M. and he is a loader by profession. He loads different items such as (cement, bricks) on his donkey cart and delivers them to different places and earns income. Currently, his cart has become rough and broken in different places. Therefore Suraiya is requesting a loan to buy a new donkey cart so that he will be able to continue his work without any gap.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Baby  Yawa

texts.fr:
En 2008, cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de détail de savons qu’elle fabrique elle-même et qu’elle a appelé «SI JE SAVAIS », elle réalise de grosses recettes car ses savons  sont de bonnes qualités et sa clientèle en est satisfaite . elle a reçu une commende malheureusement elle ne dispose pas suffisamment d’entrants pour fabriquer les savons, elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour obtenir son premier crédit afin d’acheter 3 bidons d’huile, une quantité suffisante de soude, du colorant,  du sel, et du charbons.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce, elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2008, this woman launched a retail business of self-made soap that she has named “Si Je Savais “(If I knew). Her income is good because her soaps are of good quality and the customers are satisfied. She received a large order, but unfortunately the ingredients are insufficient to make the soaps. Therefore she contacted WAGES to obtain a first credit loan to buy 3 containers of oil, an adequate quantity of lye, dyes, salt and coal. She is married and the mother of two children. With the income generated by her business, she contributes towards family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, lye, dyes and salt

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es: Reyna Maribel M. D. C. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en  Cantón La Poza, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos D. 9 y 12 años D. edad. Reyna posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, los cuales venD. en su casa D. habitación, debido a que es la única tienda que existe en el cantón en el que resiD., posee muchos clientes, los cuales a diario consumen sus productos, razón por la que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir más en el negocio, comprando más productos como: pan, agua embotellada, comida enlatada, embutidos, leche y todo lo necesario para poder satisfacer las necesidades primordiales D. sus clientes. Para Reyna mejorar su negocio es muy necesario ya que este le ayuda a mantener una estabilidad económica aceptable tanto para ella y su esposo como para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reyna Maribel M. D. C. is 33 years old. She lives in the La Poza canton, which is located in the Usulután department. She lives with her husband, who works, and their two children, ages 9 and 12. Rosa has a store where she sells basic needs products. She sells them in her house. Because it is the only store in the canton, she has a lot of customers who consume her products everyday. That is the reason she is requesting a loan to be able to have the necessary money to invest more in her business. She will buy more products like bread, bottled water, canned food, sausages, milk, and everything needed to be able to satisfy her customers’ basic needs. Improving her business is very important to Rosa because this helps her maintain an acceptable level of economic stability for herself, her husband, and for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products

loans.name: Magrete

texts.en:
Magrete is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks- this is a business she has been doing since 10 years. With the business she has been able to make things easier for her family. She resides in Edo State with her family and they are living happily.

	Magrete needs the loan amount for NGN 40,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.es: Ester tiene 40 años, ella es una mujer trabajadora que vive con sus 3 hijos y su madre, llamada Ema de 60 años, a quien atiende y la ayuda en su trabajo. Desde hace varios años se dedica en la Venta de emoliente (bebida elaborada con hierbas naturales) y de otras bebidas Calientes, que previamente son preparadas en su casa. Su punto de venta se encuentra a una hora y media de su vivienda, siendo las tardes en que empieza a vender estas bebidas calientes para esta temporada de invierno. De igual manera Ester vende productos de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre, como comida y desayunos. Por otro lado tiene un moto carro el cual alquila, de esa manera no deja de recibir ingresos en estas diversas actividades que realiza. Ester se siente contenta con su trabajo y espera progresar, pues espera brindarle a su familia un futuro mejor. Este su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará maca, quinua, soya, quesos, huevos, harina y demás ingredientes para poder vender desayunos y emoliente, que en esta temporada de invierno la venta es muy buena.
texts.en:
Ester is 40 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her 3 children and her mother, Ema, 60, whom she takes care of and who helps with her work. For several years, she has been selling emoliente ( a drink made from natural herbs) and other hot beverages that she prepares at home. Her point of sale is an hour and a half from her house. She starts selling these hot beverages in the afternoon during the wintertime. She also sells products according to the season, such as food and breakfasts. She also has a three-wheeled car thaht she rents out. This way she doesn't stop getting income from the different activities she does. She feels happy with her job and she hopes to progress and offer her family a better future. This is her third loan with MFP and she has always been punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy maca root, quinoa, soy, eggs, flour and other ingredients to sell breakfasts and emoliente, because at this time, in the winter, sales are very good.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts and hot beverages.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vannak Khun, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice for a living. Beside farming, Mrs. Srey P. is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small revenue to support her family.

For supporting both these businesses, Mrs. Srey P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for her pig-breeding and to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming.

This couple has two children, who are 4 and 7 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed plus fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa L. is from the city of Silanga, Tangub City. She is 58 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like bananas, candies, toothpaste, and more in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Josefa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Reque, un distrito ubicado veinte minutos al sur de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado por mas de quince años a la ganadería, ella cuenta con algunas vacas productoras de leche, las cuales cría en unos corrales situados cerca al lugar en donde vive. Martha extrae la leche junto a su esposo todos los días y luego la venden a una empresa acopiadora de la zona, que a su vez es proveedora de la mayor empresa procesadora de lácteos del país.

Esta actividad le sirve para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, por ello siempre brinda a sus vacas el mejor de los cuidados, de modo que puedan tener una excelente producción. En esta oportunidad ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado para que sus animales puedan seguir produciendo leche, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Lucila es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 44, lives with her husband and their two children in the Reque district. This district is located twenty minutes south of the city of Chiclayo. She has devoted herself to livestock for over 15 years. She has some dairy cows, and she cares for them in corrals close to where she lives. Martha milks the cows with her husband everyday. They then sell the milk to a local amassing company, which is the largest producer of dairy products in the country. This activity serves to help her husband support the family. Therefore, she always gives her cows the best care so that they can have an excellent production. On this occasion she wishes to get balanced feed so that her animals can keep producing milk. That is why she has requested a 2,000 soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan will help her achieve her goal. Lucila is a hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working to help her family get ahead. She has previously worked with our institution. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed to improve production of the dairy cows

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
This is 27 year old Indira T.. She is married and has one child, aged 4.  In 2008, she established her poultry business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy small chickens. In the future, Indira plans to expand her poultry farm. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: God’S Willing Group

texts.en:
Martin D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Willing. He is 38 years old and is married with two children 9 and 13 years old. He also cares for six siblings. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. 

For ten years, Martin has been operating a foreign exchange bureau at Red Light Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Martin plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to add more money to his business. He describes himself as an earnest and hardworking man. His dream is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Aurora Claribel

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio Yoloaquin, departamento D. Morazán, es casada, vive con el esposo y sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 10 y 6 años respectivamente. 
Aurora tiene más D. 6 años D. tener el negocio, tiene una persona que le ayuda a atender el negocio, su jornada laboral inicia a las 5:00 am- 8:00pm la ventaja del negocio es D. que le proporciona los ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. la familia, las desventajas son que ella ampliaría la jornada laboral D. lunes a domingos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. mercadería sabanas, toallas, vajillas D. cocina entre otros. Esto contribuirá a mejorar los ingresos del negocio con mas productos, que le permitan incrementar las ventas.
Los objetivos son cancelar oportunamente el crédito para tener disposición D. efectivo siempre, sus sueños es ver crecer a sus hijos y apoyarlos para terminen los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Aurora is 35 years old and resides in the town of Yoloaquin in the Department of Morazán. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 6 respectively. Aurora has more than six years of experience managing her business. She has one employee who helps look after the store. Her work day starts at 5am and ends at 8pm. Her business provides the income to cover the needs of her family, but the disadvantages are the long hours and having to work Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as bed sheets, towels, cookware, and other products. This will help improve her income by stocking her store with more products so that she can increase her sales. Her goal is to repay this loan in a timely manner so that she can have some cash reserves. She dreams of seeing her children grow up and supporting them until they finish their university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, cookware, and other products

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet R. is from the village of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Juliet is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a sand and gravel business. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for this activity. In 2007, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for sand and gravel business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida A., 44 years old, is a very industrious and diligent mother. She has four children, of which the eldest is 17 years old and a freshman college student, followed by a 13 year old, 10 year old, and the youngest at six years old. Her husband, a fisherman, does the fishing while she either sells the catch at the market, or goes around and sells it to people in their community or in a nearby locality. Her husband is always longing for more fishing gear that he can use to increase the volume of fish he catches, and increase profits as well. He is also planning to put up a fishpond with the next loan. They decided to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. – a partner MFI of KIVA -- in the Philippines to gain access to capital that they can used to buy their needed fishing gear and planned fishpond. She is applying for 5,000 PHP to finance her husband's plan to buy fishing gear and capital for fish vending. They believe that ASHI and KIVA can help them achieved their goal as couple, which is to provide a better living and education for their children.

loans.use: To buy fishing gear and capital for fish vending

loans.name: Aleyda Marynee

texts.es:
Aleyda es una pequeña comerciante que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución. Se dedica al  negocio de la venta de ropa de segunda mano y cosméticos, pues lleva varios años con este negocio, iniciándolo con capital propio y aumentando su capital con Afodenic.

Lo cual para ella ha sido de mucho beneficio para poder apoyar  a sus tres hijos los cuales los tres estudian. Y solo con el dinero que aporta su esposo no da, ya que  la canasta básica esta con costos muy altos.
Con este financiamiento podrá comprar: paca, cosmético para lograr vender más. Y poder pagar lo estipulado del financiamiento en tiempo forma de los plazos.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a small businesswoman who has grown thanks to her tenacity and support from the institution.  She has a business selling second hand clothes and cosmetics.  She has had this business for several years.  She started the business with her own money, and she increased that with a loan from Afodenic.

The loan has been very beneficial for her.  She has been able to support her three children who go to school.  The money her husband contributes is not enough to pay for the very high price of the basic necessities.

With this loan she will be able to buy a bundle of clothes and cosmetics in order to sell more.  She will also be able to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of clothes and cosmetics to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital to buy merchandise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose is thirty years old.  He lives in the village of Mercedes de Pedregal in the district of Tambogrande.  His wife and two minor children share a rustic home in rural part of the region.

Jose has a number of sheep and one cow.  He raises the sheep in order to sell them for their meat and he gets milk from the cow.  In addition to raising animals, Jose manages a small plot of land which the family inherited from their parents.  On the land he raises mangos and limes.  Through these activities Jose works to maintain a stable income stream for his family.

This will be Jose’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He has a good credit history with other institutions.  He plans to invest the funds in the purchase of additional animals and to purchase balanced feed in bulk.  He hopes to be able to continue to improve his family’s lifestyle and to provide for the education of his children

loans.use: Purchase of additional animals and to purchase balanced feed in bulk

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio, tiene una panadería, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes dependen económicamente de él, tiene 30 años de edad,  el proceso de su trabajo es el siguiente, todas las mañanas elabora el pan y por las tardes lo vende, la panadería la tiene en su casa; por el momento solicita un préstamo para la construcción de su propia casa y mudarse ahí junto con la panadería, con esta ayuda el tendrá local propio, no pasara preocupaciones, tendrá a su familia más cómodamente.
Sueña con crecer mucho y montar una gran panadería que abastezca la zona y cuente con muchos clientes, ver a su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: José Antonio is 30 years old and has a bakery. He lives in San Miguel city with his wife and 2 children who depend on him economically. The process of his job is continual, every morning he makes the bread and sells it in the afternoons. The bakery is located in his current house and he is seeking a loan to construct his own home and move together with the bakery - with this nhelp he will have his own space, won't be as worried and his family will be more comfortable. José Antonio dreams of growing his business a lot and establishing a large bakery which supplies the zone and that has many customers, and to see his family live in better conditions.

loans.use: Construct his home

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid T. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. For the last seven years, Enid has run a business selling clothes. She is also a supplier of shower caps.
To help expand her business, Enid has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bridal materials. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Enid hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Enid hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more bridal materials

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn A., 27, is from Proper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dry goods in the local community. Lynn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lynn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP and is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria, tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. El distrito de Poroy se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). 

Hilaria tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella abre la tienda muy temprano para vender sus productos y cierra a aproximadamente a las 9 de la noche. Hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va regular. 
Hilaria espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otra parte del dinero será para uso personal.  

Hilaria pertenece al banco comunal “Mama Simona” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el quinto año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.

Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Hilaria, age 47, lives with her husband and their five children in the Poroy district in the city of Cusco.  The Poroy district is 25 minutes from the Plaza de Armas in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).

Hilaria has a small grocery store in her home.  She opens the store very early in order to sell her products.  She closes the store around nine at night.  She has had this business for several years, and it is steady.

Hilaria hopes to receive a loan for S/.1000 nuevos soles.  She will use it to buy merchandise like rice and sugar.  Part of the money will be for personal use.

Hilaria belongs to the Mama Simona Communal Bank with the UMF (Microfinance Unit) Asociación Arariwa. The community bank has been going for five years and is well run by its board of directors.

Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to Incan times. The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.  Part of the loan will be for personal use.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is a 30-year-old mother of two children. Her children are both in school. Evelyn is engaged in a hog-raising business, which she started seven years ago. Evelyn sells the pigs that she grows. 

She applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use it to acquire vitamins, feed and other needs of her piggery.

She wishes to send her children to college, have a stable business and to be financially capable in the future.

loans.use: To buy for vitamins, feed and other supplies

loans.name: Candide

texts.en:
Candide is 42, married and mother to five children between aged 2 and 15. Jovial and hard-working, Candide and her husband also support 5 additional relatives between aged 10 and 17. Candide's husband is a driver
.
Candide runs a business raising cattle, working every day of the week. She has run this business for 20 years. With her loan, she plans on buying additional cattle, additional equipment and paying her one employee. This is Candide's first loan. With any additional profits realized after her loan, she hopes to expand her business by diversifying into raising chickens and, in the longer-term, build her own home.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle, equipment, and to pay her employee

loans.name: Gerelchuluun

texts.en:
Gerelchuluun, 29, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in Bayanhoshuu of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband is self-employed and her daughter attends a local primary school. She began to sell clothes and other retail goods in 2008 with a working capital of 700,000 MNT. She operates a rented stall and her current working capital exceeds 1,500,000 MNT. 

Gerelchuluun is a hardworking and polite person who says, "I want to expand my business and increase my profit in order to buy land and build a house in the future." She is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angelica G. B. tiene 62 años, es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 8  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la vivienda para los hijos.

Le gusta criar animales en la casa.
texts.en:
Luz Angelica G. B. is 62 years old, married, and lives with her husband and eight children in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Overcome) meet at the fairgrounds of Matilde Esther in the canton of Chillanes. There are twelve members in this Communal Bank, all of whom are devoted to growing cacao and cassava.

Luz is a farmer who grows cacao and cassava. She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the fair in Chillanes on Sundays.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy supplies for growing cacao and cassava. The assistance from this loan will help her financially to acquire what she needs. Her main challenges are pests, diseases, and weather changes. She dreams of remodeling her home for her children.

Luz enjoys raising animals at home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing cacao and cassava.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth O. W. is 27 years old and married. He and his wife have one child, 8 months old, to whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. Kenneth's business is located in Kisumu, a region in Kenya known for fish production and Lake Victoria, commonly known as the lake basin.

Kenneth owns a motorcycle which he uses to provide transportation services to the local people in Kisumu. He has been in this business for three years and says that it is profitable. The major challenges he faces are financial constraints and the unavailability of some spare parts. However, he works very hard to keep his business going well. Kenneth is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy spare parts to have his motorcycle serviced so he can provide better and more efficient customer service. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Marenco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marenco lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marbell del Socorro Téllez Dávila de 25 años quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 3 años inicio con la venta de chinelas luego invirtió en zapatos.
Ella con el crédito comprar mercadería en calzado en especial de temporada.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Patricia Lucia A. E. de 26 años tiene un taller de costura desde hace 4 años y Josefa Leonarda E. de 55 años tiene un taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Marenco group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people.  One of the group's members is 25 year-old Marbell del Socorro Téllez Dávila who has been selling shoes for three years.  She started out selling thongs (flip flops) and then invested in shoes.  She will use her loan to buy footwear, especially seasonal footwear.

The other members of this group are 26 year-old Patricia Lucia A. E. who has had a sewing workshop for four years and 55 year-old Josefa Leonarda E. who also has a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling perfumes. She is 24 years old and married with two children. Only one of them goes to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more perfumes to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a freelance farmer since 2007. He owns diverse farming machinery, equipment, and tractors and there are lots of land owners asking for his skilled services (such as excavation, farming, harvesting etc). Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his agricultural tools in order to offer better services to his clients. He estimates that with the coming years, his profits will increase.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his agricultural equipment

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 37 years old. Sandy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sandy owns & operates a business selling coconuts & green bananas in the local community. Sandy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sandy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sandy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Sandy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Sandy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan has been working in the farming business for a long time in Kompong Cham province. She has good skills planting different kinds of crops on her own land. Mrs. Chan and her husband assist each other in the farm field and make about $3 each day to cover their daily expenses. As she lacks immediate cash to begin to her rice crop, Mrs. Chan would like to request a Kiva loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to protect her crops. She will use the remainder of the loan money to purchase some piglets to feed.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and piglets

loans.name: Jiorgino

texts.es: El señor Jiorgino trabaja realizando botas para damas y entrega por mayor a minoristas para su respectiva comercialización. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: cuero, hebillas, hilos, etc. Vive en casa e alquiler con su señora madre ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  en la ciudad de La Paz  es soltero y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jiorgino works making boots for women that he sells wholesale to retailers for their subsequent resale.  He needs the loan to buy raw materials like: leather, buckles, thread, etc.  

He lives in a rented house with his mother in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is his first loan request through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy boot-making supplies.

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província de mesmo nome ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 24 e 26 anos de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sobrinha enviando dinheiro.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e funcionaria permanente a mais de 15 anos na Direcção de aguas ARA-SUL e tem um salário de 3.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, chapas, e outros)os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt para habitação.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas, o seu sonho e concluir a sua casa para propor melhor conforto a sua familia, e iniciar um negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ines is from the city of Maputo, which is located in province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 2 children who are 24 and 26.  She studied through the sixth grade and stopped because of the lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home wiht her family and also supports her niece by sending her money.

She never left Maputo. She has been a full-time employee at the water management office, "ARA-SUL," for more than 15 years.  She makes 3,500 meticals a month that she puts towards her home's expenses, and she also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is her third loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy construction materials (sand, cement, metals sheets, etc.).  Her previous loans were for 10,000 and 12,000 meticals and went towards her home.

She is confident that she will pay back her loan without any problems.  Her dream is to finish her house to provide her family with better comfort and to start a business, for which she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, metal sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man with two school-going children. He lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past 15 years, Daniel has operated a photography business, moving from door to door, looking for customers. Daniel's major challenge is the high cost of transportation while moving from one place to another. He dreams of expanding his photography business to cover a large area in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a digital camera and a motorcycle to start another business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a digital camera and a motorcycle to start another business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel tiene 56 años esta vive con su pareja la señora Victoria, juntos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que están a su cargo , el señor Angel ya es divorciado lamentablemente se divorcio de su esposa con quien compartió mas de 20 años de casada, el problema fue que su esposa le fue infiel mientras ella trabajaba en el exterior, pero la vida le dio otra oportunidad y volvió a formar una familia ,  Angel vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba , su principal actividad económica es el alquiler de volqueta a una empresa minera , dicha actividad lo realiza personalmente , es su única actividad para el sustento de su familia .
El destino del crédito es la reparación de su volqueta ,  la reparación es en el motor ya que mientras trabajaba tuvo problemas , entre sus sueños y metas esta renovar otra volqueta nueva para seguir trabajando y de esa manera seguir manteniendo a su familia y seguir adelante con su nueva vida dejando atrás aquella mala experiencia que vivio con su anterior mujer.
texts.en:
Angel is 56 years old. He lives with his partner Victoria. Together they have 2 small children who are dependent on him. Angel is divorced; unfortunately, he was divorced from his wife with whom he shared more than 20 years of marriage. The problem was that his wife was unfaithful when she was working abroad. However, life gave him another opportunity and he was able to form a new family. Angel lives in the city of Cochabamba. His main economic activity is renting his truck to a mining company. This is his only activity to support his family. 

The loan will be used to repair his truck. The repair is needed in the motor, because it had problems while it was working. Among his dreams and goals is renovating an additional truck so that he can keep working, and thus keep maintaining his family and getting ahead with his new life, leaving behind the bad experience he went through with his previous wife.

loans.use: to repair his truck's motor.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, 41, is married with three children, who are in school. For 15 years, he has been operating a retail shop. He was previously employed before he went into the business. He has managed to improve his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.
 
Wilson hopes to open a supermarket in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy soda, maize flour, cooking fat and salt.

loans.use: to buy soda, maize flour, cooking fat and salt.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with nine children; eight attend school while one has already graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from the rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her charcoal business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a restaurant business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, and also theft because of lack of security in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her restaurant in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 30,000, Mary wants to purchase food for the restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable lending terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.
