Agripina; la socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 22, 19 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y ella produce todo lo referente a cereales y todo esto lo seca para venderlo como granos, la socia trabaja con trueque en algunos productos, ella lleva lo que produce en su pueblo y trae a casa lo que no puede cultivar como la época de los inkas lleva en una olla de tiesto colmada sus granos de habas, trigo, cebada, entre otros  y le dan maíz amarillo, blanco, morado y otros productos que no siembran en sus comunidad, la socia vende granos en el mercado de Cusco, la socia viaja todos los sábados a primera hora para vender los granos de habas secas, papa deshidratada, moraya, cebada, trigo. La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas para vender.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata Bank, a nice bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in the town called Yuncaypata.  This is a typical little town in which all the pure Andean heritage is preserved and everybody in the community supports each other in the planting and harvesting seasons, taking care of each other's children and animals.  It is a very pretty Quechua-speaking town in the department of Cusco.

Agripina, 45, is married and has three children, ages 23, 22, and 19.  She works in agriculture and produces everything relating to cereals, which she dries to sell as seeds.  She barters for some products, like in the time of the Incas: she takes what she produces in her town and brings home what she cannot grow.  She carries an earthenware pot filled with her bean, wheat, barley, and other seeds, and they give her yellow, white, and purple corn and other products that are not grown in her community.  She sells seeds in the market in Cusco.  She travels there first thing every Saturday morning to sell the seeds of dried beans, dehydrated potato, barley, and wheat.

Agripina wants to use the loan to buy seeds to sell.

She appreciates and values this loan, and is committed to fulfilling her obligation in a disciplined manner, as she has been doing with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sell.

loans.name: G.s. Nagarote Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Nagarote está conformado por Dominga, Patricia y Laura. Ellas son personas responsables y disfrutan de mantener a sus familias por medio de sus negocios. Dominga Dolores se dedica a una pulpería, desde hace mas de 22 años inicio con pocos productos de consumo popular, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitaban variedad de productos Dominga ha mejorado su inventario. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, refrescos, jugos, galletas, sopas, enlatados entre otros.
texts.en:
Dominga, Patricia, and Laura are members of the Nagarote Communal Bank.  They are responsible people, and they enjoy supporting their families through their businesses.

Dominga Dolores has had a store for over 22 years.  She started with a few popular consumable products.  Most of her customers always request a variety of products from her.  Dominga has improved her inventory.

The reason for the loan is to buy basic grains, detergent, soft drinks, juice, cookies, soup, and canned goods, among other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, soft drinks, juice, cookies, soup, and canned goods among other products.

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Family” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. A native of Kenema, the 25-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has two children. Kadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells sugar, beans, chocolates, oil, cooking oil, etc. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, chocolates, oil, cooking oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 47, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, 53, a printing press operator. She is a mother to four children, three are now working and the youngest is in high school. Rosa, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosa owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosa is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries and products that will accommodate the demands of her customers. She believes that having more display of items will definitely attract more customers to buy and it means more profit. She will save her profits for the educational expenses of her children.  

Rosa hopes that her business will grow in order to have a comfortable life. She dreams that her children will continue working and have their own income. She never fails to attend the weekly fellowship* as it gives her time to read and share her understandings and opinions about the word of God. It makes her a better person and Christian. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Olympio

texts.en: Olympio is 45 years old and lives in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City. He is separated and has one child. Olympio owns and operates a business providing transport to local community members for a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase a slightly used motorcycle. Olympio is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Olympio hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a slightly used motorcycle

loans.name: Flor De Colima Huixtepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre flor de colima huixtepec, esta historia es acerca de la señora Rosalva, ya que forma parte de este grupo, cuenta con 26 años de edad y está casada con el señor Raymundo con quien tiene 1 hijo, Ricardo de 8 años de edad esta cursando el segundo año de primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos y también a la elaboración de servilletas desde hacen 5 años.

Doña Rosa (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenía la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y porque no contaba con la solvencia económica suficiente, para la educación de su hijo y para ofrecerle un mejor futuro, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de más insumos como son: aceite, sal, arroz, jitomates, chiles, carne, etc. También hilos, telas, mantas y agujas, para continuar con la elaboración de sus servilletas.
 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que quiere ahorrar para construir un local y poner un pequeño restaurante, puesto que así tendrá una mejor producción y variedad de platillos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, y así seguir apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios y en un futuro pueda terminar una muy buena carrera profesional.

Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder asegurar la educación y futuro de su hijo.

Las personas que integran este grupo y las distintas actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Rosalva-antojitos, Sara-bordadora, Amada-bordadora, Ricarda-bordadora, Adela-bordadora y Carmen-mercería.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor de Colima Huixtepec” and the story is about Rosalva who is part of this group.  She is 26 years old and married to Raymundo; they have an 8-year-old son, Ricardo, who goes to second grade.  She has been selling traditional Mexican fast food snacks and making napkins for five years.

Rosa (like she’s better known in her community) decided to go into this business because she needed to improve her quality of life and because she did not have sufficient economic solvency for her son’s education and to offer him a better future.  She will use the loan to buy more ingredients like oil, salt, rice, tomatoes, chili peppers, meat, etc. and also thread, fabric, muslin and needles to continue making her napkins.

She wants to continue investing in her business because she wants to save up to build a locale to open a small restaurant because that way her production will be larger and she’ll have more variety of dishes to increase sales and profits to continue supporting her son’s education so that in future he will be able to complete a good professional career.

She says that she’s very grateful to Kiva lenders and to FRAC because thanks to them she’s getting ahead and has been able to have a business of her own to insure her son’s education and future.

The people who make up this group and their various activities are as follows:
Rosalva-fast food snacks
Sara-embroidery
Amada- embroidery
Ricarda- embroidery
Adela- embroidery
Carmen-notions

loans.use: to buy oil, salt, rice, tomatoes, chili peppers, meat, etc. and also to buy fabric, muslin, thread and needles to continue making napkins.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella es una muy buena  ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica al comercio, vende productos de plástico como platos, vasos, fundas, entre otros productos hechos en plástico, trabaja todos los días mas que todo en las mañanas ya que a esta hora es más fresco y puede realizar mejor sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva más de dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar platos, sillas, vasos, baldes, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado tanto la institución como sus compañeras. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the La Sequita de Montecristi parish. The canton is known for their famous Panama hats, which are valued inside and outside of the country.

María lives in this area. She is 34 years old and married. She has six children from this relationship. They are 18, 16, 14, 11, 7 and 5 years old. The older ones all study in secondary or primary school. The youngest one is in nursery school. Her husband is a construction worker. 

María is a very good housewife. She earns her own income through her business selling plastic products like plates, vases, covers and other things made out of plastic.  She works every day. She does more work in the mornings because it is cooler at this time and she can cover her routes better.  She delivers her products on credit and collects money every weekend. She has had this business for more than two years and it is going very well. 

This loan will be used to purchase plates, seats, vases, buckets and other things. She has been a member of this communal bank for three cycles. She likes it because of the help given to her and the other members from the institution. 

Her dreams are to continue moving forward and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: purchase plates, seats, vases, buckets, etc.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives together with her husband and three little children.  

She is engaged in agriculture. Due to her hard work and patience, Anahit has increased the number of the cattle she has from four to eight during the past few years. 

Now Anahit plans to develop the farm further. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase livestock and beehives. Development of farming will allow Anahit to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and beehives.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 31-year-old food vendor in Mombasa. She is married .she has been cooking and selling food  for the past five years. 

She was introduced to KADET by another kadet customer and this marks her first borrowing to expand her business. She plans to purchase more maize flour and cooking oil for cooking in her food vending business. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and hopes to realize more profits to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase stock of  maize flour and cooking oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Buvaishi

texts.ru: Бувайши замужем имеет 3 детей. Занимается скотоводством с детства. В их кишлаке работу найти трудно, многие  мужчины и женщины уехали на заработки в другие страны. Поэтому скотоводство и выращивание сельхоз культуры является их основным источником доходом. Опыт  в этом бизнесе 15 лет. Ее муж и братья, как  и все уехали в Россию. Муж получает заработную плату и присылает деньги с России. Бувайши хочет получить кредит на покупку коров. С нашей организацией начала сотрудничать недавно.
texts.en: Buvaishi is married and has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since childhood.  It is difficult to find work in her village, and many men and women left to work in other countries.  This is why animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops became their primary source of income.  Buvaishi has 15 years of experience in this business.  Her husband and brother, like all others, left to go to Russia.  Her husband earns a salary and sends money from Russia.  Buvaishi wants to obtain this loan to purchase cattle.  She has recently began to work with our organization.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 12 children. 

Josefina has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Josefina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is a 29-year-old, married woman. She is married to a businessman. She and her husband have two children who are 7 and 9 years old.

To earn a living, she has been running a salon for the past 11 years.

With the proceeds of the loan she is requesting, she would like to buy more supplies for her salon, including a kettle to heat water, shampoo, and other hair supplies. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans to pay her children's school fees. She dreams of having a very successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her salon (e.g., a kettle, shampoo, and other hair supplies)

loans.name: Sewanou Group

texts.fr: SEWANOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jété Charlotte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Jété Charlotte est mariée à un certain Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jété Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Jété Charlotte et son mari. Pour cette raison, Jété Charlotte vend des produits de mercerie, des chaussures et des tissus à son domicile depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Jété Charlotte s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jété Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SEWANOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures, des tissus et des produits demerceries.

loans.name: Afline

texts.en:
Afline is 29 years, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. She also supports four people in their family. For the past four years Afline has operated a retail shop, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

With her previous loan repaid, Afline has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya for KES 10,000 to buy more retail goods for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her business further.

Afline future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To add stock of retail goods

loans.name: Jlg-002-Aathanur Group

texts.en: The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of 3, led by Veeramani, living in Kulithalai, in the state of Tamil Nadu has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. Veeramani is 47 years old having a family size of 5. She does not have the means to build a toilet. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. Taking matters into their own hands, Veeramani and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of Rs. 42000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Nine years ago, Mrs. Gloria started selling shoes by catalog in order to earn additional income to support her family's expenses. Now, this activity has transformed into the most important one in her family's economy since she separated from her husband (four years ago) and has more expenses to pay for.

Mrs. Gloria also began to prepare “homemade meals” for the people who work near her house and she is well accepted by her clients. She has three children and one of them helps her by taking orders by telephone and delivering meals.

Doña Gloria is asking for a loan of $250 USD to buy shoes as well as raw materials for the meals that she prepares. She will repay the loan in a term of 3-6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

La señora Gloria se inició vendiendo zapatos por catalogo desde hace nueve años con el propósito de poder contar con un ingreso adicional para apoyar los gastos de su familia, sin embargo al pasar el tiempo esta actividad se fue haciendo mas importante dentro de la economía de su familia, ya que desde hace cuatro años esta separada de su esposo y ahora es la cabeza de la familia y tiene que realizar mas gastos. Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos desde hace mas de un año que inicio la elaboración de comidas caseras, ofreciéndolas en las oficinas que se encuentran cerca de su casa y ha tenido muy buena aceptación. Ella tiene tres hijos y uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio, recibiendo los pedidos telefónicos y entregándolos a domicilio.

Doña Gloria solicita un préstamo por $250 USD para destinar una parte para comprar zapatos y la otra para abastecerse de materias primas para las comidas que elabora. Solicita un plazo para pagar de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: to buy shoes and raw materials

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz is 40 year old IDP from armenian occupied Khojavand region. She is now living in Beylagan town. In 2004 she rented a place in the market and started the business of selling women shoes. In 2005 she applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed her first loan in amount of $500. Her next loan was in amount of $800. Loans were invested in business and now she is in need of another loan.

loans.use: To increase the volume of her store sales
